text:
If I could give this place ZERO stars I would.  Some of the worst service, with the rudest management that I have ever encountered.  My wife planned my 40th birthday dinner there with some very close friends.  We were supposed to get a private room, a 4 course meal, a specialized birthday menu, all for a group price.  Instead we got NO private room, a 4 course meal with the WRONG food that we had pre-ordered, TYPOS on the specialized birthday menu, and we were then overcharged.

When I tried to dispute all of this with the manager - BRETT BODE -- he said there was nothing he could do about it except offer to take a few drinks off of our bill.  He was rude, aggressive, and could care less about customer service.  When I tried to dispute the fact that they overcharged us per the contract we signed he blatantly ignored it.  When I said I will contest the charges with my credit card company he threatened to call security in to escort me out.  After spending A LOT of money there for a milestone birthday with some of my closest friends, I can honestly say that this is by far the WORST service and the WORST manager of a restaurant I have EVER encountered.  While the food is okay, the service is poor and the management runs the place like a factory shuffling people in and out.  I caution you HIGHLY before bringing a large group into this restaurant, especially when Brett Bode, the manage is overseeing the place.  The ABSOLUTE WORST. If i could give it 0 stars I would.  They ruined my 40th birthday, and I am sure I'm not the first person they have done that to.  BEWARE.

Had dinner here and it was amazing.  Family size portions so we ordered two entrees for the four of us and it was more than enough.  The portions are enormous.  The rigatoni with sausage and broccoli was delicious.  The sauce was as good as it gets.

We also got the Carmine's salad which was also enormous.  It was a tossed salad with salami, ham, and cheese, oil and vinegar and it was seasoned  perfectly.

We ended up here because we couldn't get in to the restaurant we had planned to dine at even though it was late at night.  This was a great find and we will surely be back again next time we are in Vegas.  They also have a few other locations in various parts of the country.
Ceaser's salad was super salty, pasta and shrimp dish had no taste. Huge portions, no taste.
Authentic Italian food. Tasted just like the one in NYC. Would highly recommend this spot.

The staff is great and attentive.
Unfortunately, the food is marginal.
Very oily greasy Italian food.
I can't say I would eat there again.
Service is great though.
Place was probably legit before it became a chain. Poor quality food, huge portions but not good.

Went in for a quick bite ordered the veal on a bun (even though wasn't on the menu) they accommodated us! They asked us what we ordered several times@! Nevertheless they got it right and it was amazing! Oh they also comp'd the order for taking so long which was a nice gesture! Would definitely recommend!

I'll give it a 4 only cause I can't do 31/2. Its good food. Huge portions. Good service, very attentive staff while we were there. Their wing appetizer was good if you like rosemary which we do. The main entree was OK but my teens didn't eat and they usually aren't picky.

The prices are high, three entrees and drinks for 150.00. They did remove the main entree because we didn't want to take leftovers home. That brought price to 125.00.

I am a Las Vegan and it was my first time there. With a business group with high profile foodies. Let me say I felt like I was in the Best Old School Restaurant in NYC let alone one of the very best Italian Family Eateries ever. The atmosphere is dynamic, exciting and energizing just like the staff from the front desk to the bar to the table. There was eight in our party drinks, bread and fast appetizers in a NY Minute. The server was fun, engaging and attentive even the floor manager brought refills and made the evening wonderful. To top all this not a empty seat in the House. From 8 pm to closing the food, drinks and attention was nonstop. OH YES THE FOOD...." Forget about it............sooooo very good.....Family Style great.....a authentic feast....in every way."  Carmine's is a special place worth you making it the place for a milestone occasion or a very hot date.   Tom

Food is exceptional. But how does a restaurant offer only 1/20th of their menu to parties of two? How do they basically eliminate that customer base? They have the food. They have the table space. But still refuse to offer their complete menu to parties of two, with appropriate portions. So so disappointed. With all the top quality Italian restaurants now in LV, I have to wonder how this decision still holds up. We didn't eat there, solely based on the fact that leftovers would go to waste. Thoughts Carmine's?

A Las Vegas location of the NYC Carmine's!  Huge portions of perfectly executed Italian classics.  It's family style dining.  Classic upscale Italian decor.  The porterhouse steak, with a mixed green salad was enough food for 6, American adults!  Check with your server before making your final order.
Excellent food, superb service, and a great place to celebrate birthdays. I especially want to thank Michael Baker for making it a memorable 50th b-day dinner for my father.
Caesar salad was great. Everything else was ok. Wait staff is excellent. Disappointed in the food. Rigatoni ala vodka was bland. Chicken parm was very salty.

Randomly chose this in a pinch. The service was ok, the restaurant had a lot of workers, but the water took a while. The food was fast, tasted good. The bread was ice cold, I thought it was just one piece and then I tried another and all were ice cold. Would not try again. Experience was meh.

Wasn't overly thrilled with this spot. The best thing they have going for them is the eggplant rollatini at happy hour. Well priced and very good! Sauce is light and the eggplant is lightly breaded. 

The mussels are HUGE almost not edible and the white wine broth is sub par. I typically enjoy dipping with bread and that wasn't even enjoyable. 

We sat at the bar and the bartender seemed rushed even though it wasn't super busy. He messed up our bill, bar was sticky seemed like it had been a while since it was cleaned. I did enjoy their Carmines Pinot Grigio! Well priced. 

I might return for the eggplant and vino!

They prefer to keep their tables empty all evening anticipating phone reservations to show up. Stopped by at 3 PM and were turned away, we went to Trevi and had dinner and walked by after we finished little before 6 PM, I saw 7-8 tables empty by the outside. One would wonder why some food businesses complain about lack of revenue and later shutter their doors.

We have ordered their Thanksgiving to Go for the past two years. Last year I would have given 3 stars because I didn't feel it was enough food compared to other options like Lawry's or the M. The food was so much better at Carmine's we decided to give it another try...we just ordered additional sides...they did not disappoint. Food was great and everyone went home with leftovers. The 5 stars is because of Stephanie in catering. Her service was excellent and she is the reason we went back a second year and will be returning for a third. Thank you for going out of your way to make sure everything was right Stephanie!

Staff-wonderful, knowledgeable about the menu, attentive & good teamwork 
Environment- Italian singer, not too loud, sat at the bar which had sports on tv but was also a nice dining experience 
Food-yum, large portions, had the chicken saltimbocca with angel hair pasta which was delicious, the sauce was perfect 
Would definitely recommended!

Came here during Happy Hour after a long treacherous walk on the Strip and needed a leg break. Came in by accident and never read the reviews. We sat in the bar for Happy Hours and the portions were more than enough for two hungry girls. The restaurant is family style serving and portions are big so make sure you order concisely.
+=Must try the mussels, listed as an App, which were very soft and melts in your mouth. The sauce was great for dipping bread as well. Portions at Happy Hour were still very generous even for just two people to split.  The appetizers of Calamari rings were also scrumptious!
-=hidden inside Caesar's Palace, quite a ways to walk to get there.

The service is good.  The food is good.  Price is a little on the steep size probably because of the portion size.  This reminds me of Buca Di Peppo.  I gave it four stars because we were sat near the server's prep area.  This caused a lot of bumps from traffic.  There was a lot of tables open.  Other than that the food is good.  Salad was good.  I recommend the butter lemon chicken.

I disagree with anyone who complains about high prices.  You get a HUGE portion of food for what you pay for.  I actually made a comment when we got the bill, that this was the best meal we had in Vegas and also the cheapest. I think the spaghetti and meatballs were excellent.  I loved it, and the huge plate was only $34.  There were 2 of us, that ate ourselves into a food coma and we still took a good portion home.  Nowhere else in Vegas can you get that much food for $34.  Granted, my girlfriend also ordered tiramisu and forgetting it was family style, he ended up bringing the entire pie, which was $25.  That was our fault.  So we took that to go to, but she loved it.  I think by far this place is the best value taking into account the price and quality of food.  It's a real Italian hearty restaurant.  I will definitely eat there again.
Nice. Good food. Italian on US style. Good service. We will come back. In the shopping area of Ceasar palace
Food sucked !!!!  Overpriced   What a let down!! Don't eat there. Meatballs with spaghetti.
Go hungry! Huge portions, tasty and service was amazing. Our waiter looked just like Zack Galafanakas and gave us amazing suggestions. We will definitely return. Priced reasonably.
First time here and loved it!! Michael Baker was our waiter and was awesome. Really was helpful on selecting our dinner

We have eaten here about 10 times already. Taken big groups with us each time knowing how much food we always get and the high quality of food. Until last night when we were very disappointed. We order the calamari , broccoli and the LOBSTER FRA DIABLO. the price on the menu was set to MP which means they can charge whatever they feel like. Too many possibilities with that but we accepted it. When the meal arrived it looked to be amazing and very promising. See pictures. But once we started to dig into it we found that for $139.95 we have very little Lobster and looked to us like the tail of the lobster was cut off and we had only been provided literally the tail end of the tail where most of the lobster meat resides. For the amount of meat we received this was very grossly misleading especially with the cost. There were no where close to enough clams and muscles. Overall I have to say this was a a HUGE disappointment to us all. 

That will be the last time I can tell you we come here and pay over $260 for dinner and feel like we got raped.!!!  Buyer beware. !!!
My family had a great experience and loved the food.  I've eaten at the DC and NYC locations and they're all great.

This restaurant is in Caesar's Hotel shops and malls. We have dined previously at Carmine's in NYC so we know they serve more food than we can consume. We did not know they serve smaller dishes if you sit at a high top in the bar area. My wife and I split a "smaller" order of spaghetti and meat balls with a (huge) side of fried zucchini. The service was great, the place was hopping, and we didn't spend a fortune.

We had the sausage on Angel hair pasta, Carmines salad and the eggplant rollatini in the bar area. Our food came out in a timely manner and the team service was great. Everyone treated us great front the minute we stepped up to the hostess stand.

Just like the one in nyc.  The food was amazing and the service was on point.  This is a place to order food to share.  We got calamari, baked clams, linguine With clams and shrimp scampi.  All yummy!

The food and service was impeccable! We had the house salad, and shared the angel hair pomodoro. Everything was cooked perfectly! I would only hope that they might think about offering a couples portion because we had so much food left over and felt bad because we couldn't even finish half of it. Absolutely delicious though

Absolutely unprofessional and appalling service. Went Saturday night with my boyfriend and 7 of his guy friends for their bachelor party. I arrived late after they ordered, which is no big deal but we didn't get our food for an hour and 15 minutes. RIDICULOUS!!!!!!!! Which, I get ticket times can get out of hand, but come up to the table and apologize at least. We asked our server for the manager, a 30ish year old black man who came to the table and didn't say sorry at all but decided to cast the blame on me because I apparently wanted all the food to come out at once. Excuse me, I wasn't even present when they ordered! And he preceded to embarrass me in front of all these men I just met. Needless to say, I was shocked but I pulled him aside to tell him how patronizing and belittling he made me feel and set him straight that I wasn't even there when they ordered so his lame excuse as to why our food took forever wasn't even accurate and was a bit pathetic to blame the only girl at the table-- sexist. 

Anyways, he told our table he would take care of some of the bill. We ate the mediocre and cold food and waited for the bill, which the host gave us. We realized nothing was taken off as previously promised. Upset, we asked for the manager again to discuss the matter and the host proceeded to call security on us. So uncalled for and rude. I will NEVER eat there again, and all of us agree that this place is utterly terrible and completely unprofessional. I hope they shut down because there are so many better places to eat in Las Vegas who actually know how to give customer service! Stay away, far away!

P.S. All the guys were mad they didn't have alfredo sauce... And they're an Italian restaurant.... Unheard of!

Enjoyed our meal at Carmine's. Good for a large group of people.  Portions were very large (one dish feeds 4-6 people) and service was great. Byanka was wonderful. We ordered:

Caesar Salad
Calamari
Bolognese Meat Sauce
Penne Alla Vodka
Shrimp Fra Diavolo
Angel Hair Marinara with Meatballs
Cannoli
Cheesecake

The penne and calamari were the best options. Shrimp Fra Diavolo was my least favorite.

Definitely get the cheesecake. The cannoli left something to be desired. It was coated in chocolate and sprinkled with pistachios.

Located in the Forum shops in Caesar's.  Average dish price:  $35

Had a great experience here. Walked in during a holiday weekend with no reservation and a party of 14. We were greeted warmly and got seated right away with no wait! Our server Joey was kind and accommodating even though we had 5 kids with us and were constantly getting up to attend to one of them. Love the family style meals, as this suits our family perfectly. We ordered fried calamari and Caesar salad for apps, prime rib chops special and rigatoni sausage and broccoli country style for entrees, and tiramisu. I also got a red sangria. Despite dishes being so large, we did not wait long for food, a couple of people in our party waited a while for drinks. None of the food disappointed. My mom seemed to have a great birthday meal. The only thing I would recommend for them is to put bigger lady fingers in their tiramisu and to not let people stand near other people's tables to look at the menu.

So to start, the ambience of the restaurant is lovely. This place is HUGE, so the large portions and ample seating is great for parties. Our waitress was a little spacey, and I would say her performance was a little less than average. We started with drinks, and she definitely poured my sister's Hoegaarden poorly, but I guess it's not too big of a deal. The bread basket given contains a mini variety, but unfortunately both baskets had really cold bread. Some were topped with cheese, so it would've been nice to have had it warmed at least instead of it feeling like it came from the fridge. We ordered Carmine's salad ($22.95), mix seafood pasta (I forgot, sorry!), and chicken parmigiana ($34.95). The salad was good, and the portion was more than enough for our party of 7. I was really disappointed with our main dishes. Both the seafood and the chicken were just extremely bland and dry. We ordered our pasta with white sauce (choice of red and white), but it was just flavorless! I really expected more. Even the chicken parmigiana was tasteless. 

Overall - I miiiight give this place another chance, but it's not likely. It might have been the food we ordered, but I was not impressed at all with our dinner. I would rate it 2.5 stars if I could.
If in Vegas and from MIDWEST to the west coast there's not much family Italian that tips this place. Coming from the northeast, it's simply good. For Vegas, it's great.

As a local, this place is worth the trip down to the Strip. Great food and service. Don't let the high prices scare you away. Each dish serves from 4 to 6 people, making it a good value. Give it a try.

It doesn't get more authentic than this. Taste just like my grandmothers cooking. I've been to the one in New York and the one here in Vegas is identical. So glad Vegas brought on Carmine's. This is a family style restaurant, bring your appetites or order the food at happy hour for smaller portions. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Oh, and the cocktails and beer are amazing too.

This was a great experience. If you're after pasta this place is highly recommended. Walked passed the place and stopped and went back when we saw the waiter serve one of the tables facing towards us. Nice basket of different bread as an appetizer. Love the one with tomato filling on top. 

We had the meatballs with angel hair pasta for lunch. It was really good. Perfectly cooked pasta, juicy and tasty meatballs and a really tasty sauce with fresh herbs.

Friendly staff, good service, not to pushy.

Oh my goodness! Excellent food and even better service. All of the staff are wonderful and helpful but i would like to single out our server, Anthony Fabiano! Always there when we needed him! I couldn't ask for more! Well done Anthony and the rest of the Carmine's team! An extremely enjoyable experience.

Booked a table for 1 through Opentable. When I got there, I was told they would seat me at the bar because the tables were reserved for family style dinner and the portions are designed for sharing food. Ridiculous argument. If I book a table through Opentable, I expect a table, not a barstool.

Went here with a friend and we were treated poorly.  I felt ignored and when our waiter was with us, I felt that he didn't want us there.  Only ordered a salad to share and a glass of wine because the waiter made us uncomfortable.  The portions are too large for 2 petite women to share.

We had walked by Carmine's the day before and decided to give it a try. It is a family style restaurant. The portion are large enough for 3-4 people. We had the fried calamari and garlic bread parmigiana for appetizers, both were excellent. Our main course was chicken parmigiana with pasta which was very good. We had no room for desert. The waitress and staff were very friendly and attentive.

On November 11, we held a post-wedding ceremony dinner at Carmine's located in The Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. We are so happy to say that the evening went perfectly. We worked with Jose Saenz to coordinate for approximately 105 guests who had traveled from Ohio, Michigan and several other states to Las Vegas for our wedding ceremony, and he worked very diligently to ensure every detail was perfect. We reserved the Centrale semi-private dining area, and although it was not fully private, the staff had it arranged in a way that it was not noticeable that other guests were dining in the restaurant. With such a large group in Las Vegas for our "destination" wedding, we first contacted Carmine's about two months before our wedding day and were able to coordinate all of the details with Jose in advance. Everything went off without a hitch!

Not only did Jose work extremely hard to make sure all of our requests were fulfilled, the staff working our dinner event was extremely courteous, patient and kind. The best part: the food was DELICIOUS. Our guests loved the menu selections and we can confidently say that everyone left dinner full and happy that evening! We appreciate Jose's patience and hard work to ensure our evening was full of fun for our guests. We will definitely return to Carmine's whenever we have the opportunity to visit Las Vegas and look forward to checking out their other locations as well.

Came here with my husband, so we only ordered 1 item from the menu (spaghetti and meatballs), since we knew the portions would be huge. I really was not impressed with the food but then again we only tried 1 thing. I guess you come for the "italian family style" experience so I would only return with a large group. We had enough leftover for 2 more meals. Which was not bad since we paid about $35.

They do bring out a basket of bread that was pretty good. The basket had different types of bread some which were new to me.

Nice place BUT the food is regular, not good. Just like Olive Garden kind of food. 
Not worth the price at all.

Ugh. Was so looking forward to some manicotti. And was so disappointed in this place. Got served cold bread.  And it was several types of good bread- sourdough, cheesy, etc. But it was COLD. Like it came out of the fridge. Ugh. We should have left then. Then our meal came. We got the  4 pasta platter since it had manicotti on it. I was served manicotti and guess what? It was cold. Ugh. Other stuff was warm. Waitress came over and I sent manicotti back. We were given some comp wine and a small discount which was nice but the meal was a huge disappointment. Don't recommend. Won't ever go back.
The best Italian ever! I ordered Caprese salad which is not on the menu and it was amazing! I also had the Shrimp da Viagioli...it was so spicy and delicious!! The plates are enormous family style!

Dined here a couple days ago and it was AMAZING. We didn't quite get what family style meant so im glad our server talked us into agreeing on one dish. One of the managers im guessing, Dani stopped by our table to check on us and make sure everything was going well, she suggested cannolis for dessert but we were way to stuffed!

I've been to the New York location and now the Vegas location. We came here for a bachelorette party. We were starving and ordered a ton of dishes- the Italian salad, the Caesar salad, the lasagna, calamari, pasta with shrimp, penne pasta, lemon chicken, and spaghetti and meatballs. It was a lot of food for 13 girls. My advice is to ask the waiter or waitress what's recommended for your party. We couldn't finish our meals and were really not OK with wasting the food. All in all great spread, but huge portions. Remember it's family style.

Excellent service, food, wine, and atmosphere for a reasonable price. Chances are high that you will over-order and will not be upset about it.

Highly recommend "The Titanic" for dessert if you have a few people and some room left. You won't be disappointed.
A taste of NY in Vegas. Very welcome. Family style so take like-minded people with you as every entree serves at least 4. Love it.
True Italian food at its best. Feel like your in the movies is place. We will be returning next trip. Some best food I have ever had...
Nice Italian atmosphere, delicious meal and large portions..   Bring the troops, with their appetite.

Food is better than average but the service is what gets them to 5 stars.  Our waiter did a great job with our table of 8.  He gave us some history of the restaurant, Italian cuisine in general and vegas restaurants.  Food is served family style.

We had a wonderful time at Carmine's in Las Vegas. We were in town for the Rock N Roll Las Vegas Marathon and this was our pre-race carb-loading meal. We were a party of 8 and were seated and attended to very quickly. The food was amazing and even though we ordered only 3 dishes, with 8 of us, there were leftovers! However, we did find room for dessert. The Titanic requires some skill to plate, but is worth every bite. Service was wonderful, the cocktails were well made, dinner was delicious and dessert was divine! We will be returning!
The service here was terrible. Our server was incredibly rude during the entire meal. Probably the worst service I've had from a restaurant in a while. The food is very salty and drowned in sauce.

The bar tenders were absolutely amazing and good looking. One was a gentleman that looks like Jason stathom, another like Alexander scarsgard. And a beautiful woman with silky hair and great skin tone. All three were so hospitable as well. Constantly checking in on us and filling our drinks.

The food was so good. We had the calamari and the penned alla vodka. Highly recommend.

I made a last minute reservation for 12 at 9:45 for a 10pm dinner. By the time our group had walked from the hotel we were at to the restaurant, we had a great table set and ready for us thanks to opentable. Our host was very accommodating and knowledgeable about the menu an places in general; it was like having a concierge at dinner. What was also nice is we had a strict vegan within our group and they were incredibly kind to go out of their way and make sure everything could suit her needs. Large portions, good wine, and moderately priced food. I think our total was $250. The food was very good, too.

The food and service is great. We had the Eggplant Parmigiana and it was the best I've ever tasted. It comes thinly sliced in a meatloaf like form. I'll be back with a bigger group next time and indulge in more of items on the menu.

My husband and I came here in November 2014 to re-visit one year before we had our wedding rehearsal dinner there. It was a great experience so we wanted to come back and load up on carbs before our half marathon. My husband is gluten free. They have choices for the allergy. We had a bolognese with gluten free noodles and a salad to begin with. These are huge portions but that didn't stop us to try and stuff ourselves of food. It's a great atmosphere and we had excellent service again!!

Went here with my wife, we have been to the one in New York so this was our first time at the Vegas location. The drinks were amazing and of course the food also the food here comes in large portions so it is enough for four people. I will definitely be coming back here

I am a Vegas local and brought my family here tonight to enjoy a restaurant that can cater to such a large group. 

From the beginning the service wasn't good. The two hostesses greeted us, took our names, & was informed that we had reservations (@ 7:28 pm). After giving our names she gestured for us to wait & told us our reservation wasn't till 7:30 pm & that's when we would be seated. At 7:35 after making eye contact with a member of my party she quickly stopped the "important" conversation she was having with her co-worker to let us know we can be seated. 

Then the server, (I am really hoping she was just having a bad day), quickly greeted us and rushed us through our drink order. That's what our whole experience was...it felt like it was a hassle for us to be served. Our table consisted of 11 people, 4 being adults and the rest all children under the age of 10. So from the beginning she already had the "oh great" mentality. Thankfully our children were very obedient tonight (from what the surrounding tables told us) so she didn't have to do much. But still managed to make us scared to ask for a refill! 

But what really killed it for me was being sat near the kitchen and having the doors be see-thru. A man (who I found out was Andy, the manager), reached into a plate of what looked like fried calamari, and took one which he tried to toss it into his mouth, missed, and had it drop... onto the floor!!! He then picked it up and put it back on the plate! I gasped and looked to my husband, he witnessed it as well. I brought it to the other adults attention and they looked on as he took another piece and placed it his mouth right before the server brought it out. After losing our appetites we quickly had our dishes boxed and handed over our money to quickly get out of there. And if you are wondering, yes I still did tip a minimum of 20%

When leaving I went up to the three hostesses (1 male, 2 females) asked the managers name & begin to walk away when the girl in my party called me back. I noticed the hostesses looking at me. They asked me why I asked who he was, after telling them what we saw, they responded in unison," okayyyyy!!!So what do you want?" I turned and left. And that is how my horrible dinner at Carmine's was. So, if you want an over priced, very salty, lack of professionalism, possible dinner off the floor experience Carmine's the place to go.
One of my fav spots in Los Vegas! You could never go wrong with the spaghetti meatball! Portions are family style so $100 took care of 6 people!!
Couples beware. My husband and I went on a date and were told it was family style. However, we weren't told the sizes were for 4 people. So much food was wasted, not to mention paying twice as much.

Carmine's is one of my favorite restaurants, and I would love to give it a 5-star. 

I've been before, and will probably go again. However, my experience on Christmas was completely terrible. I took my parents there for Christmas dinner. We of course waited for a table. While waiting, we got drinks at the bar, and had a nice time.

We were then seated at our table. It was obviously very busy so I didn't expect extremely fast service. However, after 10-15 minutes went buy without acknowledgment, we started getting a little bit irritated. Wanting to ensure a good mood for Christmas, I just played it off that they were busy. 

After 30 minutes of not being acknowledged even once, I excused myself and told someone that we had been sitting for 30 minutes without so much as a "hello" or water. Another five minutes passed before someone came to our table. Following that, they were extremely attentive. The manager ended up comping our drinks for the dinner, and we left somewhat satisfied. 

It's not the fact that there was a wait on Christmas, which I would totally understand. It's the fact that we were seated and no one had any idea until I told them about it 30 minutes later. That seems like an extreme lack of organizational skills.

All of that being said, the food here is consistent and delicious. If it were not for the service, I would have absolutely rated it a five. The atmosphere is classy and comfortable, the drinks are good, and the food is better.

This has been a bookmarked place to try for the longest time and sadly we finally tried it and not a fan of it. Service was great but food was mediocre. Calarmari was a bit over cooked. Meatballs had a bitter after taste and the clam linguine was a bit under seasoned. Sorry to say but there are better Italian places.

Our first choice was to go to Il Mulino but their dress code turned us off and Carmine's seemed more our style -- casual but a quality experience. And we were happy we made the switch. First off, our service was exceptional. The waiter was friendly and super helpful.

Since Carmine's is family style we were quite pleased we hadn't eaten all day and were ready to eat for 2 (each)! And we did. We went a classic spaghetti and meatballs, as well as as a Chicken Piccata. Both were delicious. Both were delicious, we were stuffed, and still able to take some leftovers back to our room -- which we needed to soak up the remaining wine they packed up for us from our oversized bottle. 

The waiter also brought us complimentary after-dinner drinks that were an unexpected surprise. Definitely worth the trip!

Disappointing service and food was below average.  Stopped here because I have the cookbook and I like the recipes. There were less than 10 people in restaurant and food was slow. It was a late lunch. Beef Bolognese tasted like some had burnt on the bottom of pan. Also did not seem like it was cooked low and slow.  Bread was ice cold and not good.   I would not go back.
My husband and i went here for dinner. The portions are enough for eight people. Our meal was awesome, service was great! I would highly recommend Carmine's for a large group or family gathering!!

My sister had her wedding reception here. The food was phenomenal  (the best food i have EVER eaten at a wedding reception!)! The service my family and I received was impeccable. Mr. Michael Baker was our main server and, wow, you just don't come across a personality like his just anywhere! What a wonderful  experience! The highest recommendation!

Great service.
Fun, lively atmosphere.
Food was cooked perfectly and it's definitely family style / shareable.
We would return.
Food was good but a bit heavy on the garlic in every dish for me.  Enjoyed the family style service.   The chocolate torta is THE reason to go again.
Did not disappoint. Service was outstanding and the food was amazing. Get the baked clams... so delicious.
Food was great, enormous portions so don't go just for 1 person. Larger the family the better. Service excellent as well. The special (pollo alla Romano) was a bit pricey but well worth it.
Great place to take the family. Portions are big and can be shared. At least 1 order of any item can feed 3 adults. Good energy in the dining room. Wait staff was great also

Wow! Great food in large quantities. I went with aa party of 8. We had two salads, two chicken dishes, lasagna and the garlic and oil pasta. It was all amazing. I would definitely come back but this place is definitely meant for a decent sized party.

So I need to write a follow up review that is long overdue since my first visit back in 2013. I was back here in May of 2016 and not because I wanted to, but because I had clients that happened to enjoy this restaurant because their children love the calamari here. 

I didn't interact too much with the hostesses because my party was already sitting down.  I can tell I was dealing with a whole new group of host and hostesses! This was already a plus since I had an issue with their attitude. And this was just by them greeting and welcoming me in the restaurant! 

I was quite impressed with our waitress; very attentive and was always checking up on us. The drinks were generous pours (I was drinking whiskey on the rocks) and my clients were having wine.  The kids loved the calamari and the food was good!  I only had one calamari tentacle and one bite of the lasagna.  I was not hungry at all that evening but I can tell from one amuse bouche size bite was sufficient enough for me to count it as an okay place to come.  The food however is heavily catered to an American palette.  

I would love to give this property five stars just for the service that I got from this specific waitress, however I use this place for catering during the holidays and I can't seem to shake off the inconsistency in miscommunication when ordering via email or phone. However, great improvement since they opened.

I hosted my wedding dinner at Carmines and can not say enough great things about them!! The service was excellent, food was delicious and our private room overlooking the strip was awesome.  We were even serenaded by one of waiters!! Highly, highly recommend this place for weddings and/or group dinners.  Thank you guys for making my wedding dinner so memorable!!

We were lucky enough to book our wedding reception at Carmine's and received service beyond or best hope or expectation. It started with the excellent communication during the planning process with Sabrina who went out of her way to make our day special. She made sure that every question was answered and every little detail was taken care of. Kudos Sabrina you are an asset to Carmine's. On the day of our event we arrived and were immediately introduced to our head waiter, server and comedian extraordinaire. First he started in the most professional manner making sure that all our guests were taken care of and as the afternoon unfolded and he became more comfortable with us he was a total joy to be around. He laughed with us, danced with us and sang with us as the celebration was a total success. By the time we left Michael was a friend and not our waiter. Michael we are deeply grateful and honored to have had you work with us. Carmine's is the place to enjoy a celebration in Las Vegas and you will not be disappointed with anything they do. You can turn your special day over to them and from that point forward your party is one thing you will not have to worry about. They are all about service with a smile at a reasonable price. 
And the food is incredibly delicious. If any of your guests walk away hungry it's not because of your decision to call Carmine's Las Vegas. We can't say enough about the service the food and the all around atmosphere. We gave them 5 stars only because yelp won't let us give 10 !!!!!!

Second time here and I absolutely love this place. Family style restaurant with large portions to prove it. I swear one plate feeds two or three and we know how to eat... start off with some amazing bread a little bottle of wine and topped it off with some veil and lasagne!  Carl was super nice and suggested our  salad which was delicious! I will definitely come again! 0

I couldn't have been more pleased with our experience at Carmine's!  We chose to have a private party of 40 for my mom's 80th birthday.

To start, Cassie Bagnall, the Senior Special Events Manager, was amazing to work with. 

The room was set up warmly, with a veranda that had a nice view of the city. 

The service was amazing and the food was delicious, plentiful and well timed out is separate courses.  Servers were right there to take drink orders.

Everything was great!!  Highly recommend.

Had a fantastic meal tonight. The waitress was one of the best I've ever had and I eat out frequently. I'm normally not a desert eater but 3 of our party shared the bread pudding. The waitress asked why I didn't want any and I told her the only desert I ever eat are peanut M&M's and she went back and couldn't find any but came back with mini twice bars. I'm a firm believer in service making the difference between a good meal versus a great meal and the service shown at this restaurant was top notch.

Food and service were excellent.
Ambiance was great.  Portion sizes are large and should be split.  Everything we had was delicious.  Cannot wait to check out another location.
It really is not a place for a couple to visit. Family style is great, but it wasteful to serve ridiculous amounts of food to a couple. Caesar salad for two for $26 is an outrage.

Fabulous meal little too loud at times however we were there celebrating my father's 80th birthday and Michael Baker was unbelievable absolutely made the experience unforgettable with his singing in Italian Happy Birthday and then singing to my parents  can't thank him enough it was great!

Stopped by on a Sunday night, close to closing time (big mistake) ... Waiter seemed annoyed, we ordered penne Bolognese ... They brought bread ... Chucked it on the table as they walked by ... Went to the bar and asked for balsamic vinegar and olive oil ... Annoyed waiter brought it to us without a plate to put it on ... Got the pasta ... No mention of parmesan ... No mention of drinks or wine ... Went back to the bar ... Couldn't get anybody's attention ... Finally asked for two house reds and parmesan ... Nobody checked in on our dinner ... WTF?!  Girlfriend's birthday dinner, and this is how they roll? Zero tip.

My daughter went to Carmines for her 21st Birthday and they had a fantastic meal. The food and upscale location is one of the best in Las Vegas.

The restaurant made a mistake and did not serve the Birthday cake we had ordered and delivered from a local bakery. Carmines could not find the cake and this was disappointing because of the 21st Birthday of my daughter. I had one of the managers from Carmines call me in Colorado. Stefanie one of Carmines managers was a real pro and made the situation all good. It is not that people make mistakes it is how you handle the problem and Carmines knows how to run a business. We will be back for many years to come.
Huge portions, family style dining. Caesars salad and the muscles were great. Also had the chicken Parmesan and the bolognese which was a bit watery.

Good flavors, huge portions, had family of 6 and could not do 3 dishes.  Decent value, mixed seafood pasta $50 that had tons of fresh seafood including a whole lobster.  Kids killed the lobster, dad gets squid.  Kitchen a little slow to get plates out.  Server was busy flirting with hostess but kids liked him so I could not deny decent tip.

Great place to have dinner with friends. Casual atmosphere and awesome food. The seafood pasta was spectacular. The Cesar salad was also excellent. Come with a big appetite and order the Titanic dessert. It will make your evening!!

I first ate at Carmine's in the Bahamas and it was life changing. I never knew Manicotti could taste like that! Then I found out there was one here in Vegas. I wasted no time in making a reservation for me and 4 close friends. The food was incredible! We had the artichoke appetizer, Penne a la Vodka and Manicotti. So much food! If there were any drawbacks, it was the manicotti. It needed more sauce and more cheese on top, then it would be perfect! I will be returning!

Stumbled upon this restaurant while doing some shopping at The Forum shops. Kids were hungry so we have it a try. The Ragu with Rigatoni was so good. Don't think I've ever had a meatball so tender and tasty. Portions are huge and an app and an entree could easily feed 4-5 adults. Our Server (Jeff) was very helpful and knowledgable with great suggestions. The whole staff from server assistants to management were very friendly and always there to answer any questions. Highly recommend this place.

Went here with my family and we all got food poisoning and we all ended up going to the hospital. It was awful. We will never come here again and the place was packed, so I know that there must have been others that got sick too, just not us!  We all ate the same thing, so that's how we know it was from here and the domino effect started quickly for each one of us after eating here. Not a good memory for us!  (i had to give it a one star cause it won't let you post review if you don't)

Eating dinner at your Las Vegas location last night (7:45 reservation made through OpenTable.com) we were subjected to your employee "Edward," who proceeded to become the most insulting, inappropriate and simply slimy person I have been unfortunate enough to come in contact with. When he took over our table mid-meal, we were greatly enjoying our experience. The hostess and first waitress we had were excellent, and this in no way reflects their performance. Upon being passed off to Edward things seemed to be light and fun, however his inappropriate comments and actions progressed from somewhat uncomfortable and bizarre to outright vulgar and insulting by the end of the evening, to a point where my wife was in tears both later on in the evening and still this morning. His comments ranged from talking about his "mediterranean penis size" to personal attacks on two of my friends hair lines, to basically giving another friends wife a lap dance in the middle of the restaurant, each time guised in jest yet very contemptuous. I can not even begin to convey my infuriation at this manner and still, after an evening of "cooling off," only find this situation to be more unacceptable. It was insulting to my party, disrespectful to both the women and their husbands, and embarrassing to myself as the host of this evening. Never before have I had such a negative experience in a restaurant, and I am sorry it had to happen at yours.

We came here for happy hour and boy was it good! With 104 degree weather Peronis for $5.00 sounded so good;) I was surprised to get a tall glass of Peronis for that price on the Strip.  Nice atmosphere and pleasant waiter!! Food was delicious!  My hubby got the Calamari and I got the raw shelled clams.  Portion are huge!  Although I am not a bread eater, their bread basket had an assortment  of Italian and it looked yummy! Will be returning!
Omg this place is the best my husband and I went there tonight its family style plates that means one plate of food is enough for 4 and everything was cooked to perfection bit pricey

How's the food?  Couldn't tell you because it never came out of the kitchen.  We stopped here in July to get some appetizers.  We came in after 9:00 PM and the place was not busy.  After being seated, our waiter pretty much forgot about us because it was about 30 minutes before someone else came by to take our drink orders.  We ordered our food at the same time and, just as we were ordering, our original waiter came back to the table to take over.  We told both waiters that we wanted the portabello mushroom appetizer (they have two mushroom appetizers, the other is stuffed caps).  They both went away and the original waiter came back again to confirm which mushroom appetizer we wanted.  We repeated - portabella.  30 minutes later (we've been here an hour now), out comes someone else with mushroom caps - not what we ordered.  We told him those weren't right and he didn't seem to understand what we were saying.  We called our server over and he saw what was wrong, apologized and took away the food to get the order right.  We're now starving and eating the all the bread at the table - which is grocery store quality by the way.  Spongy and not crusty at all.  After waiting another 30 minutes (now 90 minutes waiting FOR AN APPETIZER), and several visits from our waiter who kept making us feel uncomfortable by being over apologetic, we decided to talk with the manager.  She was nice enough, apologized for the inconvenience and said that we didn't have to pay for anything - so we left.  Over an hour an a half there, no real food (other than bad bread) and bad service.  Our first trip there was our last.  Hope your experience is better.  

Oh by the way, if you like GOOD Italian food, this is not the place for you.  You can tell by the bread when a place is good or not (it's not good here) and we could see what others were getting.  This place looks like mid-west American style Italian food.  On par with Olive Garden.  Good luck!

My girlfriend and I absolutely love this place. The portions are HUGE. Bring an appetite and friends. One order of lasagna weighs about 5 or 6 lbs and can feed 4 adults easily. When you consider the portion size, the prices are quite reasonable! 

The ambiance is that of 1950s Little Italy with a mix of big band and crooner music always keeping the mood chill. The wait staff is attentive and professional, while keeping the environment relaxed and delightful. 

The manager Terry and bartenders Natalie, Anthony, Peter, Michael, and Andrew are always on top of keeping our visits special. The happy hour deals are out of this world. The meatball sliders and fried ravioli are our go-to's. I can't imagine a better Italian restaurant in Vegas. This puts "neighboring" restaurants with some alliteration and others in the Fashion Show mall to shame! 10/10 will return.

Loved this place. Great food in big portions for fair price. Due to high lease charged by Caesars Forum Shops, it's unusual to get a fair deal there. But when I left I felt I got a great deal.

The big boost in my great experience was the outstanding guest service we had. Not only from bartender/waiter that served us, but also from the operations manager that checked on us throughout and incited fun conversation.

 Then when throw on the best music played anywhere with lots of Sinatra, Dean Martin, Frankie Valli, Keely Smith and an occasional Motown hit. I love the DJ.

I also love the wide array of photos on the wall. I wish there was a directory. But I did recognize many of them.

Total home run!

Took my little sister here for dinner on her 21st birthday .Ron are waiting was amazing only mistake he made was not asking us if we were celebrating anything special.  We forgave him with the great service.  Best Calamri EVER people, the pasta was delicious, wish the sausage were bigger. We don't like cold bread so we didn't enjoy the bread. Wish it was nice a warm from the oven like we prefer. We decide to return the next day for another great experience bad idea .The only reason I am not giving this restaurant 5 star is because my second visit was not great  the waiter was horrible on October 10th . We waited forever for him to come say hello never gave us his name . We left without ordering because he just ignored us. I didn't want to bother, the sad part the girl at the front hostess di dnt even notice we just came and left 20 minutes later. I will give them a 3rd chance and speak up next time if I receive the same service.

Las Vegas Carmine's is as good as the location in NYC... Must haves include the mozzarella cheese topped garlic bread, chicken parm, penne vodka, and most definitely their chicken wings as an appetizer. My waiter suggested the carbonara dish special, and it was phenomenal..... I see another yelped mentioned it was heavy. From my experience it's a little lighter version of an Alfredo sauce with the best additional ingredients added on. If you still have room after the big 'ol portions feel free to enjoy their ice cream tugboats! Disclaimer: definitely needs a larger party to finish it. Overall, I go to Carmine's regularly and have NEVER been disappointed!

If you are a party of two do yourself and favor and sit in the bar...unless you want leftovers for weeks. The bar offers smaller portions ( which are still huge ). The bread basket here like the portions is huge and comes with about 5 different bread choices. The menu is hung on the wall which is pretty hilarious so don't forget your readers.

We love to walk around the form shops and catch this place at Happy Hour. They have a food menu and drink menu for Happy Hour which are very affordable. Ive been to this location mid day and dinner time both get pretty busy since it is a strip restaurant, but for a party of two we always get a seat quick. I would highly recommend a reservation if you are bringing the whole family.
it was pretty good food.   it was def up to par with some other vegas italian places.

Just had our wedding reception at Carmine's Las Vegas. We picked Carmine's because it was the only affordable choice for 80 guests and could accommodate dancing. From the start, their event coordinator (Tara)can't be beat. Friendly, efficient and detail oriented.. Complete full service and accommodated my various arrangements that I made. (The entire reception was easily planned long distance solely through email communication..my preference.) The reception was perfect! The facility is welcoming and classy. And comfortably accommodated 80 guests, showgirls, Elvis and DJ with dancing. The servers and staff could not be beat.. I'm pretty sure none of my guests were ever left with an empty glass and the chef even prepared a special meal for my brother who has a garlic allergy. And the food.. well, true to the reputation of Carmine's was over-the-top abundant. The amount of food has become a funny highlight from all my guests. All this at an affordable price. I could not be happier that I chose Carmine's for my wedding reception. In fairness, I don't like weddings .. particularly the kind in a banquet hall with "lovely" flowers, small piece of chicken for dinner and bouquet tosses etc..(boring to me) so gauge my review accordingly. If you're in it for a party and good for guests then Carmine's should be a consideration.
This is my go to while in Vegas. Family style servings of superb food and excellent service! Can't wait to visit again.
Excellent food!! You will not be disappointed. We have been trying to find the best place to eat in Vegas and I think we found it! Can't wait to go back!

Family style dining. Each entree feeds 4-6 people! E add a group of 4. We ordered a salad that would do for 8. Some lemon chicken, cheese ravioli and a side of spinach. More than enough food. Next time is same room for their dessert called the titanic.
Absolutely fantastic. Staff is attentive and professional. Food is delicious. Best Caesar salad ever!

I'll start with the things I like. 
1- Italian food. The prime rib was delicious.the italian sausage was great. The onions were sweet. The pasta was a bit salty.

2. The cheese cake was delicious.

Now for the things I wasn't inpressed with. Keep in mind we were a party of 16.

1. We had 2 people more than we had reserved for when we arrived. They bumped us back 40 minutes. 

- A friend and I sat at the bar and, although it wasn't busy, it took 15 minutes befor a bartender even said Hi.

3. He wasn't polite at all. Had a negative attitude actually. 

4. We get our table and we get two menus. 2 menus total for 16 people. Yeah.

5. We get an explanation that the check cant be split at all 

6. Our chairs had food on them. They weren't cleaned.

7. We ate family style. They brought the food out on one plate. On a long rectangular table, separating the food and putting them on two 
plates on each side would have been nice.

8. I didnt like the interior. They had Random chandeliers and giant menus on the walls yet they were trying to be high end?


Honestly, i think this place is overrated. I'm not motivated to go back. The food wasn't any better than most decent Italian places and a bit over priced.

Best fried zucchini I've ever had! Granted, the portions are huge, but they do such a great job. We just went last night and enjoyed everything. For 3 of us, we only ate about half the zucchini, but it is certainly worth the money. We also got veal saltimbocca and added rigatoni to the dish for $12.50 instead of a whole pasta dish and it was spot on for 3 of us. This is always one of our "must go to" restaurants when in Vegas.
Pratos pra lá generosos vai com fome cada prato serve 3 pessoas muito bem !!!!preco generoso vale a visita !!!!

My family and I were in Vegas for my bday and asked the concierge for good Italian food and they recommended Carmines... and they were right on the money! The service was amazing! We had the seafood pasta in linguine and one of the best I have had! They also brought one meatball for me since I was the only one in the mood for meatballs. Great good and the titanic ice cream was more than we can handle! Will definitely be another stop for our next Vegas trip!
Mostly love the idea. Great memories of food and drink in NYC. This one in Vegas lacks that but food and service was good, not great.
Michael Baker is the best!  We ask for him every time we come in.  Great for large groups.  Fantastic food quality and huge portions!!  A must dine spot in Vegas

Wow, what a place. It's big and loud and the menu  has lots of choices. I would say if you wanted a quiet, cozy spot, this would not be the place. The food is served family style and therefore the portions are huge and great for sharing or for having the next day for lunch. It's pricey, but what isn't in Vegas for a good meal? For instance, if you would like a salad or a vegetable to accompany your meal, the Caesar salad (which is enough for 5 or 6 people) costs $29 and some steamed broccoli, served in a huge bowl is $17, again, enough for multiple people to share. 
My biggest problem with our dinner last night was the service. DAVID was our server and although he was polite, he was not enthusiastic and didn't want to spend one extra minute at our table helping to answer our questions. Maybe he was having a bad night, but when you're out in Vegas and are about to spend $150 for 2 people to eat dinner, you'd like to think your waiter would be personable and seem happy you are there. I'm not sure if I would go back because of the service; however, the quality of the food might make me reconsider.

There were just too many things about my dinner that I didn't like - from subpar food to surly service.  
The style of Carmine's itself may appeal to some people, perhaps large families, but for me much of it seemed contrived by some "idea man" that wants a gimmick and sets that as a higher priority than anything else.
To start,. three of us were seated and given two menus.  When I asked for another my server explained (with a little too much exasperation, as though this happens too many times) that the restaurant is family style and there are menus on the wall, so they only give every other person a menu.  When I just smiled, she gave me a menu.  Thank you.
The menu didn't have descriptions below the items.  I love Italian food and can be equally happy with authentic Italian or with Americanized Italian food.  But some of the dishes, like Chicken Scarpariello, I am not familiar with.  If you purposely print a menu designed to make your customers ask for details, then employ servers that are friendly and willing to describe things.  
Family style dining isn't a bad idea, but what happens when the salads are $23 and only 2 of the 3 people are in the mood for salad?  Well, my friend, you are out of luck.  The salad is easily large enough to serve 7 people and is piled so high on the plate that when the food runner plates it up for you several pieces fall all over the table.  You could splurge and just order far more than you could eat, or somebody gets shorted.
Main courses were also easily able to feed 6 people or so.  We tried the pasta special of 4 pastas on a platter.  They were all very mediocre.  In fact nothing stood out as being even marginally better than something I could buy frozen at Trader Joe's and reheat in my microwave.  
We shared a bottle of wine and here the server actually anticipated a problem that probably occurs often.  Apparently their wine glasses are the same as their water glasses - a very small juice glass.  She warned us of this as soon as we ordered and offered to bring stemware. Yes, please.  The wine was nice, but BIG PET PEEVE: Some wines need decanting.  If you are too casual of a restaurant to do this, fine.  Just don't sell wines that need decanting!!  Do you know how unpleasant it is to be caught up in conversation only to take a final sip of wine and fill your mouth with sediment???? UGH!
And, since I am on a roll...why use water glasses that are so tiny?  Whoever made that decision should have realized that directly corresponds to needing more staff available to refill.  Nope, in reality it means sitting without water for a good part of the meal.  Hello, it's a desert out there!
Dessert choices were confusing.  Again, no descriptions on the menu and now no prices.  This I really do not like.  Why wouldn't you have prices??  Oh, someone's brilliant idea of forcing our surly server to have to explain.  Well, this one you can order 2 or 4, but this one is only one size and big enough for 6 and this one is sold individually....Seriously?  Why make it so confusing?

Even with all of that disappointment, I would have considered at least one more star if there was even anything in our copious leftovers that I would have bothered taking home to reheat.  Nope, it was all blah.  Even the bread was ick.  Big Italian sin in my book.

Ok here's the thing about Vegas. The food is always over priced and always mediocre. 

BUT THIS PLACE.

I just had an EXCELLENT meal here. The food is delicious and so flavorful! The portions are HUGE so bring a friend (or 10) so you can sample all the various delicious dishes on the menu. We had the Caesar salad, baked clams and penne bolognese. Everything was AWESOME. 

Our server Natalie was STUNNING. She made great recommendations and really made the experience great. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for some hearty portions of delicious Italian fare!

Ask about their chicken scarpariello. It was fantastic. Their service was personable and responsive.

Note: when they say large portions, they mean it. One pasta can easily feed five of me's.
Great food a lot of food great service New York Italian atmosphere highly recommended we loved it 10/28:16

To say anything less than great would be an understatement !!! I would recommend you show up with no less than 4-6 ppl cause they have large portions of food !! Great service and the food well I don't want to comment because it was greatttttttt!!!! There you have it folks ...

Bad service, our server ended up talking to his coworker while we been done and wasn't attentive or checked on. Food portion was hella big, great for groups and sharing. Food wise was a bit tasty but I wouldn't come back.

Stumbled upon this gem while walking around wasting time for our table to be ready at cheesecake factory. My friend and I decided to give it a try and boy was it worth it! Our server Carmin was fabulous and executed the sequence of service to the T! We ordered the baked clams to start and they had to be on some type of HGH because they were huge! top 5 clams I have ever ate! We finished off with the chicken cutlet and pasta. Tasted like grandmas authentic italian cooking. We were table touched by a Gentleman name Jessy. Very friendly and professional. Amazing staff and very very accommodating. We loved it so much we came back the next day and ordered the mixed seafood over linguini. To die for. Our server for that day as angelo. All in all amazing service and since I don't live in vegas I will return to the one in NYC!

Garlic overload with everything! very disappointed. baked clams were almost unedible. we had the pasta special which was linguini carbonara and it was OK but again loaded with garlic. good Italian food doesn't overload you on garlic. there's better options in Vegas for Italian food.

Quality of food is good . We actually would have rated it a 3.5 star if we could. We had the chicken parmigiana and angel hair pasta. The food was a little salty. Other than that it was pretty good quality  Italian food. Very big portions so for a family this is a great place to go but not so much if there are only 2 people.

We didn't know enough food for at least 6-8 people so shared salad with gal at next table and rest will go to homeless who are always outside .. but the bolenesege was great and best Caesars salad.  Now need to walk off the calories.

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews. Carmine's has always been one of my favorite places to eat in NYC so I was excited to find one in Vegas! I had a picture of a pasta dish I had at the location in Times Square and this location took that picture and made something even better! Our server, Michael Baker, was accommodating, funny and entertaining! Please give this location a chance if you're reading this!! We had a FANTASTIC experience and really enjoyed ourselves! The food is, as always, AMAZING!!

We had gone here a couple of years back, and decided to stop on our drive through to California. We are so glad we stopped because this was just as good as we remembered. We ordered the Giardiniera (no peas), and it was soo delicious and hearty. The fresh parmesan on the table is always a plus in my book. Too bad we didn't have a larger group; because the portions are so big, we could only order one item. The pre-dinner bread selection is always good, and we love their onion focaccia. The service was awesome, and they packed up the pasta for us in a very road-friendly manner. They've got a pretty fresh strawberry lemonade to boot.

Was here last night for a bachelorette party.  We had pre-selected our dinner items but I decided to order a round of drinks for our table of 10-- big mistake as this took over 30 minutes for them bring our drinks out and when they did they only brought 9.  I immediately let our server know and it then took an additional 20 minutes to get the other drink after we had already 30 minutes and for them to not bring enough is unacceptable.  These drinks were to have been for our dinner toast which they now ruined because by the time the last drink was brought over everyone was done eating.  When I complained to both the sever and a manager they told me they would see what they could do but the delay was because they only had 1 bartender.....the manager sent over green shots for our table and proceeded to charge me full price for our 10 cocktails at $14 per drink.  At $140 bucks our drinks should have all come out at the same time and not taken 40 minutes---epic fail and total buzz kill will not return.

Carmine's has some of the best food in Vegas. My boyfriend & I brought my best friend here from out of town for dinner last night. The food was amazing as always. We had the Carmine's salad & Ragu pasta dish. The service was also amazing. Got to check this place out when you are here in Vegas - You won't be disappointed!!

Ordered spaghetti marinara through Grub Hub. $32 supposed to feed 6. It arrived without plates, napkins, silverware, crushed red pepper, Parmesan cheese & bread. Grub Hub contacted the restaurant & they claimed that those items are not typical for delivery. What? Really?! 

Spaghetti was OK nothing special (too garlicky) and certainly not enough for 6 people that  actually eat. It was only enough for 2 people. Won't reorder again and not a place I would want to visit in person.

This was our wedding anniversary and we came here after seeing the Rod Stewart show at Caesars Palace. We weren't sure what to order and asked for suggestions from the manager, Brett Bode. Even though the restaurant was packed, he took his time with us, and explained the features of several menu items, to which we were very impressed. We had a wonderful dinner with a huge salad, shrimp scampi, and penne pasta with vodka sauce. All the portions are huge and served family style. Our server Kyle was very attentive and provided exceptional service. We ended the dinner with a fabulous ice cream dessert and cappuccino. We will definitely be back.

Fantastic family style Italian food spot on the Las Vegas Strip inside the Forum Shops at Cesar's Place. Their menus are on the walls and everything is served to feed 2-4 people. You can tell that everything is made in house. For apps we had calamari and Cesar salad, we loved both, the Cesar had a great tang and the marinara was excellent, I also got a glass of red wine. For our entrees we had the Penne al la Vodka and Chicken Marsala. We would recommend both. We were too full to try dessert but next time I want to try the Titanic. We will definitely be back. The price is a little high but quality is top notch, great place for a group of 4 or more.

Stopped by here with the family ! We order Ceasers salad which was great! Then we had the chicken parmigiana which was very nicely cut and breaded, there was plenty!!! Even for the five of us!! We also ordered the meatball pasta and that really had no flavor, it was bland for even ragú . But overall it was a good experience, the waiter always made sure our drinks were filled!
The food was pretty darn good.  The service was awesome.  Would recommend for big groups. We had a lot left over. Very open Family style food.

Possibly the best Italian food I've had to date. This family style Italian restaurant was absolutely wonderful.

Being family style, the salads and entrées can easily serve five. For a table of six we ordered eggplant parmigiana, linguine bolognese and the Carmine salad. And there was more than enough food to go around...and leftovers to boot.

The bolognese sauce was excellent...but don't expect the typical tomato style. This bolognese sauce was meat, oil and herb based...and absolutely delicious. The eggplant was a many-layered affair of cheese, eggplant and marinara sauce that was devoured with abandon. And the salad had an excellent array of tastes and textures.

The bread basket is filled with a variety of breads, from focaccias to breadsticks, and they generously gave us three baskets in total.

Simply put, if you're in Las Vegas and want top notch Italian food, Carmine's is the place to go.

Visited during our trip and really enjoyed our meal here.  Since it's family style, we only ordered chicken parm and pasta for the 3 of us. We saw other dishes walk by that looked awesome though, including the chicken scallopini with lemon. Service was excellent and the waiters here are clearly professionals.

Event planning sucks. Earlier this year I had the brilliant idea to bring my sales team to Vegas as part training, part reward trip for the awesome job they've been doing. Little did I realize the number of things that could go wrong when planning a small event. 

Most frustrating is that we lost our meeting venue at our hotel.  At the last minute, the hotel event staff sent us a laundry list of restrictions, including no outside food or drinks.   Nothing says "great job team" like shoving them in a windowless room for 10 hours with no food and water.  

I frantically turned to any local source I could find, and a friend on Facebook recommended Carmine's. I'm not going to lie, we were a little dubious; images of us sitting in a room with whiteboards surrounded by noisy eaters and screaming children came to mind.  Fortunately that was the furthest from the truth. 

The atmosphere was perfect. They put us in a quiet room in the back.  Music, air temperature, and lighting were under our complete control.  We used the 40" ++ flat screen monitor for presentations, and the staff was attentive but not intrusive.  

The food was incredible. We ordered a constant stream of appetizers, entrees, and desserts throughout the day.  Some were better than others (as you'd expect) but on the whole we were happily surprised and unanimously agreed that the food was delicious.  Note to self: the garlic bread was amazing, and the Titantic is quite unstable if you eat the bottom crust first. 

In short, they made our event easy, literally attended to our every need, and the food and atmosphere made for a very productive day.  And they saved my bacon by accommodating my last minute request for a meeting space ... or more appropriately my "prosciutto".  ; )

Service was awful from the beginning. Now I know why I walk by there daily & tell people not to go there & it's way over priced. My service was terrible. The Bartender said she couldn't wait till this day is over! I was ignored & after getting terrible service & not getting what I wanted. I asked for a manager & they told me that they are having a meeting right now & won't be able to talk to me. Not even 3 minutes later, I watched the manager walk towards the front of the restaurant & I asked if he was the manager & he stated he is the general manager. I told him how awful my experience was from beginning to end & how the bartender said they don't have peppercinis & I asked her to ask the kitchen & she brought them back. She completely lied to me & the the only thing the general manager said was I'm sorry & I'll talk to them. No compensation or sign of real sympathy from terrible customer service & over paying for a dissapointokg meal that wasn't what I wanted.

Hands down the best wings I've had in my life!  I never expected to order wings at an Italian joint, but they came highly recommended from our waiter.  Carmine's is great all around.  I've been twice now to this location in Las Vegas and loved every bite.  The veal is out of this world.  It's family style, so bring your appetite.  It can be tough with just two in a party, but it can be done.
Ate there last week.  Food and service was so good that I just made Thanksgiving reservations!

Very mid-range Italian food that is edible. No awards, but no food hang over. Part I didn't like is there was only two of us. After dinner was over I commented to the waitress that I wish they had half orders because the plates of food were so big, we ended up throwing half of it way.
Her reply was " didn't the hostess tell you if you ate at the bar area smaller portions are available ?? No, and neither did you when you came to get our order. What a good feeling to pay for big portions that go to waste. We also got served white wine at room temperature that we had to have replaced. No attention to detail.

Hello. Let me first say that I have changed my mind and my opinion. My hat is off to the staff at the restaurant ant to the manager, Anthony. We ate there on Wednesday before thanksgiving as a family meal. My wife, ex-wife and daughter and my son and his wife. We enjoyed an antipasti prepared for us by the chef and sent out with the complements of the restaurant. So, what happened. The general manager and I spoke after my last review and we agreed that I should try one more time. I let Anthony know when I was coming and that I was bringing the family. We had an enjoyable table out in the mall, the patio area and the noise level was MUCH reduced and we could all hear each other with no trouble. Which for a guy who is starting to loose a little in the hearing area, was great. We enjoyed a Caesar salad and ordered the stuffed mushrooms. Neither of which disappointed a single guest. We then ordered the chicken parmesan and the cheese ravioli. There was food for all and it was all great. If I had any complaint, which I do not, it was I kind of expected a side of pasta with the chicken parmesan, but trust me it was not needed. There was plenty and I do not think anyone missed it at all. 

Everything went as expected and we are and were impressed with the service and the food. It just goes to show you that every one can have a bad day. Strike my first review and go with this one.

Our table of 6(2kids) had the Calamari and it was a generous portion. Pieces were light and crispy. We also shared the Mixed Seafood linguine in red sauce. Portions were huge and plenty of seafood. We were hoping for a little more flavor from the red sauce. We needed up using red pepper flakes to spice it up a bit.

My family and I always enjoy coming to carmines whenever we are in Vegas. Our server was okay, did not write down our orders and kept having to re-ask us what we ordered. If you are going to do that, remember what we tell you. Since there was a group of six, it would have been better to write it down. The food is exceptional as always and very prompt. We went through the spaghetti Bolognese so quickly we had to order another tray. The berry frozen cosmo drink was very good! I would just work on making sure to take down the orders every time, to ensure a more pleasant dining experience. It was not bad... just could be a little better.

Four of us went out to eat and it was better than expected. The food is reasonably priced and there was enough for everyone to take leftovers. We had the upgraded steak that comes with the potatoes and sausage. I forget what its called, but its worth the extra $20. 

We didn't need to order any sides, so we had the calamari and salad as appetizers. This was my first time here and I definitely wouldn't mind going back. The atmosphere was awesome, and they brought out a giant banana split for my wife's birthday. 

Definitely worth checking out. 

My only complaint is that I hate having to valet, but that's a personal pet peeve of mine and nothing to do with them. Other than that I enjoyed.

This place was great!! It was recommended to us by a friend but when we looked at the menu online we realized it was family style and plates were enough to feed large groups. Almost decided not to stop by because it was just me and my husband and there was no way we could eat that much food. Walked by there on a Wednesday around noon and my husband decided to ask about the menu. Turns out they told us we could eat from the bar menu and sit at a regular table. Bar menu has smaller options for 2 people. Since we were planning on trying out other eateries while in town we decided to just get the penne alla vodka which menu said was enough for two. They brought out a bread basket with a variety of breads as well. Being that I'm currently pregnant I ordered a non-alcoholic cocktail, Pineapple Mule. It was probably the best non-alcoholic drink I have ever had!!! It had fresh pineapple muddled in the drink! I will likely be back just for that! The pasta was delicious and my husband and I devoured it! We ended up leaving stuffed even though we were trying not to eat too much. The size would have been good for three people, especially if you try other things. The other thing I should add is that the waiter was great and friendly and really knew the menu well. The other staff filling water glasses, husbands wine glass, bringing bread were all great as well!! I will definitely be back to try other things!

After much discussion with waitress and two others in my party, ordered zuppa di clams, shrimp fra diavolo and calamari in white sauce over penne. 

Waitress told us all food is made to order, isn't it usually?  Couldn't just order the caponata, though, would have to get other cold antipasto items I don't eat. So much for "made to order". Couldn't get baked clams either since they have cheese in them (premade?) and am allergic to cheese. 

Clams were ok; got more onion focaccia for dunking in broth.  Shrimp were ok. Maybe 15 average size shrimp. Not rubbery. Brought out wrong pasta dish, had clams instead of calamari. Replaced it in reasonable time.  

Food wasn't as bad as it could have been, just wasn't special. Took too much effort to find dishes that three people wanted to share, rather than a lot of dishes which we could all taste.  Also, restaurant needs to have smaller tables.  We were originally shown to a table for six (!), but convinced hostess that a booth for 2 (?) would be more comfortable and conducive to conversation.

Everything is large portions; pasta can be bought in supermarket for $.99/lb.  Only thing that is not large portion is glass of wine.  Not served in a wine glass, but in a small drinking glass.

Family style like this was trendy in late 1980's.  Now people would like a small taste of a lot of dishes rather than find a few upon which everyone agrees.

More isn't better, it is just more.

I love the food here! Love it. We sat at the bar and got a smaller portion, which was still enormous. Meat sauce and penne, with cesar salad. I felt like the server was intentionally annoyed with us because we were not drinking enough or spending enough for his liking. I found that a little bit rude and icky. For Vegas, it's perfect.

So, sat down at an empty bar staffed with three bartenders. I ordered a margarita and asked one of the bartenders if this was the same Carmines as Carmine Vento the owner of Villa Pizza, a great place for locals to get a slice since the 70's. My favorite shop being in the old Commercial Center on East Sahara.

Well, I was looked at like I had 3 heads and was asked "where's Commercial Center?"  after trying to explain where and what and who Carmine Vento is, the bartender told me flatly this was owed by some lady and they were not associated with Villa Pizza in any way.
