So I paid for my $13, standard, run-of-the-mill margarita and left the snotty bartender to tend to a pretty much empty bar and making average tasting margaritas. What happened to Old Vegas hospitality? You won't find it at Carmines in the Forum Shops.

Went for a business lunch.  Service was terrible! Staff seemed barely coherent, got orders incorrect. The electronic menu over had a lower price then we were charged,  and the server said they meet to update the menu...  Which is fraud. Dessert (strawberry shortcake)  wasn't very good.  Surprisingly bad overall and a huge disappointment !
Great food. Huge portions. Family style Italian. I recommend getting the 4 pasta special. Will feed 4-6 people easy.

Wow is an understatement. The food here is delicious. I've been here twice and both times I received great service and most importantly fresh food. The portions are huge. One plate can feed two or three people. The food can be smelled from a block away. :) I'll defiantly be back the next time I'm in the area.

I thought the food was wayyyyy overpriced and just mediocre.  We ordered chicken parmigiana and it was ok did not really have a lot of flavor and does not come with any spaghetti. add $10 if you want a side of spaghetti..

We had a great time here tonight. It was my daughters birthday and we decided to have her birthday dinner party here and it was so amazing. We had a waiter named Mike, great entertainer, kept all the girls laughing and singing so fun. And don't want to forget to mention about the food, excellent. My only very small complaint, drinks were very slow both cocktails and normal drinks. 
But overall great time and will come back for sure!

Their food was fantastic. The bread was awesome and the drinks were perfect. Our waiter was awesome and one of the waiters even started singing opera to all of their customers while we were there and received an ovation. So why only four stars?

They only serve their food family style. My wife and I got one order of the their chicken penn vodka something or another (which was great) but we had to waste half the plate because we couldn't eat it all. 

I understand that family style makes sense in NY but lots of couples travel to Vegas which means Carmine's must be wasting a ton of food.
Food is amazing! Family style and tasty. Save room for the Titanic---my son wanted to make sure that was added!

Food is good, a bit salty, prices are satisfactory.  Our waiter seemed confused and rude.  I ordered a Mai Tai and was served pineapple juice 80% and rum 20%.  When I explained that Mai Tais have dark rum on top and red in them, I was received with a lost look.  My drink was returned to me with a splash of dark rum, and no effort was made to redo this cocktail.  New York Carmines is much better, better service and significantly better bar tenders and waiters.  2 stars

While browsing in the mall, my best friend and I decided to stop at Carmine's for happy hour/dinner! The happy hour menu was a hit for us! The drinks, calamari, and those delicious meatballs! We left stuffed and happy! I highly recommend this restaurant !

A very good family style Italian restaurant.   Make reservations.  No matter what, you will order too much.  That being said, try at least one salad, the meatballs, and any pasta dish.  We had ravioli and a seafood bonanza with angel hair pasta.  It had lobster, calamari, mussels and clams.  Would definitely come here again.
Amazing food, great for groups and reasonable prices. Overall a very nice atmosphere and place to eat.

We really loved this place! After walking around all day it really hit the spot! They serve everything family style which is always fun in a big group. To be honest our favorite part of the whole meal was the Hot Antipasto appetizer that we ordered. We were a group of 4 and could have honestly probably been satisfied with just the appetizer. The Clams and Mussels were so good!! The fried ravioli wasn't my favorite. Andrew the bartender took great care of us and made good food suggestions! I would stop here again! Great food at a reasonable price for a place in Caesars

Food was ok. Service was very slow despite a non busy time of the day. Our beer glass came broken and it took them forever to replace and they still charged us for it. Also they brought us a different order than we asked and we were charged wrong. However, the waiter just laughed and kept the bill as it was. Needless to say we will never be back.

Kept us waiting for 2 hours after making a reservation then having to speak to the manager...who still didnt make it clear to wait staff....omg...seriously sorry that carmines is based in new york...they wouldnt have stayed in business....celebrating bday pre marathon....DO NOT COME TO CARMINES

We've walked past this place a ton of times and finally decided to try it for lunch. Lunch portions are even huge. We had lots of leftovers. Caesar salad was ok, but the angel hair pasta was delicious and so were the meatballs. Would recommend large parties going here. I would go again but try different items next time.

This restaurant is huge! I believed it just recently opened and we stopped by for lunch.

Portions are huge so we only ordered one pasta and one salad and had plenty of left overs. Service was great and we were greeted with a lot of smiles.

Love everything I've eaten here so far. Delicious light summer salad with strawberries, pears, walnuts, blue cheese and cranberries with a light balsamic. So good. Also had the salmon oreganata! Dying. Yum. Love this place.

First let me start by saying there's so much more that goes into a yelp rating besides the food. The food at Carmine's is okay...not the best Italian but it's a decent option inside the Forum Shops. 

Now, the reason I gave them 1 star is for service in the restaurant and management's lack of caring about their guest's experience. I'm more willing to understand so so service if the restaurant is packed and you can tell the waiter/waitress is working their butt off. However, this was not the case. 

I had lunch here during the week and there were only about 5 tables occupied in the whole restaurant. (This place is huge!!) I was surprised by how slow the waitress was to check on us and even get refills. Now my biggest complaint was when I asked how long their strawberry shortcake would take to make (since I was on a lunch break) and she said 5-7 minutes. Okay, 7 minutes...that's fine. It actually took 20 minutes and the waitress was no where to be found in the meantime. When she finally came around, I asked for it in two boxes to go...so my friend and I could take it with us for later. We waited another 10 minutes and had to speak with a manager. Besides being late, the worst part....later on when I went to enjoy my dessert, I was shocked to find that my box contained whipped cream and strawberries, and later found out my friend's box had the shortcake. Hmm. I asked the waitress for two boxes so we could each take one home...and this is what we were given. :( 

Obviously, I was upset so I called in to speak with a manager, I was told to leave a message and no one ever got back to me.

The food here is delicious. We ate here several times on our trip. The Caesar salad, spaghetti, and lasagna are awesome. The prices are pretty good too. It looks expensive, but when each plate serves 4-5 people it actually breaks down to be pretty cheap. The smell while walking around the forum shops drew us in. Only thing I don't like is that they wouldn't let us add chicken to our Caesar salad. Waitress told us we would have to order a separate chicken dish, which doesn't make sense. Although you can add chicken to Caesar salads if you sit in the bar area where portions feed 2-3. I also would like the option to order single portions, and not only family style.

I had friends staying at Casaers and we ordered take out and took the food to their suite at all of our disappointment 

The overall quality of the food was poor other than the free bread that they give you 

We asked for light cheese on the chicken Parmesan and it was still doused in heavy cheese. The sauce was light and left the linguine dry underneath. 

The Caesars salad had delicious fresh croutons but at $30 I would  expect exceptional parmesan but it was really low quality cheese.  The dressing was very heavy in garlic and anchovies. We specifically asked if it was fishy and we were assured it was not. But it was too fishy for my taste and I couldn't eat it 

The chocolate torte for desert was good. 

The food is sold family style. The cost per person is higher than Cheesecake Factory down the mall which in my opinion has much better food. 

Take out service was ok. We had questions about ingredients that the guy couldn't answer. 
They didn't give us enough plates and plastic-ware

If you're really desperate for bad Italian food Olive Garden, buca di pepo , macaroni grill all have better food at a lower price.

Interesting spot. Nice vibe and location. Maybe because it's a tourist spot but the service at the bar is very very average. You have to order food before they will give you a bread basket. A $50 bar bill does not count.

Ate at Carnines last year and made it a priority to eat here again on my trip to Vegas.  Hands down the best rigatoni and meatballs!   There were 3 of us and it was more than enough to feed all 3 of us.  Love this place!
Huge plates of fantastic tasting Italian food!  I love Carmines.

Went to happy hour on my last night in town this past weekend. We sat at the bar and had a great time! I think our bartender was named Shelby, request her if you get the chance to make you a Lemon Drop Martini! It was absolutely delicious and she was a great time. Food was amazing and huge portions. My entire party was so full by the time we left. Definitely check the place out, it is worth it!

This place wasn't anything spectacular for me. The pasta was a little bland and not really what I was expecting. I like the idea of family style as it allows you to try multiple dishes. The chicken parm was the only thing I really liked. Skip the white wine seafood pasta as it had no flavor whatsoever. I was with a large group none of which really enjoyed the food much. The atmosphere was nice and inviting and the service was fabulous. I am giving 3 stars for the service only. I would probably give the food 2 stars. I would say skip this place and got to Joe's which is also in the Forum Shops as well.
I liked the food and the service was good.we tried the Cesare salad, veal, and pasta and liked all of it. The portions are huge

We ventured down to the forum to meet family visiting from out of the country. I was a little nervous about family style and it worked out perfectly. 

Martin was our server and he is a delight with fantastic knowledge of food and wine. His recommendations proved success. 

We indulged in a bottle of Barolo and then a featured Piemonte. $78, $52 respectively which yes is pricey for those and you can't easily get these plus it's a big name establishment AND you're on the strip so for me elevated price is expected. 

We ordered 2 dishes for 4 of us and no appetizer for fear of being too full seeing how large the portions were. I have to say the prices alone for the food are very reasonable because of the quantity. The lemon veal was delicious as long as you enjoy pounded floured veal. I loved it! We also got the mixed seafood penne with white (oil and garlic) as opposed to marinara sauce. There was a mix of clams mussels  calamari shrimp and lobster tossed in oil garlic and penne pasta. It was fresh flavorful and generous. The only challenge was not having small lobster forks to help with cracking the shells. Once we asked a couple waiters they finally found one for us but not before my husbands shirt was already splattered in oil from trying to use his hands. 

We indulged in tiramisu because it was too pretty to pass up seeing it on the table next door and of course because it's tiramisu. 

Overall I think this place is stellar. Our guests stated that this was their new go to for Italian when they visit the states.

Calamari and Carmine salad were both delish.    The portions are huge and family style...one of our party has a gluten allergy, so it didn't work out so well as she couldn't try any other dishes and no one really wanted to eat her cornmeal pasta....maybe they should consider offering gf option for half of a pasta entree and the other half with regular pasta?  

Other than that, service was good and quick.

Huge huge portions!! Come with a group! I came just with my boyfriend and didn't realize it was "family style" servings. However even though it was after "lunch" since we came around 3-3:30 they accommodated us easily. We ordered the carmines salad and the shrimp parmigiana- both were fresh and delicious and the lunch portions are enough for two very hungry people! Also the lemonade is freshly squeezed by the glass- yum! Our waitress was great too and gave us to-go cups since we said we were going to walk outside and it was 110 degrees. Overall good experience.

Came here to celebrate our friend's birthday. The service was terrible. Waiter took our order incorrectly and made us wait 40 minutes instead of just cancelling our order like we requested.

The server's name was Martin and he was unapologetic and even gave us attitude for wanting to cancel our order. He was absolutely unhelpful and spent most of his time chatting it up with his colleagues. We will not be back.

Love the old-school décor: romantic ambiance, dim lighting, classic jazzy tunes,  black and white photos of past days at Carmines NYC everywhere. The bar area is nice, sit there for a cocktail before your meal or dine at one of the few high tops for minimal wait times.

Favorite dishes include the meatballs- huge and delicious mix of beef and veal, these are a must order! The seafood salad is also solid, decoratively served with fresh baby endive and plenty of octopus. Anything with fresh mozzarella is always a win, too. The main pasta dishes feature your choice of pasta and sauce- the penne and red sauce was fine, neither the sauce nor pasta really wowed me but they were cooked perfectly al dente, pasta is fresh made in house daily. I wish they had a mushroom pappardelle option. 

I did not care for the tiramisu dessert (minimal lady fingers, mostly mascarpone) or the  cold eggplant salad dish we received. I would come back for the eggplant parmigiana, shrimp scampi, and chicken scarpariello dishes. 

NOTE: Prices are not available on website menu, use Yelp photos- and don't freak out, everything is served family style, portions are ample for sharing with a group (~4).
Service was the worst. Food was ok but it took at least an hour to get to our table! So I asked them to box it! Bad experience and will never come again.

OK - I know this is the offspring of some New York Times Square type concept restaurant and I'd never go to this in New York but I did in Vegas ( I may have been buying into the dubious concept that  what happens there - stays there.Although I'm fearful of eternal recurrence).It was  Saturday Night(which makes it  all right) we'd driven from Cedar City Utah that day and had no reservations and we were beat.Here we could sit at the bar and eat and you can't deny Carmines feeds you!( and feeds you).At least we were hungry - earlier we'd been wandering around the Valley of Fire drinking massive amounts of water in the 107 F temperature eating power bars.

It was explained to us one part of the menu was based on the dishes being able to serve 4 people, the other merely two.We ordered appetizers , they were huge! We had a big plate of calamari, which we enjoyed.We also had a Cesar salad with chicken , anchovies on the side .I was so hungry I ate the anchovies.The salad didn't have little  strips of chicken - it had whole chicken breasts- it was kind of insane.I ate them!The most insane thing I saw was the guy next to me didn't understand the bit about the menu with the dishes for 4.He was from Belgium and probably didn't quite get it .When his dish came out he looked astonished and I could not keep from laughing.It was HUGE !It would have allowed the entire village to feast.He ate about one fifth of it.Every time I looked , I laughed( I wasn't being mean - it just looked funny).I'm sure he's firmly convinced Americans eat too much.

Carmines seems profoundly influenced by old Ronzoni, Chef Boyardi , Spatini Spaghetti Sauce and Francesco Rinaldi commercials.You can picture Anthony running home for Princes spaghetti on Bostons North End  and people saying stuff like Mangia and Abbodonza.It's actually funny , fun and good natured.Here everyone gets to be a paisan.

I went there and then I ordered food. Then I ate the food I ordered. Then I drank a beer and ate more food that I previously ordered. The food that I ordered that I ended up eating was really yummy. The waiters who took my order for the yummy food that I ate were nice.

Quick Recap:

Ordered food. Ate the food I ordered. Food was yummy. Drank a beer. Nice waiters.

Another drop at the bar to enjoy a cocktail and quick bite prior to a show.  Jesse was the Manager on Duty who greeted us.  Again I had to dive into the meatballs that are Out of This World!  So tender and juicy, can't have enough!

This was a great place to dine. Very affordable, especially for the area. 
Family style servings are large with plenty of food. And the quality is exceptional.
The menus are on the wall. So bring your camera. Take a picture. Then, go back to your table and make your selection. Easy.
Best place in the Shops at Caesars Palace. Great food, atmosphere, drinks and service. Thanks, Martin!

I was pretty happy with this place.  Family sized portions means your definitely taking food home.  I was a big fan of their Lasagna and even bigger fan of the clams.  Clams came out a little on the salty side but they were huge and delicious.  Definitely a good place to go to get your eat on.
Excellent food and service.   I recommend the Veal.  The service was outstanding!  Don't miss this place when your at Caesars!

My two friends and I came here a couple of weeks ago. We realized it was family style but did not realize how big the portions were. Very impressive! 

We had the best caesar salad to begin then calamari and for our main entree, we had the mixed seafood with linguini and red sauce. It was seriously one of the best meals I've ever had. 

Also, our waitress was so nice!
Never disappointed at Carmine's. Our go to place when we have a group of people. Love the family style service.

Great traditional, east coast Italian food.  Very large portions (2 adults and 2 teens shared the chicken parm with pasta). If you are looking for solid southern Italian, this is a great choice. 

Solid service, small but adequate wine list.  Restaurant has great ambience.

I live in Las Vegas over 20 years I have finally found a real high quality Italian food restaurant. From what I hear The head chef and crew make all the food from scratch every morning. For the moderately priced plates the portions are so generous. The atmosphere is great the waitstaff is overly friendly also very clean the Greatview my compliments to the chef I will be going at least once a month you're definitely missing out if you don't try this place

The food here is decent. We had the ravioli with meat sauce. The ravioli was very good, however, we regretted the sauce choice. We were charged extra for it and it just wasn't great. I really loved the atmosphere and the service was exceptional. I would eat here again, but I would make sure the party was larger and I'd try a different sauce. We couldn't finish the dish with just 2 people. The dishes are decently priced. The smell is what drew us in while we were shopping at the Forum Shoppes.
Crappy food and crappy service.  The manicotti tasted like there was ghost cheese inside it.  Don't bother.  The food wasn't fresh either.  Caesars palace needs to get rid of this place.

Good food and ambience. No menus at the table though, u have to read it off the wall or look it up on your phone.  Don't come here with less then 4 people. The portions are huge and served family style. Each plate on the menu is ment to serve 4 to 6 people.

Carmine's Italian Restaurant has excellent service and you have to plan on sharing meals since they are so large and taste amazing. The restaurant is clean and neat, friendly staff and a large bar with planets of options. I'm visiting Vegas from Santa Monica for the weekend, and stopped here for a quick bite. I had the spaghetti pomodoro and it was delicious.

Great dinner very pleasant place
Good for big groups food is great!!!!!
May be some of the best chicken I have I will try to copy this for sure

Carmine's is a great place to unwind and enjoy good Italian cuisine after winning a few hands on the floor. The concept is family style, which is awesome- you get a TON of food for a reasonable price. The entrees are served on a huge plate, and you help yourself until you can't fit any more in your belly. We didn't get dessert, but we saw the Titanic (giant ice cream/Sunday plate) pass out table and second thought our third helping of pasta. The wait staff is really nice, made for a great meal!

We have been going to Carmine's for years in New York even though we noticed that in the last few years the quality of the food has been going down. We tried anyway this new Las Vegas location in the hope it would be different.

Unfortunately as in New York the food quality is inconsistent, sometimes you are lucky and it's ok sometimes it's awful.

 We ordered the calamari and they were yummy,  well cooked.

The linguine lemon pasta tasted like detergent, may be the didn't rinse the pots, who knows.

Another problem were the artichokes. They were dry, without sauce and clearly weren't cooked since they were hard like a shoe. The very courteous waiter noticed that we didn't eat them and said he would talk to the manager. After that nothing happened.

Unfortunately we are done with Carmine's and we'll not go back.

Was actually very impressed with the food here, but come with a big group, the portion sizes are huge. The porterhouse steak with sausage and potatoes was fantastic. The steak was well seasoned with garlic and herbs. I would go back just for that, but you probably need 3-4 people to eat it. Bread, drinks, and lasagna were fine but nothing special.

Loooooove this place ! Stopped in here tonight for my birthday dinner with my wife and I gotta say, Carmine's didn't disappoint. **please keep in mind that Carmine's is set up as family style dishes and everything else is á la carte. My wife and I made the mistake of ordering garlic/mozzarella bread as an appetizer and was given an enormous portion that could've fed a small village! For our main dish we ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were probably the best I've EVER eaten, and their marinara sauce wasn't too shabby either. 

The food runners were fantastic and the hostesses were super helpful and friendly! The ONLY not so positive was our server. She was polite and friendly at first, but towards the end of our meal it felt like she was trying to rush us out of there. The restaurant wasn't even close to full and there wasn't a wait so I didn't understand what the rush was for? Oh well.. Overall, our experience was amazing and we will DEFINITELY come back when we are in Vegas in March. To my foodies out there, make it a point to stop by here, but make sure you come with more than 2 people or you will have a ton of leftovers. TWO THUMBS UP for Carmine's!

We returned to Carmines, this time with a different group of 6. Again they honored their reservation and sat us immediately. We were there on a Thursday night. They have a steak special for around $90. There was probably enough on the plate to have only that for dinner. The steak was absolutely delicious and cooked perfectly (we ordered it to be pink). It came with lots of veggies on the platter - no need to order sides with this. Unfortunately we did not appreciate just how much food would be on the plate. We did not come close to finishing it.
This group is generally pretty tough to pleasse. Each person loved the meal.
I will be returning to Carmines.

This place is great!
Our server was attentive and friendly.
I must warn you that this place is a family style restaurant so your portions are meant to be shared so order wisely these folks dont mess around with their portions.

Just had a large party for my daughter's wedding. The food just kept coming and coming. I have never had a better evening of fun, food and entertainment. One outstanding person, Michael Baker, kept everything moving along with wit and song. Not only was my daughter's wedding party a success, but we even had a toast to my nephew's birthday.

Came here because I love pasta and and got the 4 pasta special which was extremely huge but great in taste although the lasagna was salty.... so Brett the manger took very care of us and apologized. Thanks you so much Brett you are so awesome and so is the rest of the crew...

Now I realize that this is a chain from a much older beloved restaurant, that said sometimes imitation does not flatter the original.  The green salad was excellent beyond belief, huge easily enough for 6 hungry people.  The server did warn us that everything was "family style". Next came out chicken parm. on Turkey sized platter with about a pound of spaghetti under the chicken.  The chicken was pounded too thin, it was breaded but a bit too heavily, it was very dry.  Thin layer of cheese on top. Now my real complaint was "hey guys did you run out of sauce"? I have never seen such a meager portion of marinara on this dish not to mention the pound of pasta beneath.  It would easily serve 8 people.  This is so much waste, especially in Las Vegas where most of us can't take it home...I wouldn't have taken this home anyway.  I would recommend that they offer "Mama size, or little sister size, or kids table size" portions.  People might order more than one entree that way.  Very disappointing to see all that food thrown away.  There were 3 of us and we honestly just ordered salad and an entree.  Also, be more generous with your sauce or offer more on the side.  The menu's are on the wall. If your back is to one or you can't read the others your waiter is "there for you".  I wasn't happy with this as they don't have time to stand there and read you the entire large menu.  Its difficult for people without the eyesight of an eagle. Many people had to get up and go stand in front of one of the menus to read it.  I think having printed menus would be very kind as an alternative.

Came here with my family and my girlfriends family as we love the Carmine's in NYC and love family style Italian.  Food was good but not comparable to the Carmine's in NYC.  Tempted to give this place two stars for the terrible service, but the manager was very nice and took 10% off our bill.  Server brought out our food and then disappeared for 30-45 minutes and did not return to table until I brought it to the managers attention.  Unacceptable!

excellent restaurant
good was good
service above average
Highly recommend

Unbelievably amazing! Fantastic and fun service, great atmosphere, and phenomenal food! It was such a great experience for a big group of us and to have family style dining was absolutely perfect. Only thing I didn't like was that we didn't have food menus available other than on the wall and had to take a photo of it, kind of silly. But regardless it was a marvelous dinner!

Great family style Italian food with huge portions! There were 3 of us and we split the carmine's house salad which would probably have sufficed on its own! We followed that up with a classic: spaghetti and meatballs.

The meatballs were delicious! You could tell they were freshly made and even though we were pretty full from the salad we made room to eat all six! The sauce was just what you'd expect from a good Italian restaurant and the pasta was cooked to perfection too.

I wish they'd open one up in Austin which needs a good Italian restaurant like this!

My family decided to dine at Carmine's this past Tuesday evening for our last meal while in Las Vegas. There was no wait, and we were placed at a table in the very back of the restaurant. The restaurant itself looks like Buca Di Beppo, and has an extremely similar ambiance. The hostess sat us down, said nothing, and walked away. About ten minutes later, a waiter was serving the table next to us and we asked if he could grab our waiter because we had not yet been seen. Our waitress arrived, did not introduce herself, and quickly asked what drinks we would like. When we did not order alcoholic beverages, she was clearly disappointed. About ten minutes later, she came with only one pitcher of water for a table of fifteen people. We asked her several questions about the menu, and she did not seem to know the answers to any of them. In fact, we were never handed menus, but were expected to crane our necks backwards to look at the large, light-up menu that was directly behind us. She first brought out our salad, and some ice-cold bread. Soon after, she brought our food, and because the restaurant serves family style, we were all leaning over each other trying to gain access to the dishes. 

About fifteen minutes after finishing the small portion of pasta and breaded chicken I ate, I began to feel a stomach ache coming on. We left the restaurant around 9 p.m, and I was back in my hotel room by 9:30. I packed up my suitcases and went into bed, but then I started to feel terrible pain in my stomach. I THREW UP ALL NIGHT. I have continued to have terrible stomach pains through Friday evening and went to Urgent Care, where the doctor confirmed that I had FOOD POISONING!!

There are many great restaurants on the strip, but Carmine's is NOT one of them. Treat yourself right and go anywhere but there. The food quality was poor, the service was bad, and the atmosphere was busy.

If you are looking for a large portion of entree look no further! They give you large portions so that you can share them like family style! The food taste good much better than Buca do Beppo! The atmosphere was great Friday nights very lively and full of energy! It's not cheap going here but if you want authentic Italian food and great atmosphere, this is it!

Hands down the best meal we had while in Vegas! We stopped in here while passing by, looking for somewhere to stop for dinner. We were seated promptly and greeted right away by several people. Our server was fantastic! Very friendly without being annoying. We ordered the vodka penne and the cheese ravioli. It was amazing! Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. Even the bread basket was great! My only comment was the menu on the walls thing is a little difficult.

Tale of two experiences.

My wife and I came here twice on the same trip because we liked it so much the first time.  The first visit was phenomenal.  We ordered half a caesar salad and half a ravioli entree.  The caesar salad was fresh, crisp lettuce, great flavor, just outstanding.  The raviolis were hot, oozing cheese out as you cut into them, and simply amazing.  The service was top notch.  

The second time we came we were told as we were sitting at our table that we were not allowed to order half meals unless we accepted eating at a high top in the bar area.  I was ready to walk out at such an asinine request being that it is the same restaurant here or in the bar and we just ordered half meals the day before.  My wife was also pregnant so sitting at a high top bar was going to be uncomfortable for her.  As I was ready to leave my wife suggested we stay as she was having hunger pangs and needed to eat soon so I agreed.

We ordered the exact same thing from before after we complied to move seats or eat elsewhere.  This time the salad was soggy and not fresh.  Anyone who has made a caesar salad knows you must serve it as soon as you put dressing on it or it will go wilty.  The raviolis also tasted not fresh.  They weren't hot and the cheese wasn't oozing out of them.  They tasted reheated and stale.

It really felt as if the food we had the day before was now being served to us again today.  

I'm not sure what to think of this place now.  I went from writing a five star review to a 1 star.  I am averaging it at 3 but I don't think i'd even roll the dice to come back for a tie breaker.  Very disappointing food and policy.  

The rule that you can't order half meals basically means you can not come here as a couple but as a minimum of 4.  I'm not sure if the owner is purposely shunning couples or accidentally shunning them but the amount of food served is just way too much for 2 people to share unless you order a half.

After thinking of this policy, now even the menu being on the wall also seems like a pretty dumb idea.  Why do I have to stand above other diners to read a menu on a wall when you could just put the darn thing on my table for me to read like a normal person?

Carmines is coming across as bipolar and slightly insane.

If you're looking for more bang for your buck in Vegas, this is the place. The portions are bigger than Texas sized. You can easily feed 4-6 people per plate. 

The steak & fried zucchini are a most. 

Also, an inviting environment and great service!

Carmine's- "NYC's legendary family style Italian restaurant."

It's the perfect description. From the moment you walk in, you're transported out of the Forum Shops and into Carmine's. I loved the ambience, great music and a family feel. I really did feel like I was dining in an old school New York Italian restaurant amongst good company.

We arrived Friday night with a large group and we came ready to eat.

Carmine's had us covered; their portions are HUGE!

My favorites were the cold antipasto, fried zucchini, and porterhouses contadina. Everything is cooked to perfection and the servers really do treat you like family. I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant for those in search of great Italian food.

I'll definitely be back to try their calamari and spaghetti with meatballs.

Been here several times and each time has been pretty awesome. The food is fantastic and so are the drinks. But better than the food is the service. The manager was wonderful coming up and striking  conversation, making everyone feel welcome.
Frank Sinatra playing through the speakers is pretty sweet too.

Horrible service! The hostess was so rude, we had reservations for 10:00pm, got there at 9:30, she let everybody who came in after us and had no reservations sit down before us. We got seated at 10:30pm. Definitely never coming back!!!

The portions of food the serve is huge. This was my very first time in Vegas so I was very impressed with the quality of food at Carmine's. We ordered the calamari as a appetizer and there where three of us with healthy appetites and we couldn't finish it. Along with the calamari we had the Ragu it came with lots of different meat with a very tasty red sauce we couldn't finish that either. Followed by a huge strawberry short cake for dessert. We took the left overs back to or room to eat again later that night but we were still full from dinner. I worked at a restaurant  that was Italian in St Louis on the hill called ''Mama Campisi's  It is now called Mama's on the hill. Sadly Mama Campisi past away. Carmine's has it beat by a long shot. You won't leave hungry when you eat at Carmine's if i get to come back to Vegas I'm eating here again.

Large portions of consistently under seasoned and near tasteless food.  If this was representative of Italian cuisine, more Italians would have left their native land for any other country.  Waitstaff nice, but can't make up for the food.

If you are taking your honey for a romantic dinner skip this place. I lived in NYC my entire life before retiring to NV and use to eat at the one in the theater district. The quality is the same. The place serves family style. One dish will serve two people. Most waiters will guide you through what to order ie quantity. The food is very good. This is Sicilian style Italian food. Good for families and four or more.

My family and I celebrated birthdays, last evening, in Carmine's Restaurant in Caesar's Palace Las Vegas.  Truly a food coma delight!!  We live in NYC, and have eaten in Carmine's in NYC, several times. This is the first time we have eaten here in Carmine's in Vegas, it just opened Fall 2013.  
 The penne with Bolognese sauce, meatballs and manicotti were magnificent.  For our appetizer, we ordered Spiedini Alla Romana, pure heaven.   And for the grand finale, the Titanic!!  A huge replica of the ship made out of chocolate fudge, bananas, pineapples, strawberries, real cream and chocolate shavings; not to mention, the three Italian rolled cookies, Pirouettes,  shaped into smoke stacks with candles emerging from each stake.Soooo Gorgeous to eat!!! Outstanding display of food beauty, not to mention the charm and efficiency of the wait staff.  Our waiter, Mr. Baker, sang and danced for us (formerly a performer), now a church choir singer and coordinator.  He made the night extra special with his talent and charm.  Yes, the portions are humongous!! One portion for a least 3-4 persons, and the Titanic dessert serves at least 4-5 persons, and that is still too much. The next time you visit Vegas, take a trip to Caesar's and enjoy the epicurean delights at Carmine's!!
Chicken parm was ok, the lasagna was pretty good  Lemon chicken was probably the best

Carmine's completely exceeded my expectations! My group of 5 stopped here for dinner before the Beatle's Love show and decided to keep it simple to avoid leftovers. We all shared the Caesar Salad and Spaghetti with meat sauce, rather than ordering one pasta entree and one meat entree. We still had a bit of food leftover, but we were completely full from just these 2 orders. The food seems expensive at first glance, but all the options are served family style, which actually makes for a less expensive dinner.
Carmine's is perfect for groups of 4 or more and is great for celebrating. Will definitely be back soon!

Extremely disappointing. Slow and unprofessional service with a 1/8 filled Resturant. All of the hot dishes came out cold or lukewarm. Very limited liquor choices. Certainly not like their New York Resturants.

Holy Moly! Size does matter I guess this New York iconic place has found it way into my heart here in the heart of Vegas. With large portions and over the top type dishes I am wowed and glad to have this well know Italian Resturant in our awesome city.

If you are looking to feed lots of people with awesome family style food here it is. It is located in Caesars Palace's forum shop not too far from the valet which makes it quit convenient. The Resturant is just as big as the plate sizes. Nothing is small here. 

Service was great. We had at least 4 servers with one gal being the main one. Just like any Italian dinner with a hundred coarse they were always changing our new plates for us in between each dish. 

The Breezy Italian is a pretty good drink could be a little stronger though. With that said it not only looks good but it taste good. The app stuff mushrooms was good but for some reason mushy.....don't know what it was but I would've gone for something else. The garlic cheese bread was insanely huge and delicious with tons of melted cheese on top and buttery garlic toasted bread. The seafood pasta was awesome good red sauce with all kinds of seafood plus a whole lobster. Some items might have been slight chewy but non the less great. The Lemon Chicken dish was thin and tender, lemony and yummy smothered in a cream sauce and would go perfect with some linguini. The spaghetti and meat ball with big balls was very good as well. 

Fun environment great prices for the amount of food you get and lots of delicious options. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone weather they are looking for a casual lunch or somewhat nice dinner without all the up tightness. Great place!

So there are a ton of places to eat but we had reservations at Carmine's after the Elton John concert. Long line as we walked up and they seated us right away.....make reservations!  Large portions, great wine, and a wonderful environment. Everyone was very festive. Ryan our server told us we didn't need menus and asked us what we wanted to eat.  He just ordered for us....what a blast!  Great times, thanks Carmine's!

I don't know why they put my group all the way in the back but the server we had was very accommodating. I believe his name is Daniel? 

In any case, the portions are huge. They're legitimately family sizes and I suggest ordering only three items if you're five in a group or two items if your group doesn't eat a lot. We had the calamari, lasagna, and the shrimp pasta with red sauce and angel hair, and a Cesar salad; we didn't finish any of it. 

The salad and calamari were decent and I had more of the salad than I should because it was so cheesy and the dressing was just so tasty. The shrimp pasta just had a simple red sauce but it was satisfying. According to my mom and sister, the lasagna was meaty and also very tasty. 

Overall, we had a satisfying meal and our server was very attentive. Also, shout out to one of the cute waiters out there, kinda looked like John Oliver from afar LOL!
Great open atmosphere, family style potions/serving, food was traditional Italian and we really enjoyed the time with our family and friends.
We just ate here recently and we loved the food.  The service was great.  We would recommend it to anyone going to Las Vegas.
OVER-PRICED.  PERIOD.  Sorry, but cheesecake for $25.00!!!  Chicken parmigana $33????  Outrageous!! You'll do better finding an Italian restaurant that's not so famous.

Best Italian around.  We have been to the one in New York and the one in Atlantic City, NJ - all consistent, all delicious.  This is NOT a cheap Italian chain.  Chefs in all the locations make the same exact recipes - high quality only.  Best meatballs in the world.  Family style, big plates, big portions - GREAT to bring leftovers home.  Go hungry and/or with a group.  (Though, it's only the two of us sometimes but we know how to order to get just enough!)  Great service, super friendly staff..just love this place.  Prices were pretty good too - considering it's on the strip.  You get alot for your money.  Was so happy one opened here in Las Vegas. We will be regulars!!!

Everyone said the portions were huge and for sharing but who knew they were the size of Mac truck.  Unless you live in the local area and can take food home, you really want to go with at least four people.  We ordered a salad that could have easily fed four.  As it was we ate what we could and left the rest.  It was a Ceasar salad and the waiter asked if we wanted anchovies in the salad on the side or not at all which was nice.  For our main course we ordered seafood pasta.  Again we had a choice of what type of pasta we wanted and there were several.  The seafood consisted of clams in the shell, mussels, lobster, and calamari rings.  There was a choice of white or red sauce for the pasta.  We got the white which turned out to be a very light and taste wine, garlic, herb sauce which was wonderful and made good use of the basket of bread we had on the table.  While the price seems high at first glance,, the reality is that when you consider how many people one entree can feed it's not.  Our total bill including my wine was $97 and as I said we could have fed more people.  If you too four people you could get two entrees and everyone would leave full and probably have left overs.  We would have loved to try dessert but alas, we had no room left,

Celebrated a friend's birthday here last Wednesday night and all eight of us enjoyed our dinner.  Our server, Ron, was exceptional - he served each of us individually from the family-style portions, delighted us with stories, and was very attentive.  

The eight of us shared:

Appetizer:
Fried Zucchini
Misti Salad with Fruit (strawberries & apples)

Entrees:
Veal with Lemon & Butter
Ragu
Spaghetti Carbonara

Dessert:
Titanic

Every dish was a delight.  Needless to say, we all left satisfied and sleepy.

Went here for dinner with the hubby. When we first walked in the hostess told us the portions were shareable portions so we were like okay well it's probably for 2 or 3 people. We got a lasagna because we were not sure of the portion size. Well the lasagna was delicious BUT that portion was for like 5 or 6 people. I'll definitely come back but with a bigger party so that we can try more than one item. If you don't eat much or are just going with one or 2 people I would recommend you stay in the area where they say they serve small portions and get your own plate. I also think the hostess should be more specific about the portions being very large portions recommended to be shared with 4+ people.

Went to Carmine ' s again. First stop when we got into town. Same great experience and food as last time! This is now one of our go to restaurants when we are hungry. one thing to remember....everything is served family style! If there are only two of you, eat at the bar. They serve JR portions in the bar. By Jr., they mean more than enough for 2 people! Every time we come, we order the same thing: Caesar salad with grilled shrimp and penne alla  vodka. Delicious! The food reminds me of what I would eat in college on Arthur Ave. In the Bronx! Also, don't forget to add anchovies to the Caesar salad! To top it all off, they serve Peroni on draft! 

Oh, be sure to taste the different bread options! The onion rolls and pepperoni bread are great, too! Just make sure when you head to Carmine ' s that you are hungry!

I've been mulling over what to really say about Carmine's. I really wanted to like this place. Everything told me I should. 

Located kind of around the fountain at Ceaser's Palace, this place is hard to miss. It's surrounded by an air of sophistication & a sort of simpler elegance. 

I entered Carmine's due to a wedding (the reception celebratory dinner was held here). Upon entering I was engulfed immediately with the atmosphere. It has an aroma that embraces the era where men retired to the den with a glass of scotch and a cigar. I loved the amount of wood and the fact that the menu was plastered every wall. You'll pretty much choose what you eat before you even sit down. 

We got sat in the back room and had a pre-fixed menu. The table was pre set with a sampler bread basket and waters in front of us. The assortment of bread was odd and many of the flavors left a sour taste in my mouth. Oh well, you can't complain about complimentary bread. 

To start, we were given an enormous platter of calamari and ceaser. The abundance of the two starters alone was overwhelming. If you come, I recommend sharing a plate rather than order one for oneself. Trust me. Unless you're a competitive eater, or just have an insatiable appetite, you won't finish. 

The calamari batter was was overly salty and I found myself drinking more to quench my thirst. 
The ceaser salad, it was probably the best part of the meal, sadly. However, it still was too much for me. It was overly dressed and the dressing had an odd taste to it.

The gluten free vodka pasta made me feel so horribly for everyone that has a gluten allergy. The sauce lacked all flavor and the pasta itself? Odd. Just odd.
The shrimp with wine sauce was horrendously oily and ended up making me feel so nauseas I couldn't even try the other dishes. To much of my dismay, the dishes that followed looked more appetizing and were raved about. Ugh. Such a shame.

Overall? I loved the atmosphere and the service was on par to what I expect Vegas service to be. However, the food left much to be desired. I would've much rather liked to go to the Cheesecake Factory that was nearby.

Wow... You go for lunch and you get a meal... It was superb Italian.. The only reason I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is one of the dishes had a little too much garlic for my taste, but everything else was perfect, service, atmosphere and food.

Story goes a little like this.. it was about 12:30 pm and we had attempted to get a table at Joe's but we failed miserably. My family were a bunch of starving raging lunatics (we missed breakfast) so we wondered around Forum shops looking for a place to eat (hoping we wouldn't have to settle for The Cheesecake Factory) and then this placed appeared out of nowhere. Hostess was very kind to explain the concept (family style, huge portions, menus are giant screens on the wall) and we just said: We're very hungry. 
So we all stood up and stared at the menu on the wall and we ordered the Caesar Salad, fried calamari, shrimp parmigiana and garlic and oil linguine. 
And yes, portions are HUGE. We could have done without the Calamari (don't get me wrong, it was very good, but it was too much for a party of four) 
Everything was delicious but we had a lot of leftovers.
So, to sum it all up. By all means go, but don't arrive too hungry cause you'll order like crazy and then wonder, what was I thinking? Or do arrive hungry, just get a bigger family. Whatever works for you.

Wait staff was amazing, but the food. Oh my gosh. Incredible. We ordered 2 pastas for 4 people and had a crazy amount of left overs. I only tried the cheese ravioli, but it was by far the best ravioli I've had in Vegas. I will definitely be coming back for more!

I've been to the original Carmine's in Time Square NY.  This one is just as good.  I still think it's the best Italian restaurant I've ever been too.

Just be warned, their portions are huge.  I would not plan on coming with a group less then 4.  The ceasar salad alone is like a small mountain.  2 people probably couldn't finish that.  

I highly recommend the lasagna, it's delicious.  Just too bad they do not offer anything with alfredo sauce.

Terrible food. Extraordinarily salty. And I'm fairly certain they put salt in my DRINK. If you want Italian Food, stay away from Carmine's. If you want edible food, stay away from Carmine's.just. Stay away.

Amazing!!!!! The staff was awesome. Very friendly, helpful. They took lots of time to explain the menu and made suggestions. The spaghetti and meatballs were the best I've ever had.  There were six in our group. We got 2 entrees and a salad and we had plenty of leftovers. I look forward to visiting again.

All of the reviews are true:
1) Enormous portions
2) Old-world Italian/NYC decor
3) High prices

Now, this doesn't mean that it was a bad experience. To the contrary, it was pretty good.. A-OK, if you will. My mom and I visited Carmine's for our pre-marathon carb-loading meal. We walked right in at about 4:30 without a reservation. We were seated at a small table, with little room between us and diners on either side of us. Even the waiters had a hard time getting between them. Now, this could be seen as a positive thing, because we got to know our fellow patrons over the course of our meal, but if we'd had something private to discuss... well...

Anyway, onto the food! The food was served "family style" in a large party platter. One entree is easily enough for 2-4 people, depending on the size of their appetites. We ordered the shrimp with angel hair pasta ($37), with the "white" sauce. Be forewarned, the white sauce is not a cream based sauce, it is an oil/wine/garlic sauce (and they don't skimp on the garlic). There were a decent amount of shrimp in it. The taste...just okay. Nothing extra special. In all honesty, I think I prefer Maggianos as far as flavor goes. Nothing to complain about, however.

The waiter was obviously disappointed that he couldn't up-sell us on drinks or dessert, but he was pleasant overall. If you happen to be in the Forum Shops and a group of you are super hungry, sure stop by.. But there's better (and less expensive) Italian food to be had in Las Vegas!

Our Eggplant Parmesan need some extra sauce. We ask our waiter who brought us a small cup. We were shock to see a charge on the bill for the sauce. We called over the waiter and said we have never previously at a restaurant experienced an extra fee when a dish is dry and needed more sauce. The waiter response was that is they way they do it at Carmine's.
He did not bring over the manager or remove the extra charge. We think this is poor customer service.
We went for happy hour and apps.  It was good food and appetizers.  The service was great and I loved the selection of beer and drinks.  I would go back.

The first 15min after we were seated, no one came to welcome us except for the busboy who threw a basket of cold bread on the edge of our table.  After patiently waited for 15min, we waved to call a waiter, a group of them were together talking, when one of them saw us waved, he just smiled, waved back and continued with their own conversation.  Plain rude!   Just when we were about to walk out due to the poor service, our waiter came and he was very nice.  You need to train your waiters and busboys better.

We didn't read that this was a 'family style' restaurant. So we were a little overwhelmed when our lasagna came out. But talk about a delicious lasagna. Sure it's pretty hard to mess up lasagna, but it's not too often you have a really great lasagna, and this one was it.
Took the leftovers and had them for lunch at  the pool next day. No shame in our game. It was soo good.
Just as great as the one located in Times Square! A nice respite from all the buffets!  Family style platters so best to come with at least 6 in your party.

This place is great for family's but not for two people. Lucky here they have half orders of certain pastas! 

My girlfriend and I walked by and immediately got drawn in by other people's pastas on their table. 

We sat at the bar because that's where they only offer half sized pastas. Which is perfect for two people! We ordered the Penne Al Vodka and it was delish. The sauce was felt homemade and the pasta was cooked al dente. 

They even give you a pretty good bread basket with assorted breads to eat from. 

I didn't really like our server that was the bartender. He wasn't very inviting and kept trying to push the large pasta to us when you know we won't finish it. After we even ordered our pasta, he kept wanting us to order a appetizer but we can't cause it's HUGE. 

Other than that, the pasta here was great and will come back for it.
We came here to celebrate our anniversary and my wife's birthday. Service was out standing and I must say the quality of the food always on key. Thank you
Our favorite casual Italian restaurant in Vegas.  The food is unbeatable.  The menu is unique.  The service is among the best in Vegas.  Ask for Lorena, she's a true professional with experience.

Fantastic. Oh how we miss New York's Carmine's. To have it in Vegas is great. 
Great food, great Flavors and not costly for what you get. Go hungry and expect to go home with left overs.

Save your money! Don't go here! If there was a negative star, I'd give that. A cold can of Chef Boyardi would get more stars. I've eaten a lot of Italian food and there was a spice in this sauce that shouldn't have been there. It was inedible and for the first time in my life sent the dish--spaghetti and meatballs back. I couldn't fathom eating anything else. The lemon drop was not a lemon drop. My hand was so sticky from the glass. My sister hand a drink that tasted like an old cigar. The service was slow. The ONLY plus was they took the food off the check. We still had to pay for the candy bomb they called a lemon drop. When a nearby table's order of seafood came out, I nearly vomited. It should not stink like that. I was sick the rest of the day and the server tried to tell me it was allergies, that's when I told her the food just wasn't good.

Food and service exceeded our expectations. Everything tasted so good and portions were gigantic. This is a great place to come with a large group. Surprisingly everything was very affordable as well given the quality and fact that it's in Vegas!

Huge portions and an even bigger waste of my time and money. Myself and nine other were looking forward to a family style Italian lunch. 

Things started off great and then took a nose dive after the salad course. 

Two pasta dishes and a chicken entree took about 40 minutes to come out. One of the pasta dishes was wrong and had to be redone, took another 30 minutes. We thought we had ordered the chicken saltimbocca  but couldn't find the prosciutto. After asking our server about it he assured us it was there, we just couldn't see it. I'll tell you what, I couldn't taste it either. 

Carmines ended up being a disappointment. At least there was a decent gelato stand down the way.

Good food but I got the nations worst waiter. Ignored and then sarcastic comments. This was my second trip and first was better. I can't remember the last time I didn't tip and I'm still steaming at the poor service.

Had dinner last night a party of 12 Portions are huge ! Everything tasted pretty good except the shrimp scampi. From reading the reviews I asked for extra garlic and added angel hair pasta.  It was so watery, watered down and lacking flavor. The half shell clams were great, I loved the Cesar salad !!!! Meatballs very tasty & the porter house with sausage onions and peppers was cooked to perfection!

Yet again another amazing visit at Carmine's. This has now become our Vegas trip tradition. During this visit, we were so glad to see Anthony (general manager) and Chef Michael-- they both are the best!! We yet again had an amazing meal and service. This visit we has the gluten free pasta with shrimp! Thank you Carmine's for another amazing meal!

So talk about catering to a BIG party. It was over my nephew Vegas Cup soccer tournament weekend. The team wanted team dinner before the tournament started for team bounding but also just so the kids all be together. My nephew mom was in charge of finding the restaurant. She decided Carmine would be great spot! It very similar to Buca De Beppa the whole family style concept and really perfect for bunch of kids. It was my first time dining at Carmine's. Truth be told not much difference between the two from the concept or the food. I think both are very good italian food. They do your basics well from chicken parmesan, spaghetti with meatballs, caesar salad, and on on. On this night had preset menu started with caesar salad that was good. Nothing that blew me away but solid refreshing salad start. The spaghetti and meatballs good. The meatballs were decent size not over the top size but nice juicy, cooked on point, and tasty. The tomato sauce could have sue more flavor in my opinion. Still overall good pasta course. The chicken parmesan was good. It have nice crust on the outside . The tomato sauce brought it all together. The dessert if there was anything food stood was the dessert course. It was modified strawberry shortcake. Instead of pound cake they used more banana bread. The fresh strawberry not skimpy about and the sauce brought it all together. Talk about finishing meal on high note.

SHOUT OUT that well deserve Catherine not sure if she in charge of parties or her role in the restaurant. She was the main person dealt with setting up BIG party as in over 40people. Number that was constantly changing at the last minute adding more since some families not sure if make flight in on time or what not. Each time called the restaurant it was never big deal and she was more happy change it. Not sure if it was timing but they opened up back (talk about deceiving but keep walking back back back separate dining area for parties) area since we had over 40people. It was awesome for the kids that they had extra space. It not as loud so everyone could talk stories and just relax enjoy before the tournament. Catherine came out when we first got sat make sure everything was good, and very grateful brought big group into the restaurant. Our server she did amazing job also sorry not remember her name. Big parties it chaos comes to bill. She did great job and deserve shout out. The service was FIVE stars without doubt. 

Yes first review without pic! =(((( They should add that to firsts on Yelp. LOL!!!

This place is family dinning, so go with a group! Portions are very large. The aroma from outside pulled us in. We ordered from the bar as it has a much smaller menu and portions were much smaller. We started with a Ceasar salad very tasty but a bit more dressing than I prefer. Then some calamari and meatball sliders. Both were very good and fresh!
Try this place if you go to Vegas!

Birthday dinner celebration!

Great place for large parties and family style dishes. All the dishes are huge and more than enough for everyone to share. 

Service was great. There were about 20 of us and our server did a great job at paying attention, refills and making sure we didnt need anything else...

Only thing I dont like is the menu is on the wall and not to easy to read. We took a picture of the wall so we could go back to our seats abs order. A bit of an inconvenience..

I'd definitely go back!

A rocks solid italian restaurant right within the Forum Shops at Cesars Las Vegas. You would not expect this, but it's actually really good choice for italian dinner, specialy for groups.

Keep in kind the portions are family size - so easy to share by 2 or 3.

this review is for the service and mainly the lasagna. 

we've been here before months ago on a sunday right before a volleyball tourney to carb up. the sunday platter special is ON POINT. the portions are huge. you're likely going to take some home.  the gnocchi was so good and so was the lasagna.

recently, we came and asked our server if gnocchi was available, and he said he would check with the kitchen, and also offered a creamy sauce with it similar to carbonara.  so we said yes, and also ordered a lasagna. 

the bussers dropped off cabornara pasta, which all of us remembers never ordering, and we looked at eachother thinking this is not gnocchi. so there goes one seeminlgy petty but disappointing as a simple request where our server did not follow up with us on the gnocchi. if we wanted carbornara, we would've ordered it. 
 
the lasagna, however, was so salty, we could'n't enjoy it. it overpowered the cheese. so when our server FRANK, returned to ask us how everything was, i mentioned genuinly how salty the lasagna was, and with no sympathy, he resonded with, "we don't add salt." well, i've made lasagna before, and obviously most people know the saltiness comes from the sausage/meat and not added salt. but if he was a good listener, he would have picked up that it was more "salty" than usual in terms of my palette.  then my dad tried to make light of the situation and made a joke saying, "maybe the salt was on sale" and the server just had no sense of humor. it was awful. and so was the lasagna. this is a place we thought we would enjoy, but definately a true disappointment. there are other italian hot spots for less and just as enjoyable with respectable servers.

I came here with my boyfriend and his family for lunch. They had tried this place on their last visit and mentioned to me how good it was. We had the porterhouse medium done (it was a big dish with porterhouse steak cut in small slices, potatoes, sausages and red & green bell peppers) and rigatoni pasta. We had a group of 6 people. Everything here is family style. The food was definitely amazing. The porterhouse was so tender and cooked perfectly. I would recommend this restaurant to all my family and friends if they visited Las Vegas. It's definitely a hidden gem in the Caesar's Palace Forum shops.

Went to dinner with my guy friends and boyfriend after walking by the night before and getting a nose full of the amazing aroma wafting from inside. It smelled too good to be true! We had fried zucchini for an app and it arrived in a mountain! So much fried zucchini and incredibly delicious. The best fried zucchini I ever had! For dinner we had chicken saltimbocca and their Sunday night special of four pasta - gnocchi with pesto, ziti with meat sauce, veggie lasagna, and manicotti. Their meat sauce is HEAVENLY and the gnocchi was extremely fresh. We are way too much but left so so happy. Some of the best Italian I have ever had!!

We're from San Francisco and selected Carmine's for our destination wedding reception venue.  Carmine's was excellent throughout the entire process.  From the beginning planning stages, they worked with our budget to the day of they were involved the entire time.  
I hadn't seen the venue in person until 2 days before the event and it exceed my expectations.  The Revitro room was huge and more than comfortably fit our 150 guests and a full dance floor.  
The food was excellent and there was a lot of it.  It was great value for our money.  The best part was of the event was the staff.  They were beyond friendly, they had plenty of them to cover our party and they made you feel at home.  They went above and beyond.  Our waiter Mike was incredible.  So courteous and fun and he even sang for us!  The coordinator Stephanie was so nice and helpful throughout the entire process.  We had an amazing experience at Carmine's.  All of our guests were commenting on how great the food was.  It made our wedding day stress free and memorable.

Food was fantastic and one plate would easily feed 4 adults. No need to order more than one dish for a couple and you'll have leftovers for a full meal. My issue was with the menu. They project it in on four or so walls. We could not see the menu from where we were sitting. We told our waitress (blond tall no makeup) we would like a paper menu. She got snotty and put out and said that they didn't have any paper menus that it was supposed to be "interactive" and that maybe we could find it online!?? Okay....so had to get up from booth and stare at stupid menu in the middle of the restaurant glaring over a poor couple who happened to be sitting underneath it. Felt sorry for them having to stare at random people's nose hairs while they ate when people went to look at the menu over their head. Sorry but the restaurant left me no choice. Our waitress was consistently snotty and put out through the meal (yes you, blond-no-make-up Miss snooty ) we were laughing that she said the menu was "interactive" because there was no interacting  except showing my nose hairs to random couple at table. We said we could keep things interactive and take a picture of our cash tip instead of giving our waitress a paper version! Ha ha! Maybe she could find her tip online! Anyway, great food stupid menu concept!

Can't rate the food since I didn't eat there. Made a reservation for two which apparently is pointless. Options for two are the bar or the hightop, neither of which was available. To be seated at a regular table you have to order family style which serves a minimum of 4 people. Why take reservations if you have restrictions on what can be ordered and no availability at the bar or hightop. Pass if you're a smaller party. FAIL!

Man ol man!! Prepare yourself if you go here because they severe BIG portions of food!! Def. a great place to go with a big part for big servings. We got the porterhouse meal and OMG it was amazing!!! We will be back!!

When I came in, I ate in the bar area. The atmosphere and food were fantastic. Anthony, Joe, and Miguel were the bartenders working. There service was excellent and there recommendations were also great. Overall, it was a great experience and I will definitely recommend it to everyone coming to the Vegas area!

Came here with a group of 5 near closing time. They were happy to take us but I could tell they weren't ecstatic. My friends are also crazy and decided to order a lot of food. We started out with calamari and stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer. Then, ordered the lobster, steak, and a pasta dish. My friend intended to order a second pasta dish but the server recommended us not to. My friend has been here before so he was aware that he was ordering a lot. He wanted variety, not necessarily quantity. A few minutes after she took our order, she came back out with her manager and she told us that what we ordered was ridiculous and warned us against it. It was nice that they did that but kind of annoying too. We already got warned the first time. 

Anyways, the food was great. Lobsters were huge and the steak was cooked perfectly. The only thing that annoyed me about eating the lobster was that it was so messy. I was wearing a white dress and got red sauce splattered all over myself. Do not wear white. We also weren't given lobster shell breaking utensils. They brought it out but left it sitting at the table next to us. We didn't realize until halfway through our meal. Oh well. 

Needless to say, we had a crazy amount of food and ended up taking home boxes of food that fed my family for the next few days. I definitely would not have changed it though. It was a lot of food but each dish was huge. I'd rather have variety cause I know I definitely would have gotten tired of eating the same thing the entire meal.

My family and I came here yesterday for thanksgiving and got 2- thanksgiving family fest .. and omg it was really good, my whole family loves it ! There was 16 of us and our waiter was super nice and attentive ! We will be back for the food and I recommend coming here !!

We had our Thanksgiving dinner here. Had Christmas dinner here...
We love Carmine's in Vegas or NYC.
With our reservation we didn't have to wait long, got a nice round table closer to the entrance. I think we had the same table last Christmas!
Ordered linguini vongole and calamari and veal spinach.
Had chianti type red wine.
Food and atmosphere here is always super good.
Calamari was excellently fried crisp without oil taste!
But the clams in vongole were the best! Not fully cooked or too small.
It was better than I had in Maine seashores.
Thanksgiving turkey in other table looked super delicious also.

This is a family style Italian food place coz the portions here are HUUUGE.  We were in a group on around 15 people and still there was food on the serving dishes. The meatballs, pasta, lasagna were super delicious. Even the memory makes my mouth water #nokidding The desserts on the other hand could get disappointing. The cheesecake and the tiramisu were good but not the best I have had.

Two parts to this review.  I originally visited the New York location and thought the food was absolutely amazing.  So good in fact, we went back twice.  I went to Las Vegas for my 30th birthday with my girl and we made a reservation.  We got there on time for our reservation and they turned us away telling us that the kitchen was closed.  I ended up eating at a place called DJs Tacos (you should stop by there if you haven't).

We went back though, told the manager what happened and he was great about making it up to us.  Free wine, free birthday cheesecake, and of course the food was delicious.  Definitely will go back when I'm in Vegas again.

Fantastic. We were a group of 4 and enjoyed every morsel. We had a carmine salad, chicken Parmesan and rigatoni with meatballs. We had enough food for four more people. Bread was good but could have been warmed. Great service. Good wine.

Outstanding food and service
Michael Baker's singing is excellent
Highly recommend for the family

Fantastic! Absolutely amazing! Good thing this place isn't in our home town of Albuquerque otherwise we would be here all the time. The Cesar salad with shrimp was the very best I ever had, tasty with beautiful jumbo shrimp tender and cooked to perfection. We also had the calamari that was equally fantastic. We couldn't do a dinner entree, we were too full from calamari, wine, and salad. This place is family style, so bring your friends and your appetites!

Holy Moly, the portions here are REDIC!  You best come hungry, nuff said.

Located in the Forum Shops at Caesars, Carmine's is an absolute delight.  The restaurant itself is large and can easily accommodate a group of any size.  Don't expect your server to bring you a menu as their menus are posted up on the wall all around the dining room.  There you will also find what the current daily special is.  

Your server will bring out a basket of bread and, while you may be tempted to snack on it while waiting for your meal, do so at your own risk!  As I stated above, they offer "family portions" (ie: large portions) and that is a gross understatement.  We are talking pounds and pounds of pasta and food.  Yum.  We got three plates to split between the five of us and suffice it to say, we had plenty to take home.  The ravioli was incredible, I mean, it was easily our favorite thing we ordered, so do yourself a favor and get it.  You're welcome.  

Our server was fast and tentative and even asked if we were sure we wanted to order three items (we told him we live dangerously).  They also take reservations so feel free to add this to your planning itinerary.  Carmine's acted as a last supper of sorts our last trip to Las Vegas, and I must say, it was a perfect ending to a perfect week.

I really loved this place and I am recommending it to everyone I know that is going to Vegas!!!! The restaurant is in the "mall" at Cesar's and it is actually pretty large restaurant! They have a full bar and the drinks are yummy! Very heavy handed bartenders!!!!  the menus are on the walls which is a little different but easy to see from where we sitting. I went with a party of 12 and I made the reservations through yelp which was super easy and awesome!!! When we checked in the table was ready and were seated within 2 minutes of arrival!! The hosts greeted us promptly and checked to make sure our table was set then we were off! The food is served family style so very large portions and if you add pasta to a main dish like the chicken Parmesan it's an extra 12 something but it will feed about 3.5/4 people!! See my pictures we added the angel hair pasta to our chicken Marsala and we did not finish it! We also ordered the stuffed salmon which was the best salmon I have ever had!!!!!! It was pretty pricey but well worth it! Chicken Parmesan was super cheesy and cooked so well! The lasagna was really meaty and had an excellent amount of cheese! Another item I was impressed with was the shrimp scampi!!! The pictures do not do it justice!! The shrimps are almost the size of prawns. I did add a little lemon to the pasta (which we also added on the angel hair pasta) We also has one dish I was not super impressed with but I did not order it and would never have ordered it was a broccoli and pasta dish with a white wine sauce it was pretty bland and nothing too great about it. But everything else was amazing!!!! I can't wait to go back to Vegas just to eat here!!!

Just as good as the New York location, but not *nearly* as crowded! 

We made reservations for three for an early Friday night dinner, but I don't think the reservations were necessary. The restaurant got busy, but it definitely never got as busy as the restaurant in Times Square.

The staff was all friendly, and took the time to joke around with us. Our waiter recommended some drinks, and then gave us time to decide on our order.

I've been dreaming about Carmine's Bolognese since we had it in March, so of course that was the sauce that I wanted. We agreed on a pasta type and an appetizer (the calamari) and then stared at the bread basket that they placed on the table in front of us.

We'd all been to Carmine's New York location before, so we knew from experience that there'd be a ton of food coming our way, and were weighing the pros and cons of eating the bread ahead of our meal. We nibbled at the bread, but decided to save our appetites for the food.

And, oh! That food! That glorious, delicious, exceedingly large portion of food!

The calamari came out first, and initially, we thought we'd have no problem polishing it off. There were three of us, after all, and we were all pretty hungry. The calamari was delicious - crispy and piping hot, there was good flavor in both the batter and in the squid meat. I didn't try the marinara sauce, but the others seemed to love it. I preferred throwing a dusting of parmesan cheese on top, which made it even better.

As we were putting a dent into the platter of calamari, our waiter came by with our platter of Angel Hair pasta with Bolognese sauce. He then started to dish it all out for us, and for some reason, I ended up with the largest serving. 

Maybe because I clapped and bounced up and down in my seat when he set it down on the table?

The sauce was just as good as I remembered it being, which was a huge relief. I tend to have very bad luck with things that I've experienced once, and end up craving. They never quite add up, you know? But, that wasn't the case here. The sauce was meaty and mildly spicy, without being too tomato-y. Is that a word? Tomato-y? It is now.

It wasn't long before we realized, not only had we failed in clearing out the calamari, there was a not-so-small portion of pasta left over. As we were all in hotel rooms without microwaves, we weren't sure we wanted to take the leftovers with us, but then decided to see if we could find someone...in need...to give it to.

I'm so glad that we found out about this location before our trip to Vegas. It was the perfect pre-race meal, and we loved everything from the service to the quality of the food. 

Once again, we left overly full and impressed by Carmine's!

This place was just awkward! We couldn't wait to leave! 

So we only sat down here because of the happy hour sign and we wanted some food.  But guess what...happy hour does not apply to those of us who are seated at a table and will be eating. Huh? Say again? Yet you let us bring our 32 OZ yard cups full of booze from outside and we are sitting here drinking those...but I can't participate in YOUR happy hour?

The waiter...Mr. Personality 2015! NOT. I could have had better service from a log. Quicker too.

We ordered the big multi-appetizer thing.  It had some fried raviolis, some muscles, some sausage, some gross cheese thing that was sweet. Not impressed. Especially for the price.

Again back to the waiter. The guy was horrible. That on top of the happy hour ordeal and the food - Carmine's will only get the mandatory 1 star from me. I do not give out 1 stars lightly, this is maybe my 2nd or 3rd?  That pretty much tells you our experience at this place.  Wish we hadn't have wasted the time during our 4 day stay in Vegas. So many places where our time and money could have been better spent.
So happy to find our favorite New York eatery closer to California. Fantastic service, I saw examples of team service over and over again, large portions and the food was absolutely delicious.

The Food: Huuuuuge portions and yummy! Hits the spot every single time. Very fair price too.

Atmosphere: The place is big with very comfortable seats. In Three words this place is Classic, Authentic with Soothing music in the background.

Staff: Friendly, accommodating and on time all around.

I could not find one thing I didn't love or wrong with Carmine's (wait, no gnocchi on the menu) well, ok there's one thing. But Wow! We were blown away with the portions, variety on the menu, presentation, service, taste and quality of the food. Great time, we had so much left it was two more meals.
