When at Cesar's, dine at Carmines. This place is made for large groups for sure. Love it!
I'm so happy Carmine's is closer to home for me! Loved it! Food was just a great as it was in NYC!

My brother, Sis in Law (who I like better than my little brother), wife (who I like better than everyone), and I tried out Carmine's on our last trip to Vegas.  We love going there together annually and one of the traditions is to go to a really nice restaurant. Carmine's didn't disappoint!

First, the cheese bread. HUGE! There were four of us and we probably could have made an entire meal out of that bread.  It was Delish!  The food comes out Family Style and so we ordered a porterhouse and some pasta.  It was fantastic.  The ambiance was awesome and the wait staff rivaled any I have seen.  Talk about well trained and on top of business.  I was really impressed.  

Carmine's is very clean, not too crowded, and VERY Italian.  It reminded me of a Brooklyn eatery from back in the day, as I imagine they were.  The food was professionally done, but if you don't pay attention, you might think it came from Grandma's kitchen.  

Carmine's is not cheap, but it is really good food.  Give them a try!

It was almost 2 days a go we stop there with my 1 year baby ,but we waiting almost 1 hr after that they serve us with bad attitude,food and service was horrible I don't recommend anyone going there waiting time and money . 
We ordered sushi with pasta ,but the food look like soup and doesn't have good test .

What a great experience!!!  My husband and I knew about Carmine's in the city, but we've never gotten around to eating there. We took a trip to Vegas and found a Carmine's in the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace, so we decided to stop in. Great decision!  The wait staff was friendly and attentive, and made sure we had a great experience. Everyone made sure to emphasize that Carmine's serves family-style dinner- no less than 3 people told us. We went with the penne alla vodka, and resisted the idea to order anything else. We were hesitant about the size of the dish, right up until they brought it out. We ordered the junior portion that was available at lunch, and we did not need to eat for pretty much the rest of the day!  It was delicious- perfect seasoning and the vodka sauce was awesome!  Their Montepolciano was wonderful, as well, and my husband was thrilled at being able to have as many sodas as he could handle with no extra charge!  Definitely worth a visit wherever there is one, particularly with a large group!

As I've written before it's The BEST NY Italian food in Las Vegas.
Food is Family Style so portions are large...the Chicken Parm can feed 4-5...
No one leaves hungry!
Staff is wonderful, usually need reservations & is a bit noisy so if you want a business dinner or romantic dinner it may not be right spot.
Overall we can't wait to come again!
Terrible service from everyone.  Food was bland and average. Waited forever. Not worth the money. Not by half.

Carmine's is a great place to go if you have a big group and want lots of food.  The portion sizes are GINORMOUS!!  We were planning to order three appetizers and four entrees but our waiter was nice enough to tell us to cut back on one of the appetizers.  I'm so glad he did!  Otherwise, we all would have been so stuffed with the appetizers that we wouldn't have had room for anything else.  

We ordered the fried calamari and the artichoke dip which were both delicious.  For our entrees, we had two pastas - the clam linguini and a rigatoni pasta with sausages and meatballs.  The chicken dish we ordered was really good and not dry at all.  The highlight was probably the veal special but we were all too full to really enjoy it.  Be prepared to take home lots of leftovers.  You'll be able to feed your family for days =)

Family style - so expect super tasty comfort dishes of extra gigantic proportion, nothing fussy or molecular here.  Service was friendly and knowledgeable.  

Not a miss - all good.  A garlic/lemon roast chicken scarpariello had the perfect crispy skin and succulent meat that makes you eat too much.  Our rigatoni with broccoli and sausage was big, lively and nicely al dente.  A nice variety in the bread basket, and my limoncello martini was totally foo-foo but I have to admit I liked it a lot (I accept the shame).

I asked if they offered affogato for dessert, no. But our waiter was right on it, brought some really good vanilla ice cream and a double espresso on the side.  Nice.

Seriously, you should bring four hungry people if you're going to order two main dishes.  You still may not finish.  

Carmine's is doing a great job even if they are big and corporate.   It's in the Forum Shops, the epitome of simulacrum.  But somehow it all works and you feel like you had a nice break from whatever conference you came for.  Mangia bene, mangia tropo!

Great place for a date night or to celebrate a family occasion. Plenty of room for large parties. Be prepared to enjoy a conversation with your party because the food is served family style. Lots and lots of food.
Good food but ultimately very poor service. I've been to Carmines in NYC many times, was always amazing but this was the first time in Las Vegas and won't be going back. The waiter was just awful.

My experience at Carmine's was pretty good. The service was on point. Our drinks were always refilled without having to flag anyone over. I recommend the chicken  parm. It was really delicious! The waiter was knowledgeable of the menu and helped us pick out our entrees, took the time to explain everything. The vibe inside the restaurant was good too. Everyone was smiling and having a good time.

Carmine's in Las Vegas has the best Italian food I have had since NYC and Hoboken.  Our waiter Michael Baker provided excellent service and sang a fun opera B-day song encouraging everyone to clap along.  It was a lot of fun!

You must come to Carmine's in the Caesars Forum Shops when in LV.
HUGE portions!! The server Paul was fabulous!! Definitely try when u have a large group, food was awesome!

I could see myself eventually giving this place 5 stars. It's overpriced, but if you know me, I don't mind spending extra on stellar food. Please, read on to see why it's only a 4, maybe 4.5 star review. 
My boyfriend and I went here on a random trip to the Forum Shops due to the closing of one of my favorite stores. I have been lucky enough to dine at the Carmine's in NYC, so I had high expectations. 
First off, the dishes are huge, and if you are not familiar with Italian food, get ready to do some smart phone googling. There is no explanation of the food on the menu, which is also plastered all over the wall. Classic, homestyle, dishes served in portions enough for 3-4 people. We decided on the chicken scallopini, spaghetti and meatballs, and roasted peppers and mozzarella. We easily had enough food for, four, hungry people. The meatballs were melt in your mouth good, and gave grandma a run for her money. The chicken was beaten super thin and had the most succulent lemon glaze. I would honestly pass on the cheese and peppers again. The mozzarella was indeed fresh, but the peppers needed more. They were just cold and bland. Next time, I will go for the zucchini, I kept drooling watching it be served to others. 
The only downfall was the service. Little things like not telling us the refills on the lemonade aren't free, or keeping the water full. The lady who was our server was clearly still in training, but I won't lie, I don't think shell make the cut. 
She seemed confused on why two people ordered 3 dishes. I hate when people question how much we order. It happens too often, maybe we just eat too much. 

On that note, I will give this place another shot, when I have about 4-6 others with me. Any takers?

Went here with a group of 6 people and ordered spaghetti and meatballs, chicken Marsala and Caesar salad. All of it was good and it was the perfect amount to split between all of us. I also really enjoyed the focaccia bread you get on the side. Decent prices for the strip and everyone felt full and happy when they left. I would stop in again.

Reasonably priced Italian food. (For Vegas) the bread is probably my favorite as they give you a variety and it's free with the main course. The atmosphere was very warm. My dad and I ordered the rigatoni with the red sauce. At first when I saw the portion size I thought oh I'm going to scarf that down so fast- but the sauce is soooo rich and sweet that I didn't eat nearly as much as I thought I would. Overall nice place and genuine staff.

I came to Carmine's for a team dinner, and this was a great option for us since we could share the plates family-style. I liked the basic decor that makes you feel like you're at a nonna's kitchen. The menu is projected alongside a wall. This was nifty, because it allowed us to easily collaborate on what to order rather than holler over our menus.

For a party of 8, the waiter suggested that we order 2 appetizers and 3 entrees. We took him up on his recommendation, but this ended up being way more food than we actually needed. Either the portions are over the top or our eyes were bigger than our stomach. Everything was delicious, however. We had the calamari and eggplant parm as the appetizers, and then we had spaghetti and meatballs, manicotti, and some type of rigatoni as the main entrees. The appetizers were the most memorable to me out of everything we ate. The calamari had a nice light batter, and the eggplant parm was like a lasagna with layers and layers of stacked eggplant pieces. The meatballs in the spaghetti were huge! 

Overall I enjoyed the meal at Carmine's. The food is comforting and plentiful.

We come here quite often.  My family loves this place so of course it was the place of choice for New Year's Eve dinner.  We thought it would be a hassle but it was quite easy getting on the strip through the back streets and getting into forum shops.  The shops were closed but restaurants open.  At Carmine's, we were seated upstairs in a private area with a balcony.  The view of the strip was AMAZING.  wish we could've stayed there until midnight to see the fireworks.  Now I know where I want my bday dinner!  Food was amazing as usual. We ordered the spicy wing scarpariello, something we always get because it's so good.   And the portobello Parmesan.   Both were delicious.  It was a total of ten of us and we only
Ordered 2 entrees and we Have left overs!  We ordered the lobster fra diavolo..its huge and the chicken scarpariello.  I'd say of you get the wings, don't get the chicken. It's very similar...even though the waiter told us its different.  We got the Italian cheesecake for desert and it was delicious!!!  Again...leftovers.  We love Carmine's. Loves it since NY. Glad they have a location here in vegas now!

I booked a client dinner at CES. They told me to come back when I had all my party. Of course clients don't show up exactly at the time booked. They told me I could sit down if only one of the party was absent.  It was obvious they totally overbooked the restaurant with reservations and could not accommodate all the bookings they took. 

I understand CES is a busy time. But this restaurant is doing a totally unacceptable job of managing a busy Trade show. 

I do not recommend this restaurant for client dinners. Unless you want to piss your clients off

Had a great dining experience. Can't wait to come back to LV and go with a large group. This spot is perfect for large parties to share in the "Family Style" portions. Carmine's is the new bomb Italian spot in Vegas.

I was here as part of a bachelor party, so my experience was admittedly a little different than normal. We were seated in a large room at the back of the restaurant so we could be as loud as we wanted without disturbing the rest of the guests.

The service was excellent. The manager made sure to put on the UCLA game we had all bet on and though we had only one server taking care of our party of fifteen, she kept the drinks flowing.

The courses of Caesar salad, rigatoni and chicken parmigiana were each very solid and delivered in huge portions. Chocolate torta for dinner capped off a great night. Overall, a very satisfying experience.

You can find this spot in the heat of the Vegas strip , tucked away in the Cesar's hotel. 
Expect Good Italian food, Family style ambience but still elegant and our service was one of the best . Our waiter "Michael B" made the experience memorable. Make reservations and ask for him.
From greeting us he went out of his way to Inform us about his favorite dishes  and made our party of 8 very comfortable and happy .

I shall start with the service, we bit on the slow side and not very observant. When the glass is empty refill it, it's a simple concept.  The garlic cheese bread gives it the one star. But I truly believe that someone needs to explain to the cook what veal is, that poor milk fed baby calf lived in darkness just to be over breaded and over cooked, should have just let it grow up and become a steak. For the person that is in charge of that kitchen you are a cook not a chef, a chef would never do that to a cut of veal. All in all take the money and hit Olive Garden and have enough left over to hit the movies.

If you like grey meatballs and chewy veal this place is for you.  A good meatball you can cut with a fork and it crumbles with brown juicy beef.  Not carmines you have to slice with a knife and solid grey in color, obviously filled with a lot of filler, soy?  The two large veal parmingan pieces had to be pounded out to fill the large platter.  It was either a large calf or perhaps ponded out flank steak.  Either way it was chewy for veal.  Veal should melt in your mouth.  Heavy with bread crumbs cheese and marina.  When I complained about the beef the wait staff QUICKLY took the platters away and sent the manager over.  He did remove from the bill.  The scampi was ok, heavy with bread crumbs tho.  I prefer scampi baked in olive oil or clarified butter, garlic, shallots, seasonings only.  The merlot was nice although odd served in small juice glasses.  The anti pasta salad was very good.  The large menu on the wall lacks how a dish is prepared and its ingredients.  I won't eat here again.

Great food great service. Amazingly huge portions went with my husband and three kids and we only ordered to entrees and still had so much food left over. Make sure u go with a big party to eat here. I just wish they offered side salads and maybe some side appetizers. Wanted to try different stuff but had to pic and choose due to the size of the plates.

Looks just like Carmine's ny!  I felt like I was there. 

First thing, the bathrooms were disgustingly gross.  Clean them !
This place is awesome! The food is ON POINT! The portions are big and it is served family style! So much fun. The place is clean and the staff is all very nice and helpful! We will be back!
Attended a very large gathering upstairs. All of the food was very good and the service was constant and attentive.

We visited with a large party of 12for their super bowl party. The did a wonderful job with the selection of food and the excellent service but someone ordered the Titanic and with such a large party we couldn't even finish it. I would highly recommend it if you are visiting with a large party to share for dessert.

Out with friends ordered the Carmine salad had to use a magnifying glass to find the meat and cheese. The calamari was great but I made a big faux pas when I asked for more marinara. The waiter neglected to mention that there would be an extra charge for it. This took me by surprise and it embarrassed me as the other couple ended up treating us. We also ordered meatballs with rigatoni and everyone loved it. Service was only fair far from outstanding. Will have to think hard about returning.

I was really expecting much better. The service was quite mediocre. The food was lukewarm when it arrived. The lasagna was tasty, but I want my lasagna to be bubbling hot and gooey. This was not. The center was cool and parts of the cheese not melted. The chicken parm was somewhat dry and the cheese on top was barely melted. Our server was pleasant, but inattentive. She never checked on us after our food arrived otherwise we would have told her then and there that our food was not hot. We were considering having our wedding reception at this location, but sadly our experience tonight leaves us continuing our search for a good Italian restaurant. My fiancé and I are not overly picky diners and almost never send anything back to the kitchen. Had there been an opportunity to do so tonight, we would have. I tried to give the benefit of the doubt that they may be short staffed or something, but we observed many wait staff standing around not looking overly busy. It's a shame. We were really hoping this would be a great spot to treat our wedding guests to a memorable Italian meal.  At the end of the meal our server asked us how everything was when she brought the check. My fiancé told her that the food was cold.  We assume she didn't hear what he said as she took the check and cashed us out.

This place is GREAT!  the place to go if you are really hungry and with a large group. Everything is served large family size... and when i say large family size i mean like 5-8 people!

There were 5 of us and we ordered 3 different dishes since we wanted to get a really good feel of the place and being super hungry!  we had enough left overs to eat for dinner the next day!

They were also advertising that they will be open for thanksgiving! i wish i was going to be in town for that because it looks amazing!

Overall the service was good and they even had 2 tv's for the sports fans out there! it was a great surprise for me since it was football Sunday when we went. Got to enjoy an amazing meal and see my favorite team win!

The ONLY thing i wasn't too crazy about was that the menu was posted on the wall and if you weren't familiar with the menu they expect you to go up and stare at a wall for 15 mins scanning the menu. it luckily wasn't busy when we went to i didn't feel too weird about it but i know if it was packed i would have felt a little put off about standing over someones shoulder !

We eat here everytime we are in town. Some 2-3 times a year. This place just gets better and better. If i were to complain about anything it would be all the promotional crap they provided with our bill. Just thank us and let it be. I get that they owned a BBQ place but refran from the promotional pitch at the end of our meal at Carmines. Still live you tho.

Loved the old world Italian atmosphere! A bit loud but reminds you of a normal big family gathering. Excellent food and service was top notch. Enjoyed waiter who sang a few Italian songs and did it well. Will definitely come again.

Horrible place !!!! They have no menus at the table , servers messed up our order twice , food arrived cold , server wasn't friendly , a nightmare !!!!  Really did not enjoy this place to say the least !!!

A great Italian find on the Las Vegas strip amidst all of the shops at Caesar's. Come hungry and ready to dine family style. The menu is on the wall and easy to read, posted multiple times as well. All you need is to order a couple of dishes and everyone will be overly full. 

We got the angel hair pasta with marinara, house salad, chicken marsala, and carbonara. It was all fantastic and way more than our group of 7 could eat! The house salad is basic with red onions, black and green olives and lots of lettuce. The house dressing is a spicy creamy balsamic and wasn't liked by half of our group who prefer something lighter. The pasta was perfectly cooked and the marinara covered it all. I could eat just that and be happy. 

The standout food was the chicken marsala. Some how it wasn't too sweet but just sweet enough. There was no bad sour after taste that some have. There was a lot of mushrooms on top which for one of our members was a bit of let down but he worked around them. Get the chicken marsala and you will be content and ready to gamble. Or go into a food coma with all of it!

The service was ok- a C or 2.5 , the food was quick to arrive after waiting 12 minutes for the order to be taken- 

Carmin'e Salad- only the house dress provided-- wanted Ranch on the side, not possible...ok... I get it. but if the dressing lacks flavor give me an option...

The Chicken marsala - flavorless  and incredibly enough dry and the Seafood Linguini- lobster overcooked, which is hard to do, there was no white wine sauce, hardly any shrimp, and mussels , and clams, a few calamari and squid. Again flavorless, pasta not al dente...Again dry and flavorless...

The desert , Strawberry Shortcake, had a different twist, not for the better was like a marble cake, applaud trying a twist on a standard but recognize that the change was not for the better!

Overall experience a 1 star...Like a spaghetti factory...Would I go again definitely not would I recommend it to a friend or enemy - NO

I had my wedding reception here!!!! It was beyond AMAZING, lots of great food, great view of the Las Vegas strip, the room we had the reception in was just perfect for my wedding party, I ABSOLUTELY love this restaurant and I highly recommend this place for receptions and party's AND to even have an intimate dinner for two, Ask for Cassy if your having an event there she's wonderful and you won't be disappointed  CARMINES

Sabrina H.
Had a great time with our group... NCA... National Concierge Association... Lunch was wonderful... Ambience was clean, colorful and service was excellent...

Waiter was not attentive or knew how to answer questions about items on the menu, instead he'd print out what ingredients are in the dish and walked away without coming back to ask if we wanted to order that dish. Food was disgusting on top of the disgusting service.

This place had delicious delicious food. Everything is served family style, so isn't the place for a date night, but really great for groups of 4 people or more. We had carmine's signature salad, spaghetti and meatballs, carbonara, and prime rib. Everything was fantastic. The meatballs especially were really fantastic - best meatballs I've ever had. The prime rib was cooked perfectly and was wonderful. There was a ton of food - the three entrees + salad was way more than enough and we had a lot left over. Will definitely come back next time we're in vegas!

Food:  tasty and fresh family-style Italian dishes.  I love the house salad and linguini with calamari or clams.  Their cold meat sandwich is also a favorite.

Service:  is professional, prompt, and courteous.  They check in and do plate checks often.

Ambiance:  is classy, on the active/loud side, with good old time music, and clean.

Value:  they can be steep depending on your group size.  2-3 people can spend $80-$90 without alcohol.

Carmine's just catered a fantastic meal to the Veteran's Village in Las Vegas. Really, truly delicious hot Italian food brought to us as very very kind gesture to make the holidays better. Not only was the dinner great, but employees took time out to bring it to us. Fantastic treat and a super gesture. If you're dining out, go see them. They really care and go above and beyond!

This is a great place for family style portions.  We ordered the shrimp scampi and were asked if we wanted pasta.  I thought it would come with pasta, but whatever. We opted to get the pasta and were so glad we did.  If we hadn't gotten the pasta, we would have just gotten about 12 big lonely shrimp on a plate.  The food was very good, but the service was pretty slow.  It took about five minutes for our waitress to come to our table to take our drink order.  They have these oversized shot glasses for your water, which I thought was odd but maybe it is to prevent spilling when patrons reach across the table to get more food.  It is a big pricey, but you do get a lot of food, and we were able to take home leftovers and eat on it the next day.  It wasn't as good as the day before, but it was still pretty tasty.

I normally like Italian foods and restaurants, but I don't think I'll likely come back to this place again. 

To begin, they don't really have any individual menus for you to view. Instead, they have a giant menu placed on the wall for EVERYONE to view. It was quite hard to see what was on it, especially when your table is far away. 

Regarding the food, it is quite good. The servings come VERY large so it's acceptable to have at least a group of people when you come here.

Hosted a private party upstairs and everything was amazing! The view from the balcony made for very cool photos, and the food and service were on point!!!  Big thank you to Stephanie, Cassie, and the rest of the staff for making such a fabulous night possible

Overall, Carmine's is probably a 4. There are certainly dishes at Carmine's that are nothing special. The calamari and shrimp fra diavolo are two that come to mind that are just OK in my book.

But this review is about one menu item and one menu item only. The chicken scallopine. I've been to Carmine's in NYC many times, and the Las Vegas location is no different. The chicken scallopine at Carmine's is easily one of my favorite meals of all time. The lemon butter sauce is just amazing. The perfect blend of creamy, zesty, and lemony. It's so good that I even eat the spinach that it's served with, and I usually won't touch spinach. It's so good that I can eat an entire basket of bread just sopping it up. There's a recipe floating around online (from Carmine's directly I believe), but it's impossible to really replicate at home. It's never quite the same. Since the chicken is so thin, this is the one menu item that a very hungry person can probably tackle alone (if it's all that you order). I have a few times and I'm usually not a gluttonous eater. I just can't get enough of this stuff

Over $50 for an order of chicken scallopine and a glass of Chardonnay, but it's so good I don't care. Bonus points for the focaccia bread with tomato sauce on it. Goes perfectly with the lemon butter sauce.

Living in Jersey, my family and I used to eat at the Carmine's in NY all the time. About 3 years ago we moved to AZ, where the food is just horrible compared to the east coast. While in Vegas about a year and a half ago I noticed Carmine's and confirmed it was the same. LOVED IT!! Finally I found east coast flavor on the west coast! Here is a shot of the penne in pink vodka sauce. SO YUMMY!!! Went back last weekend and had it again. OMG loved it!!

Wear your sweatpants! They have huge family style portions! I highly recommend their calamari, Carmine's salad and tiramisu. And you can't go wrong with any of their entrees. This is my new favorite Italian restaurant!

Scott, our waiter, was superb and made sure we ordered the right combination of flavors. He was also not scared to tell us that it was too much or too little food for our party of 5 (loved his honesty!) Try to get a table close to the front of the restaurant so you can feel like you're dining outside under the painted blue clouds of Ceasars Palace.

The place serves great tasting pasta- Southern Italian style. Our large clan met up here for Thanksgiving dinner. 

Let me start with the pasta first. The shrimp scampi with spaghatenni/angel hair pasta noodles is terrific. The perfect garlicky dish with fluffy great tasting pasta and jumbo fresh shrimp. For sides, we had deliciously prepared mashed potatoes, steamed carrots, brussel sprouts, and green string  beans. Ok, the specially prepared turkey was juicy and moist. 

The bar service, table service, and the basket of breads receive positive marks from me. This place is memorably very good.

Family style Italian dinner. The food was not great, it was overly salty!

If you have a big group they are accommodating but the service is not the best either. 

For the price you can definitely find somewhere better.

Great food.  Great Service.  This is a family style restaurant so don't be scared when you see the prices.  Each item you order at least 4 people can eat from it.  Couple that was with us in Vegas ate here 2 days in a row.  If I had more time I would have come to visit one more time.  

The next time I am in Vegas it will ne on the top of my list of places to visit.

Where to begin. My fiancé and I love food and have been to a lot of amazing restaurants . We were very excited to try this place out but unfortunetly the service sucked. Our waitress looked like she didnt even want to be there. Didnt help us at all. I had to keep waiving other waiters down just to take care of us.The food was not even hot.  The whole expierience sucked. It was WAYYY OVER PRICED for the service and food we recieved. We will never be back.

Good family style Italian dining. Just know going in that this restaurant is better with at least 4 people otherwise the price of everything prohibits diversity. 5 of us shared a Caesar salad, chicken part and a pasta dish. Perfect amount of food. The quality is very good, but more chain style than high end. Certainly a fun place and not our first time at a Carmine's.

I had tried Carmnes a few years ago and remembered it was good, so of course on our most recent trip my family and I had to try it again. We were only 3 people, and it was happy hour, so we grabbed a table at the bar, ordered some wine, and some happy hour specials. We loved the fried calamari, and the meatball sliders were so good my son and I had to order a second round! The garlic bread parmagIana was huge, and loaded with mozzarella cheese. However, the mussels in red sauce was the best yet! Black mussels swimming in a garlic and basil tomato sauce were out of this world! Needless to say, we were very happy, and full, when we left. We will be back, again!!

We visited twice in the week were here. In the main restaurant they serve GIANT portions, if you aren't that hungry eat at the bar. The spaghetti and meatballs is very good and the calamari is amazing. The muscles in red sauce are delicious, order them spicy! It was busy on a Saturday night, yet we were seated immediately and had our appetizer within 5 minutes! The staff is friendly and know the dishes well. Highly recommend!

The food here is amazing! 

My favorite dish is the Chicken parmigiana with the penne a la vodka. A great mix of tomatoes, garlic and herbs! (And alcohol...) 

This is a family style restaurant with portions that can feed a group of 4 maybe even more, depending on how much you eat. 

The service is good, but the only downfall is that they don't have a menu to give to you. The menu is on screens located on the walls of the restaurant. It is big enough to see, but if someone walks by the table you lose your sight. It's hilarious when you're looking at other people trying to read the menu. I've seen a few people sitting at the tables bob and weave through people passing by. (It's embarrassing if it was you doing it)

The atmosphere is a little loud and can get hectic sometimes, but It's a great place to try if you're looking for Italian food.

I hope this review helps!

The chicken parm was like rubber....worst we ever had (and we eat out as Vegas locals daily)!  Don't order it. The pasta carbonara was actually tasty. Would not recommend based on the parm dish. Salad was okay, not very tasty. Head to Capo's or The Palm instead!!

Not bad. Huge portions so plenty to share. For a chain restaurant I was pretty impressed. I would recommend going here if you are in Vegas as most of the restaurants are pretty iffy when it comes to quality.

Two stars for the following reasons: 

1) when we walked in, the greeter was totally rude to us. Didn't even look at our faces when she talked and told us that the place is full for next two hours. When we checked Open Table, they had openings every 15 min so she was totally lying so that she didn't have to do her job that she is actually hired for. 

So I was able to make a reservation within seconds that would allow us to get seated within 15 min. However we were able to find a seat at the bar which allowed us to bypass dealing with her again. 

2) Food was incredibly cold! We ordered chicken parmesan and some pasta. After waiting for 20-25 min, I was expecting to be at least a little warm! Who serves cold pasta and chicken?!?!

What can I say about Carmines Las Vegas? Thank you for being sob old to open a restaurant in sin city after all these years you've been feeding Crazy Bernie in NY's theater district. I have been a faithful customer in the city all these years and now you've made me a believer in Vegas. Chicken parm and meat balls are awesome.

Unbelievable Italian food served family style
We have gone in there just for drinks and appetizers as well love the baked clams and side of meatballs. Have been to the New York and Las Vegas locations both were amazing

We came here for dinner and it was very nice but quite expensive. It's family style though so if everyone wants the same food then not so bad for cost. You need your glasses to read the menu because it's on the wall. The food was ok. Not fantastic nor terrible. Nice atmosphere c

We had some family in town last week and of course they wanted to do the tourist thing and walk the Strip. A lot of the restaurants on the Strip are either super over priced or just not appropriate for a large(r) group. Carmine's is the perfect solution! 

The food was delicious, portions were huge, service was amazing. Our server, Kellie, was super patient with our family & offered great suggestions. She was spot on describing the portion sizing & we all loved the wine she recommended. Even though the restaurant was fairly busy, we still felt like we were being taken care of. 

Totally recommend this place. We will definitely bring visitors back here. I forgot to ask but I've also heard they have a good happy hour? So I can't wait to check that out!

Perfect for big groups and the food is so good! I went with 13 people but the wait staff suggested way too much food. The servicing a are huge and family style. We got 4 appetizers and 6 entrees for 13 people and we had so much food left over. It was ridiculous. But everything was so good! Highly recommend the Italian salad and penne!

Big portions and meatballs that melt in your mouth. I have got to get this recipe. The pasta was perfect and I kept telling my kids "this is how you prepare pasta!"  The Ceasar Salad was also very generous and tasty. Great place for dinner!

We went to Carmine's after passing it several times over the last few weekends. The price is kinda deceiving. While the price I paid was $32 for the ragu, it was a huge portion. My girlfriend and I shared and we still had a lot of food to take home.  Definitely family style portions. And the waiter was very informative with the menu because I was ready to order three things. The food was very good. I'll repeat again and again and again. Total cost was $54 after (soft)drinks and tip. Very happy with this dinner selection.

The bad:
The service, particularly the hostess stand.  They are all young and seem uninterested.  When we went to put our name in, and again when we went to ask a question, the feeling we got was that we were bothering them.  Not friendly either.  This is the only reason for 4 stars, and not 5.  The waiters were nice enough.  James was great and really friendly!

The good:
THE FOOD.  Everything is family style and the portions are HUGE.  For a party of 4, we only ordered one salad and one pasta entree and had difficulty finishing it! 
We were only in Vegas for 4 days, and we came here twice!
The bread is good; be sure to ask for olive oil and balsamic vinegar!
The Caesar salad was amazing.  Not overdressed and the croutons were just right.  The dressing was great too; you can ask for a side of it.
The spaghetti with bolognese sauce was amazing.  The pasta itself was al dente and the sauce was pretty freaking good.
Wish there was a Carmine's in California!
Will definitely visit here again the next time we are in Vegas!

Good food. Their bar wall is sky high and landed on my IG wall. 

Their portions are HUGE!  Biggest portions I've seen. I was here for a company dinner and man things tasted extra good because it was paid for :) 

The lamb dish is great and so was the porterhouse? Their noodle dishes were pretty decent. The shrimp scampi noodles could have had more shrimp. Felt a little lacking.

Just had a very unsatisfying meal at Carmine's--enough to compel me to write a Yelp review.

Upon the waiter's recommendation, my boyfriend and I ordered the pasta special, which happened to be the Carbonara. I was initially hesitant because I wasn't feeling like a heavy pasta kind of meal but our waiter insisted that the sauce was very light and he preferred it over the Pomodoro, which was what we originally had in mind. 

I really wish I wasn't so easily swayed by others' opinion because the Carbonara, as I expected, turned out to be incredibly nauseous. I could only stomach 2 fork-fuls before I started to feel nauseous. My feeling of disgust was only exacerbated by the harsh reality of having to spend $40 for a dish I barely touched and did not enjoy. Seeing as I am in Vegas and all, I guess I could elude this meal to a gamble that did not go in my favor...

The only saving grace of my experience today was the calamari. It really is as good as my fellow Yelpers suggest. But then again, don't let me sway your decision.

Family style dining and atmosphere, grand menu on the wall for there grand portions.
First time here for a group birthday party. The "white" sauce looked and taste like butter and oil, not much sauce just barely coated the noodles. Linguini pasta was not fully cooked but they did make us a fresh batch with no problem. Servers and staff was nice and accommodating.

I love this place for the late night happy hour! You would think more places in Las Vegas would have this, but it really is hard to find. We've been here a few times already and will definitely be back again. 

The meals at Carmine's are served in family style portions, but the happy hour menu has small plates- perfect for 2 people. Our favorites are the meatball sliders and fried calamari. Such a yummy late night dinner after a show in Vegas. Would highly recommend this place!
Definitely on the pricey side. I can't say that if it wasn't for a work meeting of I would've gone on my own but the food is good and I would come back!

My wife and I were not all impressed with this restaurant. Everything is "family style" and while this is great for families and large groups we found it did not work well for dinner for two. 

We ordered pasta with sausage and were very disappointed with the portions. As it was family style it was a big plate of pasta but only two sausages, one each. The food was nothing fancy but a simple plate of pasta and marinara sauce, with two sausages added. It was very plain, simple, and underwhelming. Cheap food without a price tag to match. Also the food was barely lukewarm when we got our meal and quickly turned to being stone cold. 

Overall our impression of Carmines was that it was overpriced and poor value for money and not at all suited for smaller groups or couples. The food was plain, flavorless and cold.

As a first timer to Vegas with a seasoned vacationer to Vegas, Carmine's was a must. After my experience there, I now understand why. First, our waitress, Natalie, was beyond exceptional! She asked if we had been there before, and when she learned that I was a first timer, she went in-depth to explain how the menu and their serving sizes work (FYI, everything is family style). She then continued to explain the happy hour specials for both the samplers and drinks. Natalie was extremely professional and informational, but welcoming and friendly, too. She had no problem having friendly conversation with us beyond quick small talk. The food at Carmine's is flavorful, fresh and plentiful! The entire staff takes pride in their work and wants all diners to have a pleasant and memorable experience. On my next Vegas trip, I will definitely be back.

It was ok. I would say it has a good atmosphere like the Boston Atlantic Fish Company. I think the shrimp was good. 
The bread was weird , a mixed bunch of dinner breads some cold some hot, I don't know if that's a thing... So I just left it at that. Dishes were very vanilla. The atmosphere was good. 
Sitting next to the balcony was cool as you can see out to the Caesars Forums Shops where the pseudo skyline is visible at night.
Great food but you better bring lots of friends to help! All the food is family size and more than two people can eat. Funky menu on the side wall only, no hand held menus, what's that about

Quick look: NYC's famed Carmines in the center on the Forum Shops Mall delivers  traditional Italian fare in MASSIVE family type portions. Couples / single diners beware - this is a lot of food and I suggest groups of 4 or more for ideal proportions. 

In depth review: being from NY we were well aware of the Carmine's reputation. Was excited to FINALLY get a chance to try their fare here in Vegas. Ate there this past Monday night and the massive space was pretty full at 7pm for dinner. Nice casual setting with high ceilings, a freakishly large bar with flat screens showing the football game and large menu boards and classic Italian pics decorating the walls. Felt very warm and comfortable even though the room was gargantuan and located in a busy mall. 

Server was a nice Serbian fella and he was very attentive. Made some good suggestions and explained the portions and the menu. We kept it simple and ordered a mixed drink, a glass of wine, calamari appetizer and the veal parmesan with penne pasta. The calamari priced at $17 was the largest portion I have ever seen. Was a mountain of fried squid and way too much for two people. It was good, breaded well and not too greasy. We almost filled up on this and had to stop ourselves. The bread was also very tasty!

The veal parmesan came out with perfect timing after the appetizer. The serving dish was piled 4 inches high with penne pasta and it included two giant slabs of veal parm on the top. Wife and I looked at each other in disbelief at how large this dish was. The waiter served us and we started to eat. It was very tasty and the veal was prepared perfectly. The red sauce was also delicious and was glad to see that they did not use sugar when preparing it. We ate till we couldn't eat any more and we had a lot to take home with us in doggy-bags. Was it the best I have ever had, no. But it was certainly one of the better traditional veal parm dishes in the city. 

It's a lot of food. Too much for less than four people. We actually had enough for two more additional meals!!

My advice would be to add a "couples menu" to their menu. Many couples go out in Vegas. It's a different market and I feel like the large, massive portions alienate couples who want to eat there. Who would want to carry doggy-bags around with them on the mall and on the all night? A lot of people do not have refrigerators in their hotel rooms as well. Price for two of us was about $130. So the pricing is not exactly cheap. 

Was a solid meal and w/o a smaller, couples menu - I will only return when I have family or friends in town and they want to eat traditional "red sauce" Italian.

I have also had lunch here - the submarine sandwiches are also MASSIVE! I had an Italian mixed and a tomato and mozzarella sandwich and both were tasty and well made. The bread is super fresh and they don't hold back on the meat. Two people can split one and have more than enough.
Veal parm is very good I love the milk fed taste. Meatballs are good. Comfortable seating. Good service. Big portions.

This establishment is not worth the wait and the hype. I had the linguine and meat balls.  The food was not hot at all, the sauce was very sweet that was a little overbearing and the linguine tasted like it was straight out of a can. We asked for bread and the waitress literally gave us the bread as soon as we got our food, and the bread sucked.  The meat balls were very mushy and were very bland. Would highly recommend not coming to this establishment.
Excellent food! One of the best Italian food I have had in a long time! Good service and a great birthday desert!

What a wonderful experience. Portions are HUGE so come hungry - very hungry! Our service was amazing. Michael Baker was amazing!! Truly a gem for the place. Not only was he extremely attentive he can sing. Yes, he sang to us - Carmine's is very lucky to have him on their staff. Food was AMAZING!! Cannot say enough about this place.
Happy hour is great. Good deals and even better meatball sliders. A must stop for me every time I'm in town.

The portions are huge!!! Warning myself and my aunt shared a meal, and we're both big eaters. The food was very tasty. We had Penne Alla Vodka and the sauce was good and the Penne was perfectly Al Dente. I would recommend to anyone who comes to Las Vegas.

We were not treated equally here, and we will never return to be subjected to such poor service. Other tables around us were set with appetizer plates, but our table was not. After being provided with bread, we still had no plates. We waited so long for service that one of us was heading over to the server station to grab plates ourselves at which point our server saw us and finally introduced himself to give us plates and to take our order. Other tables were given a pitcher of water, but our table did not have a pitcher of water; and our tiny water glasses sat empty for a long time. Other tables around us had their plates replaced after their appetizer, but we were not given fresh plates after our appetizer round. Other tables around us were served their main courses onto their individual plates, whereas our entrees were placed on the table, and we had to serve ourselves. Maybe we were not treated equally because we were Asian, or maybe because not all of us ordered alcoholic drinks. The food was okay, but I'd rather go to Olive Garden.

Service and food were amazing . Frank was our waiter. His service was excellent and to top it off the food was excellent. I had the giant stuffed raviolis and my friend has some rigatoni dish. Portions are gigantic. Top it off the manager Dani checked on twice to make sure that our dinner was to our satisfaction.

Came into eat for the first time a few weeks ago and WOW! The mussels appetizer was excellent and a huge portion. Fiancé and I shared the chicken Parmesan and added linguine...Very good! I also enjoyed my chocolate cherry martini. Marcus our sever was outstanding and the GM Terry even came over to say hello and chat. Impressed! :)

What a wonderful experience! The good was delicious (absolutely HUGE portions that feed 4-5 people each) but the service was even better. We celebrated a 91st birthday and a 34th wedding anniversary at Carmine's and couldn't have asked for anythingn better. They were attentive, friendly and made the special occasion more special in their own way. I would absolutely recommend this place on these two qualities alone. Adding in there were 15 of us and for everything we ordered it was more than reasonable!

I wish I had known everything here was served family style! The portions are ginormous and service is top notch in this old school Italian restaurant. 

After wandering for what seemed like hours, I landed here for dinner and sat in the bar, since they serve smaller portions there. My server was so sweet and helped me navigate a few options since I was dining alone. I ended up with a huge side caesar salad and the chicken parmigiana. The caesar was probably one of the best I've ever had. It was so garlicky and delicious. The chicken parm was also on point and bathed in a nice red sauce. 

Menu is loaded with all the Italian favorites and each portion is designed to serve 2-3 people. I wish I could've tried more dishes, but I guess that means I'll have to come back with a group!

We came with a large group, and we had a good time.  I know others love the food, but I thought it was too greasy and overdone.  I'd have preferred smaller portions that are more well executed.  The waiter was overdoing it, but it's Vegas, so he gets a pass for that.  That said, it's a fun way to bring a big group and have fun.  I wouldn't come back for one or two people, but for a large group, it's fine.

My friends and I were trying to figure out a place to eat so this was recommended by the security guy at Ceasars and he mentioned that they offer family style servings. I must say, the food was amazing. 

Our server brought us complimentary bread right away and it was delicious with the balsamic vinegar and olive oil. We orders a couple of appetizers. The calamari was huge and was able to feed 6 hungry women. We also ordered the Ceasars salad with anchovies which was so delicious. It had the perfect amount of dressing. For our main course we ordered chicken parmesean and the seafood linguini. They were both huge portions as well. There was a generous portion of seafood in the linguini which again was evenly split between 6 girls. We were all able to have a good portion of each type of seafood in the pasta. 

Not only was the food amazing but we did have an awesome server. He was very knowledgeable and attentive. We also had another server actually served our food for us evenly. 

The only thing I didn't like was the bloody mary. It was honesty the worst I've ever had. I had asked for it to be extra spicy and it was not spicy at all.

Overall, I'd rate this place as 4 starts bc of the amazing food, portions and great service. I'd definitely come back here again!

Great food!  Tried the eggplant parmigiana, it is the best I have ever had!  Delicious!  

The cessation salad is delicious!  

Service was on point!  If I am in Vegas I will be back!
This place has amazing food and service. KYLE D is the best server ever!!!!!! Big shot out to him and his sincerity.

I can not say enough good things about Carmine's that I am having trouble of where to begin. 
First, I was running out of options of where to host my sorority's annual reunion day. We have grown quite large and size and needed a venue that could accommodate 150 sisters. Carmine's can host that many plus lots more. 
Second, we were on a tight budget and Cassy, the special events manager, was able to put together a family style menu that that would accommodate almost all special diets. When planning for this many people it is difficult to make sure all diets are met and Cassy nailed it all making sure there was food that almost anyone with certain diets could eat. 
Third, the day of any event is always quite stressful and the staff - especially one server in particular Micheal - went above and beyond to make every lady in the house felt special! Even the smallest request was handle with a smile and he even put on a show for the group and sang a song in Italian.
Just a few other highlights: the food was absolutely delicious. The decor was elegant making decorating so easy with only really needing center pieces for the tables. But my favorite part is that the staff boxed up all the uneaten food and we were able to donate this to local shelter!
If you are looking for a place to host your next special occasion this should certainly be on the list of places to consider.

Better bring a ton of people and your stomachs to Carmine's!  This is in my opinion the best "Family Style" Italian restaurant I have been to.  The atmosphere has that home old school Italian feel, and right when you walk in you get hit with all the good Italian aromas.  The food is all family style and each item can literally feed at least 2 people.  To start you have to get the Cold Antipasto.  When this thing came out is was like a 2 foot long plate covered in meat, cheese, and bread.  Once that is done start running down the menu.  For the beef The Rack of Lamb would be a great choice which is a house specialty was super tender, juicy and melt in your mouth goodness.  Next if you want to go off the menu you can get the Carbonara for a pasta.  The Carbonara noodles were cooked perfectly they you get the creaminess of the sauce with the saltiness of the Pancetta.  One word Phenomenal.  Then if you want to go with an Italian staple you have to get the Lasagna.  The lasagna is doused in tomato sauce with the right amount of meat and cheese.  This this was dense and will fill you up fast!  If you have enough room for dessert you can never go wrong with the Cannoli's, but for some odd reason you are not human and still can eat a horse you have to get the TITANIC.  The TITANIC is literally the size of the actual ship.  It is The Titanic at Carmine's is a gigantic sundae made with six whopping scoops of ice cream, whipped cream, caramelized fruit, hot fudge sauce and an entire Chocolate Torta.  Overall, the food is amazing the service is good but sometimes it will be awhile before the waiter checks on you which is the reason why Carmine's is down to 4 stars but whenever I am in Vegas I always visit Carmine's.  

BrandonFitFoodie

I finished up my conference and had one last night in Vegas.  I'm Italian and wanted a no nonsense dish of pasta and salad.  I came across Carmines in the Caesar's Forum shops so went in.  Since I was by myself, the hostess recommended I sit at the bar.  She informed me that the portions were served family style but I could get half portions there.  Ok, no problem.  After I sat, my bartender confirmed I was there for dinner then pointed out that only certain items on the menu were served in so-called half portions.  Ok, so the pasta part was simple.  I was willing to pay $17 for a two serving dish of pasta pomodoro.  I noticed the sub selections came with a side salad so I asked if I could get one with my pasta.  Simple enough, right? Well, no.  I couldn't get a side salad with my pasta.  I informed them I was expecting to pay separately for it but "No, we can't do that".  So If I wanted a salad, I would have to pay another $17 dollars for a very large (serves 4) salad.  So needless to say, I left. Honestly, I don't think they cared.   With all the competition in Las Vegas, you would think Carmines would be a little more accommodating.  (By the way, the gentleman sitting next to me ordered a dish of rigatoni with no meat and got served a very large dish of rigatoni with a large amount of sausage. I guess he didn't like the explanation from the same manager who denied me my side salad.  Because, he left, too.)   I walked through the casino, sat at the bar at Rao's and had a lovely single serving of pasta, with a single serving of salad, one meatball and a glass of wine.  Oh, and I can't forget about the one cup of cappuccino.  It was excellent.

The portions were true family style, but that was where the excitement ends. The service is slow. Don't be prepared to get in and out.  I was with a single colleague and it took over an hour to see our meal. The food itself was more on the bland side leaning towards dry (our chicken parm).  I would advise anyone to avoid it. As a Tri State area east coaster it was a big disappointment.

First time here for a business dinner. The food was very good. Huge portions served family style. We ordered the mixed salad with was tasty with radishes, onions, and olives. For the main entrees we got the seafood mixer in white sauce which was pretty amazing. It had lobster, squid, octopus, and clams. The sauce was very good. The other two entrees were spaghetti and meatballs and chicken parmesan which were both delicious but the seafood mixer took the cake with its flavor and presentation. Service was good but our waitress was a little short with us that why I'm given it 4 stars
Really delicious Italian food, very large family portion. Great to come with a group. Love the service and ambiance, it's inside the forum shops.

Great ambience and food for a resturant plopped in the middle of the forum shops. Pro tip. If this us date night like ours was, opt to go to the bar where you can get one or two person size serving entrees! We wanted to sit at a table to this meant ordering from the regular menu which means all the orders are family style size. It was cheat meal time and we ordered the calamari and the penne alavodka. The calamari came out crisp and the sauce for dipping was fantastic. The pasta dish was cooked to perfection and the sauce was so rich and filling I could only eat one serving from it. We didn't opt for the to go box because I know we would over eat. Ugh such a shame to throw out so much delicousness. Bring 4+ people if you want to sit in the main area to dine in. That way you don't have colossal amounts of left over grub.
This place has HUGE portions!  Really yummy food too!  It's great for big groups who plan to share.  The Lasagna was excellent and I loved the fried zucchini.

Please feed me eggplant caponata... 
for breakfast on toast; 
for lunch with roast; 
for dinner the most!

Should you care 
of what seems unfair, 
that I shall not share... 
but please don't stare - 
at my eggplant caponata!

For the sake of a plate full, I'll dine alone, 
seated like in a throne - 
a princess and her egglant caponata. Get your own!

It might seem strange to pair it with tiramisu.
Though I did try it; but you don't have to.
I see you eyeing on this too! 
My tiramisu is not for you!

Can't you know that this won't work?
You're waiting hopefully with your own fork.
I suggest - order your own eggplant caponata and tiramisu combo, you dork.

Stopped in for a quick lunch. Family style spaghetti and meatballs was great. I splurged and had a cocktail - Sinatra Tea - which was wonderful and incredibly strong. Unfortunately I did not realize this until I tried to walk through the mall.

My grandparents who are from NYC have been telling me to try Carmines when I go to NYC for years and I just haven't got around to it. I stumbled across this one in Vegas over the weekend though and when I saw it, I knew it was my chance to try it. 

Our waiter was great - he explained how the dishes were FAMILY STYLE when we sat down and that those dishes are enormous so that we could try not to order too much food. Of course we still had too much food. The portions are ENORMOUS. He came around basically all the time to fill our water cups and had a great memory + sense of humor. 

I came here in a group of 3 people. We decided to order 2 dishes to split between us 3. A pasta dish and the Shrimp Scampi. Note that the Shrimp Scampi doesn't come with pasta itself. Just the shrimp. Both the meals we ordered tasted great - I really enjoyed the shrimp. Note that 2 meals was way more than enough food for this group of 3. But 2 meals gave us some variety, so if I were to go again as a group of 3, I would order 2 meals and take the rest home. Needless to say, none of us had room for dessert after this meal. 

Splitting the bill between 3 people including tip came out to around $30 per person which is pretty damn fair for Las Vegas for a nice dinner. Food in Vegas can get really expensive at a lot of the restaurants. Carmines has a great location being that is in the shops at Caesar's Palace. Anyone staying here or Bellagio or Palazzo/Venetian or anywhere around these can easily walk to dinner here which was a nice plus. 

Would I come back with a group of 3 or more people? Yes, definitely. Would I come back with just me and one other person? If we were really hungry or if we were ok with a lot of left overs, then yes, definitely.

We had our reception here for our wedding.  It was a small affair, only 20ish people, but all of them kept telling me how the food was just awesome. One guy kept saying that he'd never had such great food at a wedding reception.

The food and the service were outstanding.  If you are considering an event in Las Vegas, I highly recommend this place.  Tara made me feel comfortable about the arrangements and the waitstaff was superb. I never stressed about things being done well.

don't get me started. chef boyardee if i ever tasted it! the caesar salad looked like it had been rescued from the dumpster. the chicken marsala looked like it was Marie Calender's at best! the penne alla vodka was so over cooked - we couldn't eat it. 
save your money! this is not even edible for a free meal on an airplane!

First time eating there was 2 days ago.  Amazing food!  Carmine's serves huge portions that will feed three people.  Delicious is an understatement.  

We had the lasagna, and it melts in your mouth.  No joke.  Fantastic bolognese sauce made with veal.  

Service was nicely attentive, and the manager dropped by to check on our experience. That was an added plus.  If you live in Las Vegas, ask about the local's discount.  

A fellow local foodie recommended going, and we were not disappointed.  If you want great food, I personally recommend going to Carmine's before Scarpetta and Rao's.  I am looking forward to my next visit. This could be my go to place any time I'm on The Strip.

Checked out Carmines with my fellow Yelper Amar B. this Halloween. I've heard alot about this place so I was pretty excited to see what they had to offer. Carmine's occupies the former Planet Hollywood restaurant spot inside the Forum Shops. My first thoughts walking in were "wow this place is huge and empty." The restaurant is massive, vaulted ceillings, tons of pictures and sizeable bar.

The food here defintely gives 'family style" dining a whole new meaning as the portions here on the are massive. I have never seen a restaurant regularly serve up so much food. The appetizer and two entrees we order were more than enough to feed the seven of us. Unfortunately, Carmine's failed to follow the common mantra of quality over quantity.

We started with ordering the Garlic Bread Parmigianino as a appetizer. The huge texas toast style slices of bread totally caked with a thick layer of Parmesan cheese and garlic seasoning. After about half through the slice, the oil from cheese and spread became overwhelming and I had to put it down. The Chicken Contadina was OK at best, huge pieces of bone-in chicken got cold too quickly and the sausage that accompanied it was surprisingly lacking in flavor. The last dish we had, Rigatoni Bolognese, was the best out of the three, the meat sauce and the pasta complimented each other nicely and dish was full of flavor.

Service was a bit below average for this type of restaurant. Our server came around infrequently to refill our miniature glasses of water and didn't even offer us a wine list or dessert menu. Not sure if he was just having a bad day but he came across as very uninterested, hurried, and unhospitable.

Carmine's is certainly not cheap, most entrees run anywhere from $30-$50 but keep in mind that they are meant to feed a large group of people. The place has a lot of potential and I would love to come back and check out some of their other offerings.

A big disappointment. My brother and I went here to see if they are as good as they claim. Nah. Go somewhere else.
They say they serve large family style portions to feed at least 4 hungry people, Italian "generous family" style. We ordered the Spaghetti Bolognese, about $38, and while it came on a big plate, there obviously was not enough pasta. So after two small portions each, we were left hanging. There was still some meat sauce, so we asked if we can just get some more spaghetti. The waiter said the manager said it will be $12.50 more. Since we were unsatisfied, we had to bite the bullet and order it. But I felt ripped off. If they had given enough pasta to begin with, there would not have been this problem. My brother and I always eat at Buca di Beppo and we never ever had this problem. And, my big complaint is pasta is cheap. In my opinion their true hospitality and good business sense to make the customer happy would have been to just give us the extra portion of pasta just to be satisfied, as opposed to being reamed. PASTA IS CHEAP. Or, if they wanted to charge, max. should have been $6.

The waiter was also not a very pleasant guy. He was always hurrying, he had no genuine interest, he was perfunctory. Proof: we had to ask for bread. We had to ask for the olive oil and balsamic vinegar to dip the bread. And though we still had not finished the bread, he swoops away the olive oil and vinegar. We had to ask for it back.

Finally, this place is really a joke. When you call a place LEGENDARY, it's reputation is vaunted, by its length of it in business, at least, arbitrarily, around 30 years; it has served actual LEGENDS, this being Vegas, it should have served and has documented patronage by Sinatra, Elvis, etc. And to be a legend, it really should be respected and renown; Carmine's IS A LEGEND IN THEIR OWN MIND, ONLY. Look at their sign: ESTABLISHED 1990. THAT IS HARDLY A LEGEND. Overstated, just tooting their own horn, with nothing to back it up. With all the great Italian restaurants here in Vegas I am sorry we even went here. Appropriate descriptions would have been "Famous Italian food", or "Celebrated Italian Cuisine". LEGEND? Since only 1990? Have you noticed true legendary places? Vacheron watches, depuis (since) 1755. So give me an effing break Carmine's.

I also politely told them there, and through their comment place, at their website, of my utter disappointment. No reply. In other words, they don't really care about customer service. All they want is $$$$. This place may go on for a while due to foot traffic. But you can rest assured I DO NOT AND WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AT ALL. I'd rather go to Buca or the many other fine Italian restaurants here in Vegas.

A great place to do family style. They serve huge portions. We had calamari, rigatoni, spaghetti and meatballs, chicken parm. My favorite were the calamari and chicken parm. The meatballs were delicious as well. The rigatoni was nothing special. Overall good service and the only complaint I had was the menu may be on the walls but the text is too small. And the prices aren't listed as well.

Super fun meal our first night in Vegas.  Firstly, I love going to Ceasar's Shops at the Forum, such a beautiful area.  Carmines is located inside, and although it looked full, they found a table for my hubs and I.

We were surprised to find that food is "Family Style", i.e. portions of everything they serve are for 6 or more people.  So this is a better option for groups.  But hell with it, we decided to order things anyway....  They serve great New York-style Italian food, and LOTS of it!  (*Note: we had so much food leftover, we gave some to the table next to us.. they then gave us some Calamari, which was really very good).

Started with Carmine's salad--  excellent!  Big enough for 8 people, but we scarfed down plenty of it, so good.   I ended up buying one of their cookbooks, mainly just to get that recipe!  Ordered Chicken Parmesan for entree, also great.  After dinner, found they had Decaf Espresso-- hurray!  

Staff were all EXCELLENT-- from the hostess to the waiters to the busboy-- they were all so friendly, nice, efficient, great.   A very fun Iand FILLING!) dinner to start our Vegas vacation.  Glad we did, we'll be back (but next time with friends!!)

La démesure a l'américaine avec des assiettes gargantuesques infinissables par une personne seule. Il vaut mieux s'y mettre à 4 pour une assiette de pâtes, et encore... 

Nous n'avons pas osé le dessert "Titanic" qui doit être autour des 5000kcal.

Vin servi dans un verre de table, pain sans intérêt mais service attentif (comme partout a vegas).
The bar happy hour is amazing. Very generous servings and happy hour prices. The meatball slides are the best.

We wanted to try Carmine's when we were in midtown Manhattan a couple of months ago but it couldn't compete with the nearby Shake Shack. It's good they opened in town. First thing you need to know, all the servings are huge! Come hungry with a big group. Last night it was just me, my wife and our toddler son. There were so many things on the menu which was posted on the wall. I was told this was intended so you will get up from your table and check out what the other patrons were having. We decided to order a custom Veal Saltimbocca on angel hair pasta. The flavors were simple, nothing to really write home about. Next time we'll bring the whole family so we can try more. Service was good, servers were very attentive. Also on the pricey side, but I guess that's justified by the large servings.
Great food and great service.....came here with a large group, hands down the best Italian restaurant I've ever been to.The atmosphere was cool , casual and a bit nostalgic.cant wait to come back!

We arranged a dinner for my family this past weekend.  It was reasonable cost and a ton of amazing food!  Very easy to arrange - the event coordinator, Stephanie, was a dream to work with.  They even put our family crest on the menu cards they printed for us!  The waiter, Michael, was patient and extremely helpful!  They even called security to get a wheelchair for my elderly uncle so he didn't have to walk as far when leaving.  And they were able to get a four course meal served and get us to our show in time.  I would highly recommend to anyone that wants a great dinner!

Good food, bad service.
Hostesses who think they work at a nite club.
If you ask for butter with your bread they wonder why.
They think it's strange if you want ground pepper with your food.
Nice place and food. The service is not commensurate
With the price you pay.

Went on a Monday for lunch and sat at the bar. Bartender was very nice but sick...manager should have sent her home! Had the meatball here and it was huge but juts warm and not hit and cheese not totally melted. For those prices you just can't give huge portions food needs to be quality too!

Carmine's offers their food in the family-style.  Most of their dishes are so huge that they could feed two people.  Their prices seem to add that notion in there because it is expensive and not worth the price if you were ordering a meal and appetizer per person.  Sharing, maybe; individual, no way.

We were here for a party so they had dishes prepared for us and they were passed around the table.  Therefore, we tried many different dishes so I was able to experience a lot of their dishes.  We began with calamari, mushrooms, and salad.  The calamari was very good and cooked perfectly but the others were not worth mentioning.  The main meal consisted of a few types of pasta and some meat accompaniments. I did not think any were exceptional or worth mentioning either.  The sauce was solid on the spaghetti, however.  

The atmosphere at the restaurant, located in the Forum Shoppes, was nice, but the food underwhelmed unless the only reason you are coming here is to have leftovers for the next day, also.

Overall was a great experience ! 4 of us shared the spicy chicken wings, penne vodka, and shrimp scampi . The food was very good the service was impeccable Michael Baker made the night for us and the food was a plus!  Great ambience, good bar, and comfortable seating. Absolutely good for date night and Fantastic for families, or any occasion!  For locals is worth the drive , Ceasars Forum valet does not charge to park ! Definitely going back to try out the menu!

The service here was great. Leo was personable and attentive. Wish I had a large group with us so that we could try more. The portions are huge. Each dish that came out of the kitchen looked amazing. It was my first time having portabella parmesan, and I'll definitely have it again. The pasta was perfect. The cheesecake was divine.

Super good food and if you go during happy hour from 9:30pm-closing the food is great and affordable as far as the tasters and happy hour drinks! Regular priced meals are full price but can feed a army so becareful! Located in the Cesar's forum shops area!

Their calamari fritti was surprisingly good!  I also really liked the broccoli and had seconds of it.  Some of the other dishes we had (lasagna and manicotti among others) were good.  Not spectacular, not really good, just good.  The bread they served was weird and cold, and no olive oil.  I think my perception is a little colored because I couldn't drink.  So A-OK definitely describes it... I would go back, but if I were specifically looking for Italian and didn't have a large group, I know I could find better.
Really good place. Food is large portions. I really enjoyed the atmosphere! I have been here twice and both times the food was very good and consistant.
It was a good restaurant crowded but it was a Saturday. Went with my sister and friends to celebrate her birthday. The portions are huge!!! And very. Beware the white sauce is not creamy.

GF and i stopped in during happy hour and sat at one of the bar high tables for a quick bite. Great selection of authentic, family style Italian cuisine. Ambiance is great, especially being located in the busy shopping area of Caesar's.

Reasons for my mediocre 3-star review: 

slow service...there were two other tables besides ours, and we waited 10min til we were asked if we wanted something to drink...another 12min til we could order our food...then over 20 til we started eating. (during busy hour, that wouldn't be bad...but there was only 5 tables seated in the whole restaurant at the time)

and the other thing that bugged me...ordered a hot sandwich (which was great...and huge!!) but i asked if my GF could have a little side plate of spaghetti w/ marinara instead of the side salad, but was immediately and definitely shut down. not a 'oh, let me see what i can do' or a 'that will be a $$ upcharge' etc etc. just a flat outright NO. c'mon, we're only two people and don't want to order a family size boatload of spaghetti just to try it. pretty sure that could have been arranged. 

anyways, i'd caution any small parties from going in...will be hard to find appropriate sized dishes to order. but for larger groups who are open to sharing dishes family style, this would be fantastic

This is by far some of the best Italian food I have ever ate. Please do not confuse this with the Carmine's pizza spot in. Vegas these are 2 different places. Everything is family sized. The waiter told us to try the rigatoni and broccoli along with calamari for an appetizer, the portions were so big it was only 2 of use it was enough to feed 4 people . The staff is very friendly and inviting. Prices are a bit high but when your eating this good it counts. I recommend this to anyone looking to eat some really good southern Italian food.

My wife and I came here after a show.  We weren't hungry enough for a whole dinner, but wanted an appetizer or desert.  We ended up getting the stuffed mushrooms and chocolate cake.

The place has a nice ambiance.  Our server was very nice.  He did disappear for LOONGG periods of time, and we spent a fair amount of time waiting.  (The restaurant was empty.)  But he was very courteous and friendly other than that.

The food was not great.  I love stuffed mushrooms, but I was not impressed with these.  The stuffing had a mushy, porridge-like texture.  It was kind of gross.  After one bite, I scooped most of the stuffing out and just ate the mushrooms themselves.  The word "goop" sums up the stuffing, and that's not a word you want to use with stuffed mushrooms.

The chocolate cake was quite good, but very rich, and my wife and I could only handle a few bites.  I have no problem with having a rich dessert that you can't eat a lot of, provided they bring you a portion size that reflects the fact that you can't eat more than a few bits.  But this was an enormous piece of cake, and a price to match.  That doesn't work if the cake is so rich that you can only stand to eat a few bites.

For goopy stuffed mushrooms, a large piece of super-rich cake, and two cokes, we spent about $60.  The food (especially the goopy stuffing on the mushrooms) was not good enough to make us return; the price makes it a "definitely won't be back."
Love Carmine's! It's very very close to the ones in NYC. It's festive with good food and a fun atmosphere!  Check it out!

Amazing! We just had dinner here for a group of 50 for our wedding in fabulous Las Vegas on Friday. It was absolutely incredible. Stephanie was our event coordinator and we did not have to worry about a thing! She was insanely quick to respond to any and all of our questions. We came to Vegas with a group of 5 a year prior to do some recon and after enjoying the food and service at Carmine's first hand, there was no question this was the place! 

We booked the private room with the balcony overlooking the High Roller and everything was awesome! We had so much delicious food (and booze) that everybody was fat and happy at the end of the night! 

The ONLY bad thing I have to say, is that it sucks that we didn't have time to come back for lunch and try some more food! NEXT TIME!!!

Love you guys!
Seth and Danielle

The food and service are great! Family style so come with a few people and be ready to share. We had 4 of us ordered 3 things and still took leftovers back to our hotel. They made for a great midnight snack!

Great place for lovers of Italian food. Prices are built in a way for sharing with a group, many of the pastas ranged around 36-40$. Most plates of pasta can be finished by 2-3 people. Meat portions were big although the veal was very thin. We went with 6 people and were pleasantly stuffed at the end. Coffees/espressos weren't the best, but the food was good.

I did not eat here, just popped in for a drink.
The bartender didn't really seem interested in us being there. The drinks were more expensive then I thought they should be for a class of wine and a shot. 36 dollars later, we were on our way. 

I've heard the food is good and they have great deals on breakfast. I'd try it next time I'm in town to change it up a bit.

We held our Bachelor party dinner here for 25 people.  We were able to get a private room, by booking early with Stephanie.  I have to say that she made everything for our event nice and easy.  Before I start with the food I have to say that our server Michael was amazing he took care of all of our needs and we couldn't have asked for anything more.  The family style servings are great and come with large portions. All the food we ordered was excellent but the items that really stood out were the fried calamari, manicotti, and cannoli.  Thank you to everyone at Carmine's for making our night very special.

Had a great time! This is a family style restaurant and there was only two of us so we sat at the bar. We got lucky because it was happy hour! So we ordered off the happy hour menu and got a cheese steak sandwich with a ceasar salad. the salad was amazing!! The service was also great. She was so friendly and funny! Love this place!

Great food and location in Ceasars Palace. Huge Family style portions. We were able to walk right in and be seated. Waiter (Michael) was very personable and attentive even though he had 4 other tables at the time. We ordered the pasta with the sausage (don't recall thr exact name) and the shrimp in tomato base (again, don't recall the name). The entrees were really good, not excellent, but good. The green salad and zucchini strips, however, were superb. I would recommend both of those to start. The mixed drinks were delicious. I'd definitely eat here again to try some other menu items.
