This was a first visit for all six of us. The portions are huge. We ordered two entries and a salad and had more than enough. The chicken Marsala was terrific. The chicken was very thin, the mushroom gravy was scrumptious. The spaghetti and meatballs was very moist and tasty. The sauce was very thick and flavorful. The anti pasta green salad was yummy, with a delicious dressing. Everyone was impressed and enjoyed the meal.

A rarity on the Las Vegas Strip, good food.  This is family style dining.  Portions are huge.  Ate here with a party of 14 and never had to wait for drinks, the appetizers were very good, and the main courses were fantastic.  Both the lasagna and chicken parm were very good.  It ain't cheap but it is great for large groups.  We sat for 3 hours enjoying a meal and company.

0 stars.  Huge disappointment.  Father in law was always talking about wanting to try this place since couple months ago and was waiting for Carmines to open.  We dined here last weekend and our experience with both food and service was horrid!  Our server never came back to ask if we needed anything else once our meals came out.  Our pasta dish was undercooked.  The clam pasta tasted extremely bland and tasteless.  The meat sauce was boring.  It took 15 minutes and asking 3 different people before we got a basket of bread.  My in laws were so fed up with the slow service and horrible food.  What's going on Carmines???  We will not ever return.

Let's begin with awful. Went here with my family and was originally deterred by the price, but they said the sizes were family and they are. But they messed up my meal TWICE. By the time my family was done eating their overcooked veal and ravioli (the only redeeming part of the meal), they had brought my food out for a third time. We had them box it up because I wasn't about to make my family wait for me to finish. Did they comp the meal in anyway? No. And don't get me started on the service. Unattentive and didn't even ask how the food was, we had to tell them they screwed up. Will NEVER return and do not recommend and wish I could give them zero stars. Thanks for ruining the end of our Vegas weekend.

This is probably one of my favorite places to eat when my family is in town. The staff is very nice and their food is AMAZING! Yes they serve family style, and if you're blind like me you have to walk up to the wall with the menu on it to read it. But other than that it is great. Their veal is to die for, and another one of our favorites is their seafood medley. I highly recommend it!

Come here with a huge appetite and with a group of people who aren't afraid to blow their daily calorie intake through the roof. The food is rich, hearty, and the portions are ginormous and done in family style fashion. 

APPETIZERS
The Fried Calamari is an excellent choice. My group also ordered the Caesar Salad and Mixed Salad. Both were standard. I liked the Caesar, though it had too much dressing for my preference. 

ENTREES
We ordered several other pasta entrees, but below are the dishes that I tried.

Chicken Scarpariello: Skinlesss chicken thighs and breasts that were well-seasoned and flavorful. 

Eggplant Parmigiana: Layers of eggplant, and plenty of gooey mozzarella cheese and marinara sauce.  

Shrimp Scampi: These were gone almost in an instant. The garlicky, buttery shrimp was delicious, and they weren't the tiny frozen variety. 

DESSERT
Titanic:  My group and I sunk the Titanic. This is seriously a massive dessert that requires team effort. Its foundation was a decadent chocolate brownie. On top of that were scoops of ice cream, huge dollops of cream, slices of strawberries and pineapples, a drizzle of chocolate, and a sprinkling of chopped hazelnuts. After we dug in and devoured most of the monstrous dessert, the Titanic resembled the aftermath of the Stay Puft Marshmallow's annihilation in the first Ghostbusters movie. 

SERVICE
The staff did a great job taking care of my group. 

OTHER
There are gluten free options available, such as the Pasta Vodka Sauce.

OVERALL
The food and service is fantastic, and I'll definitely be returning.
I freaking love this place!!  The fact that there is one in Vegas now gives the West coast a piece of the sweet, amazing action now too!
Great place, the staff is magnificent. The food is magnificent and large portions. Great place for larger parties to share food served family style.

When they say family style they mean that. Each entree was huge. It worked to order a few different plates and then we were all able to try it all. We did the porterhouse which was huge and cooked perfectly! The shrimp scampi with penne pasta was also really good. Had perfect flavor and enough flavor to cover the pasta with great flavor. Also ordered the lasagna and that serving was also huge and really good. It came with beef and veal in the meat sauce. 

Our server was really nice and honest about the dishes. She was attentive and made sure we had our drinks and water in the table. 

This place was a great pick for dinner even though it was a pretty nice walk from our hotel. We did make a reservation, not sure if it was necessary but didn't want to chance it and nit be able to get in when we got there.

Now this is what an Italian family style restaurant should be. Generous portions of delicious Italian food served in a cherry atmosphere by attentive, welcoming waiters. The Caesar salad was properly dressed and served with anchovies in the side. We had the spaghetti and meatballs and shrimp scampi. Tomato sauce was thick, rich and generous. Meatballs were moist with just a hint of garlic and cheese. Mama would be proud. Highlight of an already fantastic meal was the scampi. Not the butter and garlic drenched monstrosity served elsewhere. These were succulent shrimp seemingly baked in garlic, butter, white wine and parsley, with a seasoned bread crumb crust. This was the kind of dish that makes you smile. Simple Italian done right.

GLUTEN FREE AVAILABLE.  But dang they portions big!!! We sat in the bar area so we could have the smaller bar portions and they were still huge.  And a huge plus is that they have gluten free options.  I had the vodka sauce with a side of sausage--yep side of sausage.  It was very good.  I would go back just because they offer gluten free.

Went to dinner there with some friends busy place!!! Recommend call first make reservations you will get seated faster otherwise 45 min wait! Big place clean and great music and friendly staff ready to help you and serve,we sat and ordered some angel hair pasta and meatballs family size and chicken pecans with a nice gravy on it looked great and was served fast we also had the red dry sangria which was ok not great but ok and we sat and enjoyed our food and it was great our server was quick and on the spot for got his name but he was ok and gave us great food choices to try!!! Love this place so far but half way threw the meal a real strong fish oder came threw the whole place and stayed and was making me almost taste the fishy smell it was nasty had to go to the bath room and throw up it was so bad!!!!! So that kill it for me but everyone else noticed the smell but never said anything so I kept it to myself and drank my sangria and talked to my guest who just flew in from Tampa and they were having fun so I went with the flow and didn't make a seen so thought I would put it in my review and hope the get rid of that smell!!!!! Bad calamari smell threw out the whole place..... bad  fish smell but great food otherwise..... steve

True family style eating.  The portions of food are huge!  Normally I can eat everything in sight but  on this trip I got a lot of stuff to go.  We were invited to eat from the awesome hostess that works there.  She warned us to come hungry and not to eat anything all day.  We started off with the fried calamari which is probably the best calamari in Las Vegas.  I'm willing to defeat anybody in arm wrestling over that statement.  This calamari seems to melt in your mouth like an m&m.  Stuffed mushrooms was pretty good as well.  

The next portion was a big ol' plate of ragu with spaghetti.  It had meatball and italian sausage links and pork butt.  The pork butt was outstanding.  The italian sausage kinda gave me heart bun later that night but that was ok.  

The next dish was Chicken marsala.  Two words.......The Bomb.  One more word...Delicious!  

Desert was strawberry shortcake and bread pudding.  The portion side of this dish was titanic.  I wasn't able to sink it though.  If I ever decide to go back I'tt definitely have to be with a crew or a small gang.
Huge portions. The shrimp scampi lacked a sauce. The wings and lasagna were some of the best I've had. This was true Italian food with the scenery to match

Deliciousness! A mouthful of bursting flavor. This is my new found glory for when visiting in Vegas! Everything from the service, atmosphere, location and most importantly the food all was on point. Thank you Italiano! =}
As soon as i land this is the first place i run too. Service...amazing. Food ...delicious. Doesn't matter if you are at the New York or Vegas location, its like going home!

This is a family style Italian place with great food. The entrees are served family style and are big enough to feed four people. However on top of the great food this place has excellent service. Despite the place being busy we did not wait long for our food which was hot and fresh. This is worth the wait

A group of 8 of us walked into here and looked at the menu on the wall, first in shock over the prices listed next to the dishes. However, we found out that these were family sized plates to share. After the shock subsided, we decided to sit down.

We knew we wanted a salad, so the waiter had suggested getting 2 salads because each salad would feed 2 or 3 people. We got the mixed green salad, two of them. As for the main, we all decided to share the Eggplant Parmigiana and the Rigatoni & Broccoli. Again, the waiter suggested we get a third main dish as he didn't think it would be enough for the 8 of us, but we held off this time. 

When the salad came out, boy did we feel the waiter kind of misled us. The salad was HUGE, it probably could have fed 5 of us comfortably. I don't know if it has to be said, but there was plenty of salad uneaten by the end of the meal. The salad was average, I think the only reason I enjoyed it was because I was craving greens/vegetables. Again, when the two main dishes came out, we were really glad we hadn't ordered a third main as the waiter advised. These family sized dishes are no joke. Nothing memorable popped out for me for the mains, I was hungry and I was full after I ate, the dishes were neutral to me - they weren't particularly bad or good. 

If you want a place to just eat a lot of blah tasting carbs, this is the place for you. However, there are a lot of other options in the area. Plus, the per glass wine costs were a bit steep. Plus, the waiter was not friendly at all. That is all.

The food here was amazing, but that was the only high point for us. As soon as we arrived service was less than expected. As a table of women they sat us in a terrible spot basically with the dishwashing. They were very accommodating when we asked to move though, we appreciated that. Then service continued downhill. Our server had three tables, he'd visit us every fifth lap, while tending to the other two frequently. We waited like 15 minutes for someone to offer us a box or check. Disappointing they treated us that way due to assuming we were women who wouldn't spend enough to serve us well. Won't be returning.

We are avid fans of Carmine's in New York and just went to the Carmine's at the Forum in Las Vegas. The food was the same, portions enormous as always and the decor definitely felt the same. We especially loved 2 things. We were able to get in without the reservations having to be made weeks in advance, and it was not as noisy. We had a wonderful waiter (Joey V) and will definitely return.

Excellent place for groups, family style Italian -- One of our main courses ordered was the lasagne -- amazing!

Ambiance was full of energy, yet casually elegant none-the-less.... Very kind and quick service!

I LOVED Carmine's when we lived in DC. Me and my husband used to go and get the chicken saltimbocca and an app of calamari at least once a month if not a couple times a month. I was  so excited when I saw a Carmine's in Caesars. The day after I saw it I brought my sister here talking it up. The chicken saltimbocca was good. My sister ordered the greens salad. Eh. I didn't care for it. But our service was AWFUL!!! I was so excited and talking to the server and she just failed in every way possible. It was extremely disappointing. I won't go back to this location. Idk if the one in AC is still there maybe I'll try that one next time I'm there.

Don't make the mistake of going to Carmines. Go to Rao's, they won't disappoint you there.

Would not go and would not recommend again.
Really disappointed.
I have been coming to carmines for 4+ years based on my brothers recommendation. My brother is a Las Vegas local.

Had the worst experience last night.
Ordered; bottle of wine which was not brought out when ordered, instead I needed to remind them when the appetizers came out. So we had no wine until the food was served. Appetizers; baked clams (not as good as usual, over cooked on top, too hard to chew), side of meatballs (was ok and really the only shining light of the dinner). Entree; penne vodka which was terrible. Sauce was runny, not creamy, with giant cloves of garlic. Almost as if some ingredients had been left out.  Penne vodka was sent back only to have it brought back to the table 2 minutes later to be clearly the same dish only nuked with overly cooked pasta added to the grotesque dish. Which was then sent back again and I asked for it not to be remade.
The pasta was taken off and the female manager (Dani) did come over to speak with me. She attempted to resolve the situation by bringing out 6 Cannoli (3 to go and 3 for the table). I am deathly allergic to pistachio nuts and the Cannoli were covered. I told the woman who brought them out that I was allergic and she said no problem and that she would bring out some Cannoli without pistachio nuts. The manager Dani, also came over and I told her as well. I waited 20-25 minutes for the Cannoli to be brought out to the table and finally gave up and left. 

Regret going to Carmines and wish I would have gone to Rao's. 
Food and service are superior.
Great food and service. Shrimp cocktail was fantastic. Portions are huge and food is served family style so order to share! Even the salad is large enough to share.

What an incredibly fun place to dine! It's an awesome place if you've got a big group of folks to feed. All of Carmine's entrees are served family style. We had around 20 in our party and the staff took care of us with military precision. We were never rushed and were taken care of perfectly. All of our entrees were delicious and very ample in their serving size.

My friend and I were trying to find somewhere to eat when we stumbled across this restaurant! Took one look at the menu and we walked right in. We didn't make any reservations but the wait wasn't long. 

First off, the portions are huge. Our waiter suggested that the both of us share an entree and I'm glad we listened.  We still had lots of left overs to take home after! The chicken Parmesan was delicious. Also, the bread is addicting. Pretty sure that's the reason we decided on only ordering one entree. 

Now that I know it's a family style restaurant I will definitely be returning with a group! I heard that happy hour has a smaller serving size so I will have to come back for that!

Love carmines and have been to both NY locations, Atlantic city and vegas before. But they changed the penne ala vodka!!! Does not taste like the penne vodka that they made me fall in love with!!!! The mixed green salad is so huge and refreshing and delicious and i cant wait to have it again!!

One word:  Forgettable.

It's only been a couple months since I was in here, and already I've forgotten what we ate... I remember the group we were with... I remember the service was attentive to our large party... And I vaguely remember the interior. But the whole experience was just, very, forgettable.  I even had to double check to see if I've written a review of thyet, is place or not.

Twelve hungry Italians can make for some serious caloric debauchery and yesterday was no exception.  Our doll of a waiter actually laughed at the amount of food we  ordered!! Here's what we had (keep in mind, there were five kids and seven adults and everything is served family style): 

--mixed green salad--delicious, every morsel was devoured 
--Caesar salad
--broccoli--yummy
--eggplant parmesan--incredible
--spaghetti with meatballs
--rigatoni with Bolognese (my fave) 
--Porterhouse--kids liked it (didn't love because it came with some garlic rub on it)
--chicken scarpariello--ok, could've used more sauce

We left happy and it goes without saying that we took a long walk and skipped dinner!!!  All and all, it was delicious.
Stefanie the event coordinator was amazing, along, with the staff and the mass amounts of food for our wedding reception. Highly recommend!

Went here with my gf last week for lunch at around 2pm. It was our first time. We actually came here because of the reviews on yelp. The food was mediocre this is why I rated it as 2 stars. But the waiter Frank P was horrible.  Unprofessional, inattentive, and nonexistent. I am not exaggerating when it came to his profession as a server. 

We walked in got seated waited for our waiter for about 5 minutes. Saw another family get seated. A waiter approached them right away and took their drinks. Then he came over to our table didn't ask what we wanted to drink and told us about the food. He came back in about 20 mins. The other family already received their drinks and salad. At this point I was already getting impatient. He comes by after 20 mins and takes our order. We ordered the stuffed artichokes and a pasta dish. We waited and waited. Didnt know why it took so long since it was not busy. Didn't get our stuffed artichokes until another 25min at this point I was so hungry that I wasn't even mad when the appetizer had come. Not once did he check up on us. Then not long after our appetizers came our main dish arrived. They did not even give us plates. Our waiter was no where to be found and we had to ask a host to give us plates. At this point I was outraged. The food was ok but for it's reputation I expected better food. Then finally after being there an hour half he shows up asks how we were  doing while eating our meal. After finish eating we sat there waiting for our waiter Frank. After  15 mins we found him asked for our check and he puts our bill on the table said nothing. I did not want to leave a tip but it is so hard for me not to. So I only had given him 15% rather the 20%.  We didn't get a proper greeting or a proper farewell. We left disgusted of the service. I would not come here again because the service  was so bad. I expect bad service from a pit stop on a self serve buffet but not this place.  It was an unpleasant experience. I would  be more lenient if it was super busy but it was not busy at all. Just a lousy server.

This review is based solely on he food.I can honestly say that this has got to be the absolute worst Italian Meal I have had in my 41 years of walking this earth, and that's including frozen pasta dishes from the supermarket & even a meal from Olive Garden. I have eaten Italian food at 5 star establishments so I'm not your average inexperienced customer. We ordered as an appetizer the fried zucchini. The zucchini came piled high and looked kind of like shoestring fries . This appetizer OMG simply made my stomach turn. I could not taste Zucchini at all!!!!! I could only taste old burnt oil and breading. I love Zucchini a lot and this was a huge let down and a complete waste with the quantity we did not eat. For our entree we ordered Chicken Saltimboca because it NORMALLY would be my husbands favorite thing to eat. The chicken was pounded so super thin and over cooked and lacked flavor despite the prosciutto and cheese on top. The only flavor you could taste in the entree was the brown gravy like sauce/substance that completely overpowered the entire dish. We also ordered Spinach as a side, this was not entirely horrible it was rather nice in fact I would have liked it to be served hot however rather than room temp.

Fabulous place for a group dinner! I was able to make a reservation via opentable for my bachelorette party of 13 with no problem. I had been to the restaurant in NY so I knew the portions were good size. They were very nice to us and accommodating! Only bad thing is we ordered 2 salads, 2 other apps and 6 entrees which was WAY WAY WAY too much food. We could have all split one salad and maybe 3 entrees tops. All things considered, the meal was an incredible amount of food for the cost.  I docked a star because the waiter should have told us not to order so much food and it would have been way less money per person. Overall, I would def say thing place is great for groups. Big bang for your buck.

Aloha, Carmine's is a classy bar/restaurant traditional design with heavy dark woods, nice.  We sat at the bar for a quick cocktail before meeting the group - really good happy hour prices and great calamari to go with, yum!  Would love to come back for dinner.

On 11/11/17 my family went to Carmines for.my daughters 40th birthday. 500 dollars.later asked if they had a birthday desert for my daughter. And was told we'd have to buy a 30 dollar desert. Because the chef would be mad if.he.gave her a small scoop of ice cream. Bad business I'd never return. Food was fair. server scared of chef.
Crazy. Won't be back
The food was delicious. We ordered family style and left very stuffed. The portions were more than enough for all  4 of us.  We would definitely come here again.

Some very reasonable, large format, Italian wines... so that was cool. We got the lasagna and spaghetti with rigatoni - both safe dishes in mixed company. Both were served family style in HUGE portions. There was so much food that we ended up having left overs even after only having ordered 2 dishes for 4 people. Think Maggiannos... only bigger. 

The lasagna was pretty good, the spaghetti, not so much.

I very much enjoyed Carmines.  I've been to their NY location and this was right on par.  Sat at the bar with my guest and enjoyed basketball and some great food.  Drinks were priced reasonably and maybe even poured a tad heavy, which was great.  The food was HUGE as it's served family style but the prices are totally fair.  The challenge with eating at Carmines with 1 other person is that you have to agree on your dishes.  But since we did, it worked out great.  We had the fried zucchini to start and the manicotti as an entree.  Food, in total, was less than $45 and more than we could eat.  That, my friend, is a bargain considering the location and quality.  It's much cheaper than Rao's and I found the food substantially better, too.  You are getting a dish that serves 3 - 4 for the price of a single entree at Rao's.  Heck, it's about the same price as a burger at Ramsay's.  The service is similar and very good, also.  This will be our new go to Italian on the strip for sure.
Food was very good, very friendly server would definitely eat here again. Wish there was one in Socal

We came here to celebrate my grandma's 70th birthday and there were about 40 of us, we had a private room upstairs with a balcony with a great view of the strip. We had about 3-4 servers that assisted us, it almost felt as if we had the restaurant to ourselves (which we did not) but we had the whole second floor to ourselves lol. We opted for this restaurant because my grandma loves Italian food and they do family style dining here so it was a great choice.

The restaurant itself was very beautiful and made you feel at home, there were lots of pictures gracing the walls. It was very reminiscent of Maggiano's and Buca di Beppo as far as the decor goes. It's very welcoming and spacious, lots of seating and the people here are so friendly.

We already had a set menu for the occasion, for the appetizers we had Caesar Salad and Calamari, for the pasta we had Lasagna and Linguine with Shrimp in white sauce, for the entrees we had Chicken Marsala and Chicken Parmigiana and for dessert we had Italian Cheesecake and Strawberry Shortcake. We had 3 tables full of people and each table was given two of each dish, talk about an overwhelming amount of food. There was so much food I wasn't able to taste everything (I made the mistake of filling up on their delicious bread before appetizers arrived lol). The Caesar Salad was very good and fresh, it wasn't drowned in dressing and it had a good flavor. Their Lasagna was amazing, it was the biggest portion I'd ever seen. It was layered with yummy ricotta cheese, lots of meat but I wish there was a bit more sauce because we all were fighting over the little sauce that was in the serving dish! The Linguine with Shrimp was also very good, the shrimp were more like prawns and they were quite generous with the amount given. The shrimp were cooked perfectly as was the linguine and the wine sauce was so delicious. But my favorite dish was the Chicken Parmigiana, it was seasoned, breaded and cooked to perfection!! The nice layer of Mozzarella on top as well as the yummy marinara complimented it well although it would have tasted perfect by itself. If I was not full at that point I surely would have had to big pieces. Lastly I tried the Italian Cheesecake for dessert, it was definitely different. It was very light and airy not like the typical cheesecake and it had a bit of a lemon flavor. 

Overall this restaurant was amazing and the food was amazing, definitely in my top 5 for Italian restaurants. I will gladly be back when I'm in town.

Very disappointed. Came here with my family. Everything. We had was super salty. We were so sad because we just came back from the Grand Canyon and was so hungry. Ordered he chicken parm, ziti, and pasta with meat sauce. We didn't finish the food (barely touched it) and gave it to someone on the streets. What a waste of money. Terrible experience. Even the server was kind of rude.

Wow, Olive Garden quality food and wine at 2 1/2 - 3 times the price!

The Chicken Parmesan was just OK, it tasted like everyone else's except if I remember correctly it was $35.00!!! We let the waiter pick a good wine and it was so bitter neither of us finished our glasses.

Asked to see the manager and we were told he was busy...

So my family and I were looking for an authentic Italian restaurant because we've never been able to find a decently priced one. So we tried Carmine's after reading reviews and seeing that it was averagely priced compared to other restaurants. After eating there it definitely could use some improvements

A major negative about the restaurant was that I was surprised at how they don't have menus and they looked at me weirdly when I asked them about menus. I mean 99.9% of restaurants have menus so I don't why it's weird asking about it. I don't think any Italian restaurants that I've ever gone to don't give out menus. I suppose it was meant to save costs but I just don't get the logic behind this strategy especially when new customers who come here can easily be turned off by this weird lack of menu experience. Now you can say everyone doesn't mind, however when I went there I saw at least two tables sit down and leave after walking back and forth to look at the menu on the wall. I mean when I go into a restaurant I expect to see menus that way I can converse with people i'm eating with about what to eat and such, especially with dishes that I have to share. So once we sat down they said that menus were on a big screen at the wall and If I wanted a menu I needed to take a picture of it with my phone or stare at it from my table or go up there and look at it. Problem was that the menu on the wall only covered certain portions of the restaurant and certain tables couldn't get a clear view of the menu and my phone was almost dead from a day full of sight seeing. When you make a menu on the wall make sure everyone can see it from a table, that way people can talk to each other in what they want to eat especially since all dishes are shared. That way customers don't have to keep going back and forth and risk higher chances of collisions with waiters, staff, other customers or even cause accidents on spilling food and drink on other people who were all dressed nicely. There's a higher risk of accidents occurring when you have that many people moving around a finite spaced environment. Their menu wasn't even that overly complicated so it could easily be a page or even used as a place mat for eating. So many ideas available when deciding your menu. Then they have certain tables not occupied near the menu wall, because I imagine it obstructs the view of the menu or that people would hate the idea of people walking back and forth around you while you're trying to enjoy a meal. Kind of a waste of real estate for a restaurant and loss revenue when those tables can easily be filled. So a lot of problems could be solved if they just created a menu.

Now another minor negative was the food. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't amazing either. The pasta, meats, veggies, and even seafood were all exceptionally fresh. You can taste it. Nothing feels mushy, dried or like it's been sitting in the fridge for months. Everything is exceptionally fresh. The only problem was that the food wasn't really hot. It was warm. My family ordered the Prime Rib special on Saturday and it was warm. It was delicious but it was warm. If it was hotter the food would've easily been a 9/10. I mean if I'm paying that kind of price for that food I expect a certain level of quality. 

The prices were insane. Just ordering two dishes you can easily top $150. We ordered 3 dishes so you can imagine how expensive it was. The prime rib special on Saturday was $95. But they said it could feed four people. If your family are big eaters like mine, then 2 people could easily finish that. Pastas start at the mid $35 range but adding substitutions adds another $15 to it. Portions are average for that price I would say, 

The major positive about Carmine's was our waiter. He was decent and was constantly helping us probably the only decent staff member of the whole place. Especially when we wanted a new table because their typical 4 person table wouldn't have been able to accommodate 3 full plates of food. So remember to ask for a bigger table if you're a big eater.

And like I said earlier some tables have absolutely no view of the menu and you could really tell which were the good tables and which were the bad ones. 

Would I go there again? Maybe. It wasn't anything memorable, especially for that price.

NATALIE must be your waitress!! It's not so often we meet someone so attentive, especially when it is a very busy Sunday night. 
This was our first time dining here. We enjoyed the ambiance, the music , plus we sat at the bar top so we were more away from the crowd. The bar menu had smaller portions, but this was definetely enough for two plus a lot left to take with you to enjoy. I recommend the blood orange Italian soda, the fried zucchini  and the hearty  Bolognese sauce with your favorite pasta!!!

I came here with my family during a business trip.  We had reservations and got in promptly, although traffic  was awful.  The service was extremely slow, taking over 45 min just to get our appetizer.  Once we got it, the stuffed mushrooms were very soggy and not very good for $18.  Our main course came about 30 min later.  The portions are very large, family style.  The food was average with soggy pasta and thin, rubbery chicken.  The sauce was very thin.  The whole meal took about 2 hours for three people.  If you're trying to feed a large group for a reasonable price, this might be ok but for a small family there are better, higher quality options for the money.

Service was great and the food was hot, flavorful and very tasty. We came with our two kids (7 and 5) and were welcomed with kindness. We look forward to coming back next time we are in town. We all had a great meal and fantastic dining experience.

It might be a little bit expensive, but I probably think that because I went here with just one other person. Carmine's is really a place that you shouldn't visit unless you have four or more people.

We ordered a salad with balsamic vinaigrette, strawberries, arugula, candied walnuts and much more. It was MASSIVE.

After that, we ordered a dish that had multiple types of meat in it such as chicken, sausage, and potatoes.

I would definitely come back here again I just need to be with more people so I can actually eat all of the food. Those two dishes cost about $100 with drinks.

This was delicious! We came with a rather large group, about 10 people that they easily sat in the middle of the restaurant. 

The menus are on the walls, they do not pass them out so pack your glasses if you are near sighted. They do share a wine menu and cocktail list with the table so you do not have to squint to read the labels. 

We ordered one Caesar salad to split for the table - absolutely plenty for 10 people. Then ordered two pastas and two meats for the table. Again absolutely plenty, there was even left overs. Listen to the server when they advise you on how much to order because they know better than you do, believe me. 

The food was delicious! The wine was great and the atmosphere was lovely. It's a wonderful Italian restaurant that I would definitely suggest if you are looking for a place in Caesars.

We ordered the wings and meatballs and spaghetti.  The wings were good just a bit salty.  The meatballs were good.  Family style dishes.  Bread basket with varied bread.  We were a bit confused on who was our server because we had more than one come to our table which caused miscommunication. It seems that's how they work there.  It would have been nice if they would have told us before hand.  Overall good meal,  you get what you pay for.  Go check em out.  Plenty of leftovers for another meal.

I took a risk on this place on having my wedding dinner held here without tasting the food first and never been here before. My best friend recommend this place I trust her judgement good thing I did the dinner was great family orientated style big dishes and a lot of food. It has been a year later my family until this day still talks about the food and tiramisu cake.  On our one year anniversary my husband and I came back to celebrate we tried porterhouse steak it is the best steak I have ever had it just melt on your mouth it is pricey but it is so worth it.
This place is delicious...huge portions but Wow!!! So worth it.  The lasagna was to die for. Totally recommend Carmine's.  Bread basket is great too!!!!

My favorite NY restaurant from back home comes to my current city?! Hell yes. I havent had good Italian since moving here 4 years ago, inexpensive, great for groups and you ALWAYS leave with leftovers! Highly recommended for anyone looking for that east coast TASTE thats impossible to find here. (also some really cute hostesses)
Came here for lunch.... my first time at any Carmines portions are huge I need a nap, delicous  and great service

The best steak we've EVER had. Went for V Day, wanted to try something new. Found Carmine's on opentable. Great atmosphere and service. Everything is family style. The wait was shocked when we ordered calamari (yummy!) AND he 3 lb porterhouse w peppers and onions RARE. Not sure why he was so excited by that but that's how my husband and I like out steak. The steak was beautiful tbh and tasted even better. Only complaint, I would ask for all red peppers instead of green and red. Otherwise, amazing! Next time maybe we'll try the porterhouse contadina. I don't like sausage but I'd be interested in trying theirs. We didn't get dessert bc they are huge and for sharing. Will def be back.

Wow! This is THE place for groups! Hands down! Need somewhere to go with 15 people in a pinch... Here is the place. It is just absolutely enormous, and beautiful to boot. We were given a private tour of the place and I couldn't believe all the rooms that this place had! 

We were here last night so it was also nice to see some of the beautiful Holiday  decorations that were up. 

Since it was only the two of us the manager (Jesse) recommended a sampler platter. I forget the name but it had everything, and it was more than enough. (This place is used to catering to larger groups, and family style dinners, it can get quite hard to order for just two people, recommend splitting everything.) The favorite on this dish were the baked calms, absolutely amazing! The least favorite of mine was the cheese ravioli, I thought it was just a bit over cooked. Other items in this dish is sausage and peppers, fried polenta (soo delicious and unique!), mussels, eggplant, stuffed mushrooms and calzones. We also ordered a couple of medium carafes of wine which was perfect.

The manager (Jesse) guided us through the entire menu including our wine selections and everything turned out more than amazing! It was so nice to see a manger take pride in his work, not to mention his striking well groomed appearance! We will definitely be returning.

I was very pleasantly surprised to be presented with a special menu of substitutions available for my food allergy!  My friend and I ended up with a pomodoro pasta dish and a couple of happy hour drinks.  Our server was knowledgeable and attentive and the ambiance was pleasant.

Ran into this place shopping at the Forum in Caesar's Palace. What stopped us was a table with a big bowl of seafood.  It looked like a seafood cioppino. It had everything seafood in it you can imagine, mussels, clams, shrimp, lobster and crab.  The portion comes in a huge bowl, I kid you not.  Ordered a side of garlic bread and the garlic bread came on a huge platter about 2 feet long with 8 huge slices of garlic bread.  The serving is family style.  If you have a big group you will get your money's worth.  If you are a party of 2, you may want to think about eating here.  It was too much food and we ended up only eating half of it.  We took it to go to see if we could find some homeless people on the bridge that connects Caesar's to the other side of the street.  

The ambiance made me feel like I was in New York during the gangster days.  Our waiter had an accent that resembled the guys on the Sopranos.  He was entertaining and very helpful with answering questions from the menu.  We both had a latte after dinner and it was delish! 

I took away one star because the portions are large and there is no ability to order half portions.  A party of 2 cannot finish the portions they provide.  It would be nice if they would consider putting half portions on their menu.  

Restaurant has inside seating and seating along the Forum side to people watch.  If you like to eat, this is the place to go.

We walked in here by accident and boy was I happy we did. It's family style. Huge portions of food for everyone. We had the house salad and fried zucchini to start. It also came with a variety of bread that was very freshly baked. That in itself was very good. For our entrees we had the shrimp Diablo and rigatoni with broccoli and sausage. We had frozen cocktails that were expensive but delicious.Everything was excellent. We finished with coffee that was ok but nothing overly fancy. The price is as advertised. Expensive but worth it.  As a side note all of the other dishes that passed us looked equally as good.

We got the Rigatoni with Sausage and Broccoli. Absolutely terrible.  The sauce was water down and hand no real Italian flavor. It was pretty much just cooked rigatoni. The look of the restaurant was nice but did not go well with the quality of the food . The bread that was served was not cooked and we had to ask for olive oil and vinegar.  Although the concept of having family sized portions sounds good, but when you get bad quality of food it's makes for a bad experience for everyone.

I'm glad I finally got to try this place, but I won't go out of my way to return. We ordered the veal parmesan and lasagna; I like pasta with my chicken parmesan, so I assumed I would want it with veal parmesan as well. It came with 1 pound of pasta! Each entrée was roughly $40 each. Not sure what the charge was for the side of pasta.

I don't generally eat meat, so, this was an indulgent treat for me. Sadly, I just was not that impressed with the veal or the lasagna. Both seemed to taste as if they included canned ingredients. Yes, they give you enormous portions, and claim that everything is served family style. However, I would rather have small to average size portions and good food over ginormous portions and not so great food. 

Service was absolutely exceptional. Had to be the best service received during this visit to Las Vegas. I wish I remembered our servers name because she was outstanding!

Our bill came to just over $100 before tip. This is generally what we spend for dinner in Las Vegas, however, I would've rather had an indulgent dinner at Mastro's or the like. 

When I'm in the mood for Italian food on the strip I'll stick with Maggiano's. At least there I know I'll leave satisfied.

Five stars for the service. However, I'm rating this place two stars overall because it was overpriced and just not that good.

I used to work here in the Forum Shops and was one of those anticipating for Carmine's to open and finally got to try them out last week. I came here with a party of 11 to celebrate my aunt's birthday. I must say my aunt and her family are from NY and have eaten at the Carmine's there, so the expectations were set pretty high. I do love the inside of the place especially how the high raised ceilings have all sorts of pictures hanging on the walls. If only the restaurant was in a stand alone building then it would truly give that Manhattan feel. Before anything was served we noticed that the plates were at the end of the table, my aunt expected the server to place each plate in front of us because that's what the server did in NY. It didn't happen, so I guess here it's more of a self serve concept. My beverage of choice was the strawberry lemonade since another review mentioned how good and tart it was. She was right I did enjoy the tartness(tasted similar to Red Robbin's Freckled Lemonade), too bad it's not free refill because I sure did finish that drink before the food was served.

So here is the break down of the food:

Carmine's salad- I liked all the additional toppings in this salad like berries, nuts, and salami if I remember correctly. We had 2 salads and assumed they were the same because they looked very similar. After tasting both we realized the other one was a mixed green salad. I prefer Carmine's salad and say it's worth the $3 difference. 

Calamari- pretty standard, wasn't too greasy and the breading was like how I've had it at other Italian restaurants.   

Zuppa Di Clams (white)- I am not a fan of clams but my brother convinced me to try the last piece and I was pleasantly surprised. If you enjoy clams I definitely would recommend this dish, pretty delicious I must say. The sauce for the clams was so good we saved it to put on our pasta.

Broiled porterhouse steak- this was really delicious and I thought it was perfectly cooked with various pieces being rare and medium (refer to the picture). One of the better cuts of steak I've had from a restaurant. Warning this is pricey, costing $80.

Chicken Scarpariello- I read from another review recommending this dish and when we ordered it the server said they were out?! I was shocked at first because I've never heard of a chicken dish running out at a restaurant. Thankfully she came back and said they still had it. It was cooked in a buttery sauce, probably my favorite dish of the night and reasonably price. I will definitely order this the next time I come back. 

There was a pasta dish we ordered but I can't remember what the name was. Next time I come, I'll also order the Rigatoni & Broccoli as recommended by another yelper. According to my aunt and her husband the food was a little on the salty side, but still a good quality in comparison to the one in NY. However the service was lacking. I really want to come back but it probably won't be any time soon. This place was pricey so I'll have to find a special occasion to come here for.

Service was great and food was so good. Serving size is huge so my wife and I sat at the bar where they do 1/2 size servings on some items. This is a must if you have less than 3 people in your party. We had the fried calamari, Caesar salad, and spaghetti with meatballs.  All were great and the waitress was very attentive and answered all the questions we had. We will be back.
Food was amazing. Huge portions. Not many choices for appetizers for only two people. Must try the lasagna.
No place better in Las Vegas to entertain a large group than Carmine's. Great service and family style old-school Italian. The wine list is great and very reasonable. Can't go wrong.

This is absolutely a great place for dining with an empty stomach. And when I say empty please do fast 12 hours prior to coming because the plates are ginormous served with heaping mound of food. If you've never been here don't forget to bring your mom, dad, sister, brother, heck the entire town while you're at it. You'll still have enough leftovers to take home with you. 

They'll start you off with bread. Ask them for the olive oil and balsamic vinegar because they don't just give it. Look up on the wall and you'll find a brightly lit marquee, which has the full menu. Great idea to save money on menus & trees, bad idea for people with poor eye sight. I just pulled up the menu on my phone. No biggie. You can pick any type of pasta and any sauce to your liking and they will gladly make it. 

With just a party of three we had an appetizer and one entree for sharing. It was more than enough to be extremely full and to have leftovers. 
For the appetizer we had the meat stuffed mushrooms, which were amazing. Tasted like a juicy meatball on top of a mushroom. 
For the entree we opted for the linguini with bolognese sauce. The noodles were al dente and the thick meaty sauce was just perfect. On the table there's shaved Parmesan. Don't forget to add that to everything!

Overall great flavor, awesome service, cool ambiance, and the pricing is just right. 

Tip: Do make reservations on holidays & weekend dinners. Lunch time during the week seems to have plenty of open seating. 
Sit at the bar if you're coming in for a quick "small bite" (really it's normal portion-sized). They have great HH.

Come check out the food here. The bartender Mr Fabiano was awesome.  Loved everything here. The manager, Anthony, took good care of us. Happy Hour Beer (Perino) and Red Wine was perfect with the Meatball angel hair Pasta & Raw Clams. We would be definitely coming back!! 
You guys come check them out for yourself then yelp it...
Love! Love!

I loved the style of the restaurant. It had a New York/ Mob style to it. It was beautiful..... I ordered the shrimp scampi and all the plates are for 2 or more people. ( they are huge portions) I also had a pineapple mojito and it was delicious! Will definitely be back because I want to try some more of their food....which sounded amazing.

This is a family-style upscale Italian restaurant. Large portions for two to three people. Me and the wife ordered a couple of drinks and a cheesesteak. 

This sandwich is definitely meant for two. The ceaser salad it came with was second to none. The dressing is made in house as you can taste the fresh anchovies. 

Overall a very nice play to enjoy a drink and good food at the bar. Thank you to our bartender Joe for a nice time.

He standard of family style Italian food. The menu has all the classics of anything you want. The wine list is not very wide but has a good selection of reasonably priced wines. 
The garlic bread parmigiana is excellent and a must!  The veal parmigiana is excellent and plentiful. The shrimp fradiablo is tasty and not too spicy. The penne a la vodka is cooked to perfection. 3 entrees for 5 people is plenty and with take home. 
Deserts are not homemade so we didn't have any.

Came here for Thanksgiving dinner with the BF's family and some friends. There were 17 adults and 2 kids. We had turkey, mashed potatoes with gravy, carrots, green beans, Brussels sprouts, candied yams, cranberry sauce and stuffing. Turkey was kinda dry. My favorite was the candied yams, stuffing and green beans. Tim loved their Brussels sprouts. Overall food was just so so. It didn't wow me. But I do appreciate the family style serving concept. 

Atmosphere was awesome. Loved the setting. Feels like a big Tahoe hotel. Two stories. And we were at the second level. Downstairs is where they had the bar and smaller tables. Music was great. Perfect for the party. Service was slow, but good. Drinks were always filled. But we had to ask for more bread. My picky eater child only wanted their pizza style bread. 

I'm giving it a 4 star since I don't think it's fair to judge them base off just their Thanksgiving menu.

Our dining experience started off to a bit of a rocky start as they didn't have enough chairs to seat our group.  The manager  kept coming back and forth to me giving me updates and ended up giving us some apps complimentary.  The food was very good and i am glad we waited to eat.  The plates are family style and so we ordered several things off the menu and we all loved all of them! i would definitely recommend!
Wow! This place is great. We ordered chicken Parmesan , salad, and spaghetti and meatballs. Best I have ever had in my life! All of it!' Service was great too ! Our new hot spot while visiting Vegas
Good times good food. A little slow on the service but the size of the portions kinda make it that way. If u want a true Italy meal come stop by. And it's not too pricey.

My wife and I were seated between 2 other couples who had just ordered before us. One ordered calamari and the other couple ordered caprisi salad as apperizers. We didnt order an appy because the portion sizes are MASSIVE. When there appy areived they were huge too. They actually offered us some of theirs too. So we tried both the calamari and the salad. They were the BEST i have ever had. We were both stuffed from what we got from our neighbours. Then the spaghetti and meat sauce came and it was the best we ever had. And i eat spaghetti and meat sauce every where. This place is awesome.

No complaints here--went in with the company while in town for business. Located inside Caesar's Palace on the strip, Carmine's is an upscale, family-style restaurant a la Maggiano's, except darker and more intimate. Probably would be a place Tony Soprano would stop at while shopping in Vegas with Carmine and the kids. I has a couple Negroni's to start, which were a bit different than any standard Negroni recipe I've tasted--very lemon-forward and light in the Vermouth; still tasty, though. The menu is convenient projected onto the side wall, so everybody can view, discuss, and order--neat idea. The table ordered Ceasar Salad, Garden Salad (which I did not sample, but the Caesar was excellent--homemade dressing with the authentic anchovy notes and fresh garlic bite), Lasagna, which was a colossal, seemingly 10-layer monstrosity which was a real crowd-pleaser. Meatballs looked great too, but I did not try one. Manicotti and beef tenderloin were both delicious as well. The only thing I thought was a bit odd was that it was evident they usually do not bring out olive oil for the bread--when we requested it, we got a little caddy with pale, "possibly extra-version" oil usually seen on salad bars. No big deal. It would be tough to go wrong with Carmine's if you're hungry and with a group.

Good old family style Italian. 

Such a fun place to go. Everything is intended to be shared so the portions are HUGE and it's really a great deal price-wise if you split everything with your table. Service was awesome and the atmosphere was fun and lively. 

To be honest, I don't remember all the different dishes we tried (there were so many and I didn't even get to taste them all, I was so full!), but here's what I remember most:

Antipasto Plate: Fun, nice variety. Although, they don't really give enough of each item for everyone to try them all so you kind of had to dive in first in order to get what you wanted. But, all the things I did try was delicious. (They had octopus and smoked salmon!)

Fried Zucchini: Super fun! It came in a gigantic tower. I think my jaw dropped to the floor when I saw just how much zucchini we were getting. Haha. It was tasty, but it basically tastes like a french fry.

Chicken Parmesan: Delicious. I liked this one a lot. Definitely recommended.

Titanic: Whoa, was this dessert a monster! It was so big!! Made of ice cream, strawberries, pirouette cookies, etc. it really was a titanic beauty. I thought we were never going to finish it, but I'm embarrassed(proud?) to say we did...super quickly.

This Italian restaurant is located inside Caesars Palace and it is absolutely incredible! They do family size dinners so we ordered a pasta and their chicken Parmesan and still had lots of left overs (there was 5 of us). We also ordered 2 bottles of wine and their fried calamari (definitely recommend). Our waiter was so nice and helpful, I forgot his name, but he made the experience even better. You definitely should try this place if you're in Vegas, you will not be disappointed!

I am very sad to write this review. I have eaten here and in the New York location multiple times. First off the prices have doubled. For one meal it 39.00 including nothing. We ordered chicken Marsala and it was very very thin and all we tasted was flour. We told our waiter and he took the plate and handed us the bill 70.00 dollars and we left hungry. No manger came over, no apology or offer to get something else. I was so embarrassed that I brought my new boyfriend here and raved how awesome they are . I feel ripped off and very sad

Two of us stopped in for dinner and realized the portions were too big for just two. The staff suggested we eat in the bar using the bar menu where the portions were half the size.
The menu was a little limited compared to the full menu but it had the pasta we wanted. The Bolognese meat sauce with Angel Hair pasta portion was generous and delicious. The calamari appetizer was one of the best I've had.
The atmosphere was perfect 1930-40 and made you forget you were in the casino's shopping mall. The wait staff was attentive and friendly which made for a perfect evening.

In town for a conference and took a customer to dinner.  He actually requested Carmine's in lieu of some gold standard restaurants in the area.  I was very pleasantly surprised!  We started with the calamari.  It was crisply fried and not greasy at all.  Four of us ate the whole platter.  We then split the Porterhouse steak and penne pasta with a rose cream sauce.  The pasta was very good if simple.  The porterhouse was outstanding.  On a cut that size, it is usually tough and difficult to prepare properly.  It was med rare and sliced into thin strips with a little drizzle of garlic butter over the top (butter, no wonder). It was very tender and flavorful. We all commented on how good it was.  

Definitely a solid 3 1/2 stars!

This was my first experience dining in at Carmine's.  I did try the cheesecake at there DC location but only as carry out. As far as the Vegas location, we received a warm greeting upon entry. We sat at the bar and both bartenders were attentive and engaging. We ordered and the food and drinks were fabulous. The portions are huge for the price. I left very satisfied. I definitely will be returning and recommend to any that haven't been.

My girlfriend and I came to Carmine's in Caesars palace looking for some good Italian pasta. At first we were shocked at the prices, but the server assured us that the portions of food are meant for 3-4 people, which indeed they were. We received a basket of assorted bread as we waited for the spaghetti and meatballs that we ordered, but the bread was unappetizingly cold and rather unsatisfying to the palate. The pasta came out within an acceptable time frame, and the pasta was served to us from the family size platter into individual plates. The pasta was very very salty. Indeed if you enjoy strongly salty pasta this is the restaurant and dish for you. I, however, left with lips slightly puffed from excess sodium absorption. 

I will be giving our leftover pasta to the first homeless person we meet on the strip. I hope for his sake that he has access to a lot of clean drinking water.

Overall, I expected better food from a restaurant that received such high ratings on yelp.

Having dined in many Italian establishments & neighborhoods, I was somewhat disappointed with the overall quality and/or or taste of the dishes. The calamari was very delicious and tender no problems there the chicken marsala with seasoned perfectly the olive oil garlic dish was prepared with a chicken broth which made it very soupy like not enough garlic taste and the beef tenderloin was ordered medium and Kim Gray all the way through but other than that the meat was tender. For dessert we ordered tiramisu which came family style as well great presentation great taste. Please note the menu is up on the board and everything is family style each dish can feed about 4 people

Got married in Vegas and came here for our wedding dinner. Very large portions allowed everyone to share and taste multiple dishes. The calamari was a huge hit. Caesar salad was the best dressing I have ever had. Everyone enjoyed their meals and all dishes were cooked just right. Even better, there were left over's for everyone to take home. Staff was very friendly and efficient and best, the chef went out of his way to come out of the kitchen and congratulate us on our wedding. Truly a night we will never forget.

Family style Italian restaurant located in the Forum Shops. This place is amazing. The entree's are huge, meant for sharing, and the prices vary from $37 and up depending on the type of pasta. We started with the calamari appetizer ($28) and the most amazing garlic bread covered with generous portion of cheese. For our entree we ordered the lasagne ($38) that was light and fluffy with a rich tomato flavor, the best I have ever had. This would easily have fed a group of six. Our waiter, Mark, was wonderful. He was very informative with all of our questions and very attentive. Everyone was really nice. The ambience is really cool with high ceilings and framed pictures hung on the walls. I would recommend this place, in fact we are going back again tonight........can't wait.

9 hungry adults ready to eat!! let me tell you, hands down, #1 on my list!! 

All of the servers are very helpful with one another, if it's 1 table, there are 2 servers. 2 tables, there are 3 servers & so forth. 

Last minute decision but we had just enough time to put in a reservation and I am so thrilled we did. Entrees are huge, just enough to serve 3 hungry people. we got 2 appetizers, 3 entrees, & 1 HUGE dessert named the titanic. we all shared everything. I highly recommend the salmon platter. everybody dug into that one within 2 minutes & it was gone. they are ALWAYS refilling drinks, but I will remind you they are not free refills. Very nice atmosphere but don't go here if you are planning a date or somewhere quiet. this place is very up beat & seems to always be busy. I forgot out servers' names' but from the look of it everybody here is nice & guiding. it is a bit pricey, our bill came out to $400+ & a tip so if you're planning on going, have some money ready to spend. recommend this to everybody!!

Happy Hour Times: 2pm-6pm AND 9:30pm - close
Happy Hour Specials: $8-11 food, $5-7 drinks

Walking in, this place looks like one of those family friendly Italian places. It can be a little overwhelming but if you're here for Happy Hour, head straight to the bar area. The bar is huge so there's plenty of room but there are also high top tables in the same area but not attached to the bar for some privacy. 

We came in after a concert and were starving so we were delighted to find out there was a late night happy hour. We ordered quite a few things but the ones that stood out to me the most was the Mussels in Red Sauce and the Fried Calamari. The sauce with the mussels went great with the garlic bread but I would have really preferred it without the melted cheese on top. 

As the waiters brought out food for other tables, the portions looked HUGE. Next time, I'd definitely come back with more people during happy hour so we can enjoy those specials AND order some of the larger dishes.

Very large family style portions.  Spaghetti and meatballs large enough for 4-6 people.  Meatballs were tender and succulent, among the best I've ever had.  They serve Duckhorn Cab by the glass, which was a pleasant surprise!  4 stars because it's a lot of food for 2 people so not very conducive of couples dining.

Not sure how to rate this restaurant.   There was good and ok.  We were with a group of maybe 20 so had a reserved space upstairs.  We had a fixed r ate of 35 pp which is very inexpensive for vegas.  I did not have great expectations for the food.  We got there an hour earlier than our reservation as our meeting ended early.   They could not accommodate us earlier.   Not because of space  but more wait staff.  We got seated exactly when we were supposed  to.  We all got our own drinks from the upstairs bar, there was not drink service for our  group.  I had ice tea, no charge and very good. An assortment of bread  was brought to the table.  No butter, no oil or vinegar.  We were famished and plowed through the bread.  This is a family style restaurant and that was kind of neat.  2 salads, ceaser and house chopped both very good with generous portions.  At some point they brought oil and vinegar for the  bread but no plates and by then most of the bread was gone.  Dinner came, 3 choices of pasta, chicken  and aalmon.  I could not repeat the Italian names of the dishes- we were  all looking words up on our phones.  It was comical.   So the food was amazingly good, almost  perfect.  Not much for service. If you have a large group on a budget this was very good.
Oh my gosh! Sooooo much food! We ordered the calamari appetizer and the cheese ravioli. There were 4 of us. It was more than enough food.

Maybe this is a step up over Buca deBeppo but it's not up to the Olive Garden par.  Service was lacking for dinner on a Saturday night.  We were served bread with no fat.  Had to ask for evoo and vinegar (or butter).  The stuffed artichoke was stuffed with bread crumbs and Parmesan.  I hate bread crumbs!!  UGH   The lasagna was ok, but no veggies...just cheese and noodles.  No whole grain pastas available.  Very frustrating.  We won't be back.  They changed servers on us in mid-stream.  Too pricey.  Seemed like a sports bar setup.

While I was napping, it was decided that we would come here for dinner. We arrived for our reservation and it was busy.  The family portions are huge, seriously, we of course ordered too much and ended up giving our left overs to a hungry looking man on the street, he was thrilled and grateful. (we are good people like that :)- 

Service was ok. Bread was ok. pasta wasn't anything too special. Cesar salad didn't have enough croutons IMHO.  The scrimp was breaded and yummy, we liked that with the angel hair.  We also had penne with bolognese and it was ok, not my choice.  

Not sure I'd recommend coming here with a group smaller than 5, probably a good choice for families.

I was in Vegas for the marathon 11/14 and chose this establishment for my pre race pasta meal. I made reservations (for 2) in Sept for 7PM and they called me 2x on Friday 11/13 to confirm. I arrived at the restaurant at 6:50 and was told there was a delay. At 7:45, I grew tired of waiting and being ignored by the      apathetic host staff and tracked down the manager who got me a table. Chicken parm was rubbery, but the rest of the meal was good, but can be found anywhere on the strip ( Maggianos, Spagos, etc)
My recommendation is to go elsewhere, but if you must dine here, ask for Carl. He was an awesome and funny waiter.

Got duped into ordering too much food for the four of us (2 kids). We originally wanted just some bolognese (2 stars) and some spinach (3 stars), then got talked into ordering the Caesar salad (1 star, super sized and soggy) and calamari (it was also super sized but decent @3 stars). Food was meant for 8 people. Paid as if it was for 8 people. Ended up giving most of it away.

Came here with a group of 13. We got the Caesar salad, Carmine salad, penne a la vodka, spaghetti bolognese, and eggplant parmesan. I wouldn't recommend the eggplant parm, but everything else was pretty good. The plates may seem expensive, but they can serve a lot of people, so per person, it's pretty reasonable. Definitely come here with a big group. Anything smaller, you would only get to try like one dish.

LOVE this place! Big portions, delicious food and house wine is great! I probably come here with spouse, friends and family at least ever other month or so. Definitely my favorite Italian place in town!

Brought clients in for lunch. It's best to valet park at the forum shops and walk over to the restaurant.

I invited clients here since the entrées served family style. I arrived early, secured a table and my waitress started me off with a brewed ice tea. I started us off with an order of Carmine's salad followed by Portobello parmigiana, and lastly sausage broccoli pasta. The quality of food was superb and the portions are massive. My clients and I ate like mob bosses but bosses and they still  took leftovers back to their office.

This was my second visit  here and I'm already thinking about my next visit and trying different  entrées of their wide range of menus items.

We had our wedding reception here on February 21 in the Terraza private room, which has it's own balcony that looks out to the Strip.  Everything was amazing!  Appetizers (calamari, stuffed mushrooms, and Caesar salad), Pastas (shrimp with white sauce on spaghetti, Italian sausage on penne), Entrees (Salmon Oreganato, Chicken Parmigiana), and Desserts (chocolate cannoli and fresh fruit) were all amazing!  All 48 of our guests could not stop raving about how good the food was and how full they were!

Our waiter, Michael, did an amazing job and made sure we were taken care of all night.  He also surprised us with 2 songs and his amazing opera voice!  I have to give a special thank you to Deidre Kennedy, our special events coordinator.  She was such a delight to work with and made our day as seamless as possible.  She even met with me earlier in the day to go over exactly how I wanted the room and our wedding items set up.  

Awesome food!  Awesome service!  I know we will continue coming here on our frequent trips to Vegas and whenever our guests return, they will as well :)

This place is as good as it gets. Family style servings with wonderful service Carmine's is headed in the right direction. The food was fresh, hot, delicious. Mother's Day had a special with salad, pasta, chicken, stuffed salmon and the Titanic for dessert. It served 9 people and we had leftovers. We added fried zucchini and I highly recommend it, it was so good. We had such a good experience I am looking forward to going again.

This place is NOT FOR COUPLES. This restaurant is designed for families or at least a group of four. Each dish is a little less than $30. The pasta comes in large plates and is shared so everyone has to agree to the pasta ordered. The salads are large and meant to be shared as well. The food is ok. The pasta was not el dente. We had veggie angel hair pasta in a cream tomato sauce. It was acceptable but nothing special. The one plus was our waiter Michael. He was attentive and pleasant.

Came in with a few of my good friends. The restaurant is traditionally southern Italian family style so the servings are served just as you were to be at home with your family on a Sunday evening.  We ordered the scarp wings with a delicious butter lemon rosemary sauce (omg definitely did not expect them to be this delicious!), hot antipasto (what a great deal for a sampler), large shrimp cocktail (these shrimp were the biggest shrimp I've ever seen!!) and for our main course we ordered a few pastas and entrees.  The pomodoro with spaghetti and prosciutto is to die for! Super fresh with large plum tomatoes with just enough spice to set it apart from the traditional red sauce.  Also the garlic and oil with ravioli is to die for, cheese heaven!!

For the cherry on top, Marcus provided us with the best service!  Answered each of our questions with absolute certainty and passion that had us at the edge of our seat anticipating the next course with excitement. Water bottle service, wine service, fresh new plates between each course and great suggestions for each plate.  Thank you for the endless amount of smiles and jokes throughout service! 

This dining experience has truly been remarkable and I will definitely be back and telling my friends about it along the way! 

Cheers for a great job well done guys.

Our memory is from Times Square. This is really close. The waiter had attitude. We love that. The food was excellent, huge portions, but we knew that. 
If you are not from NY/NJ/PA you need to experience this. It's a great time and great food!! 
It's excellent food!!!

We stopped in at Carmine's at the Forum Shops at Caesars on a previous trip to Vegas.  What a treat!!!  Large groups are welcome.  The food is served family style.  And, the portions are huge.  The food was amazing.  I would recommend this place to anyone that wants a great Italian dinner.

We had dinner reservations at 745 and since we were running close, my husband dropped me off and then went to park.  While waiting for him I ordered a bottle of water and a diet coke.  After 40 minutes of my husband circling thtee different parking garages, we decided that I would leave and we would go somewhere else.  I put down what cash I had, roughly $8, and left.  The waiter cane running or if the restaurant too tell me what I had left "didn't even begin to cover my tab".  Really? A bottle of water and a coke? I explained the situation, but was told I couldn't leave until I paid.  I gave him my card feeling like I really had no other choice.  Way to go!!  I will never attempt to go back if this is the way they treat their customers.

The service was good, pricing a bit high but one dish can serve 4-6 people. The food was just so/so. The lasagna was dry and the Cheesecake was bland, no flavor at all. We were a party of four none of us were raving. Maggiano's in the Fashion Show mall is much better Italian!
Great food and customer service. I do want to note that the portions are much bigger than traditional sizes, so be careful when ordering! Overall I fantastic restaurant and would highly recommend.

I've went to Carmine's in NYC about twenty years ago.  I don't recall the quality of the food but decided to try Carmine's in Las Vegas since the one in NYC has an excellent reputation.  I have mixed reviews.  For the incredibly high prices we paid for pasta, it's not worth it.

I went with a group of ten people and we ordered:
Lasagna:  good but nothing to rave about
Meatballs:  Wow...you call these meatballs?  Not very good at all
Chicken Parmesan:  Actually quite good and the best item we ordered.
Chicken Scarpariello:  Not much flavor, sausage was good.
Rigatoni Pomodoro:  heavy basil sauce, tasty but not worth paying $35 for a huge bowl of $4 pasta.

We didn't order desserts since we were full from our entrees.  Portions are huge but what's the point of having huge portions of just average food?  How about focusing on quality instead?

Service was excellent except for one waiter who kept on hovering around our table after we were finished, almost as if he were trying to rush us out even though there wasn't anyone waiting to be seated.

Would I go back?  No way.

We happen to come across this restaurant while shopping. It serves it's food family style so the portions feed 4-6. If you sit at the bar the meals generously serve 2. The ravioli was the best I've ever had. The sauce was excellent!  We also had Carmine's salad, which was awesome. Great ambiance. Definitely a place to bring the family.

We went on a trip and stopped by since we were fan of Carmine, have a good experiences in New York and New Jersey so.
Good food, good service, big portion, good selection of wines. The noodle came out a bit mushy, over cooked, well maybe it too busy but our wait said if anything didn't cook right we send it back and they will cook a new one for us, Well it was a good favor, so hope next time will be the remarkable meal to talk about.

I had Carmine's in NYC a few years ago. Up until recently I hadn't realized it's become a chain. I'm extremely weary of chain restaurants, but we figured we'd give it a shot because my boyfriend had never tried.
In short, service was straddling the line between mediocre and poor. Our server showed little interest in making an impression- come to find it was the end of her shift. After our food was brought out she whisked by us saying "I'm leaving, so and so will finish up with you." Gave us a brief smile and left. No thank you, no asking if we needed anything else. My boyfriend sat with an empty drink for nearly the remainder of our meal before replacement server came in to check on us. Nice. 
We had the vodka penne...it was good, in an Americanized Italian sort of way. I'm also weary of "Italian" labeling like this, because they are seldom authentic Italian. No exception here. The draw is portion size and I get it, like Cheesecake Factory. I guess we're just not people who like to sacrifice taste for a heaping pile of bland food. I will also add, like many reviews have done before me, the bread was cold. Like...not a hint of warmth to it. Yuck. 
If you're not feeding a family, opt for Trevi instead. Much friendlier service and better food- can't argue with that.

Super yummy and we were able to get in with no reservation which i was surprised. The place was crowded. Very large portions as to be expected with family style restaurant. Great place for large groups. We had a small group so we left some food behind  love the atmosphere and music as well.

We ordered the lasagna, chicken saltimbocca, and chocolate cannolis. The lasagna was good (but I have had better). The chicken saltimbocca was not very good. The chicken cutlets were very thin, and the chicken itself was not tender. They also skimped on the Prosciutto topping. The cannolis were ok, but taking into account that this resturuant is originally based in NYC (in which the NYC/NJ metro area has some of the best cannolis you will find anywhere in the world), Carmine's cannolis were disappointing. The service was slow, but we went on a Saturday night when the place was very busy, so I really can't fault them much for that. The decor is nice, but this is not the place to come if you want to have a nice quite dinner....the sound level of the crowd is very loud (more like being in a crowded bar, rather than a restaurant). Carmine's is very similar to Maggiano's, serving the large family style portions. I have not been to Maggiano's in several years, but what I do remember is that the food and atmosphere was far better than Carmine's. Overall, I think Carmine's is ok, and maybe if I ordered some other dishes, and it was a little less crowded/noisy, I would give it a higher rating. However, the best rating I can give it today is just 3 stars.

Service was great.  Mussels with red sauce ehh not the greatest. Meatballs with angel hair pasta good. Portions are out of control and just a plain waste of food even when two people are sharing an entrée.

We had walked by Carmine's earlier in the day when we were walking through Caesars Palace. My girlfriend  had heard about it before and wanted to try it. After our show, we decided to head back over to give it a shot. It was maybe 11 or 1130 so there was no wait to get a table. 

The seating is a little unusual because where you sit decides what type of menu you can order from. We were suggested to sit at the bar because it was just the two of us. I guess if you sit in the main restaurant, you can only order from the regular menu that is all served 'family style' in huge portions to feed many people. Even the bar menu had notation that the portions would be large enough for 2 to 3 people. 

The last couple hours before close are included in Happy Hour and you can get deals on appetizers and drinks. We decided to try the Calamari for an appetizer and then ordered the Rigatoni with Sausage and Broccoli to split. Both our appetizer and entree were served fairly quickly and not surprisingly, both portions were huge. The Calamari could have fed 4 people and our Rigatoni would have easily fed 3. Everything we had was great and fresh. Everything from the red sauce to the Italian Sausage seemed like it was made in house. We ate as much as we could but could have fed another person or two with the leftovers. Seriously, don't let your eyes get bigger than your stomach. 

The staff were all friendly and the restaurant was clean. The prices are on the higher end, but the portions are enormous. Try to come during the Happy Hour times for a cheaper meal.

The restaurant itself is stunning, with cool decor throughout the place. Our waiter was kinda blah but watching other tables waiters, you can tell they are on top of their work. 
Our food was amazing!!! We orders penne alla vodka, white seafood mix and chicken Marsala. Each fish was very good. The only thing I would change is the stupid menu on the wall.... if you can charge $30  a plate, you can afford menus each for your guests... I don't care for people walking closing and hovering over my table because they can't see across the restaurant to look at the menu.
This place is stupid.  Family only.  Don't take a date.  What do you mean you can't feed 2 people what they want?

What a fun time for Super Bowl! They charged $50 per person for all you can eat buffet. They had large tv's set up in every room. Everyone with reserved tickets had a table to watch the game and party. The food was really good. Service was very good. They had a little trouble with tv sound at first, but got it fixed quickly. The only bad thing about the party was that Denver lost. We bet on them and couldn't believe that outcome! Oh well, next year. Great job Carmine's!

We had a very pleasant lunch at this place. For a group of four, we ordered a plate of stuffed mushrooms and a lasagna. The portions are family style and humongous!  Everything was delicious. Between their yummy bread of three or four kinds, the one appetizer, and one entree, we were very full. Most of the group had peroni beer. My white sangria was delicious.
