Over Rated Shrimp Plate and Very Over Priced There are much Better Places to eat very close at that price was ok wouldn't recommend shrimp plate the Italian Place in Excalibur is a Better place my opinion

The first time we had Carmines was in NYC theater district. The food is amazing... We recently tried carmines at caesars and nothing has changed since our first experience in ny. Everything we had was amazingly delicious 
The entrées are sooo good, we had the bolognese pasta by far the best we ever had. The meatballs were a big hit absolutely finger licking delicious. Chicken parmigiana was sooo yummy.  The chicken was soo moist not dry and full of flavor all white meat no fat.. and lastly the garlic bread is a must.
Authentic Italian food Carmines is just amazing. I wish i had one close to home.. 5 *****

Carmine's is a family style Italian food place located in the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. The portions here are HUUUGE.  I would def say that this is more of a group type of restaurant than a 'bring a date' place. But if there are just 2 of you, they have open seating by the bar with "half portions".

We sat at the open seating pretty easily. The service was fast and the food came out pretty quickly. I recommend the rigatoni bolognese.... mmmmmmmm.  But all the food we got here was really good, even the bread.  I waddled out of this spot  content and full feelin like Fat Tony.

Go to Carmine's with a big appetite and bring some friends to help you eat.

We came to eat here on Valentine's Day and it was amazing. We sat in the bar area but it wasn't lacking. The food is amazing and seafood is so fresh! Service was great! If your visiting Vegas this is a MUST! (Don't forget to tip your waiter they work hard and are half of the reason why a restaurant is so good)!!!!!

Huge portions. Family style. Fried zucchini was heaven. Best food I have had all week. If I'd been a local would order more to take home. White calamari, Ravoli and another penne dish turned out to be more than we could eat. Great choice for large groups.
We came here to celebrate our wedding. The food and service were amazing. Can't wait to go back.

I have been to a lot of restaurants in Vegas and ate wonderful food but tonight I can say that I had the best service from Kyle D at Carmines. He was funny attentive and always had a smile. If you are looking for great food and even better service come here and ask for Kyle D! Props bro!!

Fun Place, come with a big hearty appetite. Love the old style decor and Hugh Italian style portions, that a real Italian is use too. The food is good, Not the best, but good. Service is also very good, friendly, But overly attentive, a little more privacy and less checking up is more appreciated. Veal parmigiana and calamari is good, had better, but certainly better than most Places in Vegas. GOOD bread, different herbs on different type breads. One Place Beats them All, my secret. This place is in the top 5. Beats the chain restaurants by Far. At least Carmine's uses an abundance of herbs, spices and plenty of garlic, Unlike pseudo Maggianos & Buca Di Beppo, both allergic to herbs and spices. Carmine's has Good Music, NO MICRO WAVE, THATS ITALIAN ! GREAT OLD NY PICTURES, NICE ROMANTIC DINING! EXCELLENT DESSERTS ! PORTIONS BIG ENOUGH FOR 4 people, or 2 ITALIANS ,lol hey I'm Italian, I know, Reasonable Priced. Tasty food. Home cooked. You'll end up taking home plenty of Food.

Great family style Italian food. The food here is beyond amazing. I recommend starting with the Spicy Scarpariello Wings. Although the name i spicy it really int spicy at all, usually it takes a little longer for these to come out but definitely worth the wait! The portobello mushroom parm is delicious! For the main course I think you can't go wrong with the chicken  parm which is made thin but not crispy and dry. Also the eggplant parm is the best I've ever had. It is served like a loaf, this is the first place I've seen that at. I'm not a huge red sauce fan, which is why I love that these parms are not drenched in red sauce. If you like sea food you have to try the mixed seafood with white sauce it  has huge shrimp, lobster, clams and muscles served with pasta. They have great customer service. Overall worth it.

Carmine's was great. The food was spectacular. So why not 5 stars? I want to get that out of the way -- the service, while prompt, felt rushed. Myself, my husband, and two other couples came here to have a nice, long, dinner. You know, the type of dinner you have with friends you haven't seen in awhile and you want to catch up. That's what we wanted to do. But our waiter asked us about three times if we were done with our meals (we weren't). I felt as though they wanted our table out to make room for another. I wish I hadn't felt that way, but I did.

On to the food -- the food, like I said, was spectacular. We ordered the lasagna, manicotti, and chicken dish with mushrooms, in a delish brown sauce. The portions were pretty much just right for 6 people. The lasagna was amazing, just absolutely sublime. The manicotti was all right, it could have used more sauce.

We did order drinks, and while I enjoyed my lemonade, I did not realize I would be charged for a re-fill when the busser asked me if I wanted "another one". $4.95 for a lemonade x2 is kind of ridiculous, and when I saw it on the bill and saw my half-drunk second cup still sitting on the table, I downed it before leaving.

To end our dinner we had The Titanic - a glorious dessert, with brownies, ice cream, whipped cream, chopped nuts, strawberries, and pineapples. You have to see it to believe it, and eat it to love it. 

Besides the service and outrageous cost of lemonade I was very pleased. I would definitely go back. I'll just stick to drinks that can be re-filled next time.

For a chain restaurant, I liked it.  The food, service and decor was nice.  The family style portions are enough to feed a small army and the salads are amazing.  When in towna nd you have to take your team to dinner, this place is high on my list!

My wife and I were on our way to another bar/restaurant in the Forum Shops when we walked past this place and made a mental note to come back and try it sometime. It just looked inviting.

Turns out we got our chance sooner than expected when our plans at the other restaurant did not go entirely as planned. We had show tickets at 7:30 and had sat at a table at the other place from 5:30 to 6:15 without getting served so much as drinks, so we politely took our leave and ran back to Carmine's. Could they possibly accommodate us and get us to the show on time with such short notice? 

We were seated straight away with no wait. When we explained our situation to our server, Ryan, he had our cocktails out within 5 minutes. Once we'd decided on our dinner items he talked to his manager and they bumped up our service order and had our entrees out about 5 minutes after that. We couldn't believe it! When they brought it to us we actually said "that can't be ours". 

Did getting it so quickly impact the quality of the dish at all? If it did, then they should be charging more, because everything was fantastic. For drinks I had the Espresso Martini which was just spot on and my wife had the Sicilian Mule, which was somehow actually even better. We ordered Angel Hair Pomodoro and Veal Saltimboca for our entrees, which was way too much food for two people, but we ate every last scrap of it anyway because it was amazing. Oh, and we ate most of the bread basket too because how else were we going to sop up all of that delicious sauce that the Veal Saltimbocca was covered in? 

Head to toe, beginning to end, Carmine's impressed the heck out of us. Not only will we be back, we'll be back with friends.
I loved this place it was so tasty and the portions are great if you enjoy left overs!
Horrible service! The hostess didn't want help us at all!!! You have to ask what you want many times and still not getting it! Will never come back again !!!
Great food and ambiance. Every time we go to LV we have to eat here. Big portions to share and great service

I think it's impossible to not over order!!!

Warning:  the lobster Fra diavolo easily feeds 8 people.  

The restaurant setting is very nice.  Low lighting. Rich wood grains.  Comfy chairs. 

We had a very attentive server.   Even though we had a party of 17, he made it feel like it was just two of us.  

We all tried not to order too much.  I think we order 5 entrees for all 17 of us.   We still had tons of food leftover. 

We started with appetizers: Caesar salad, stuffed artichokes and calamari.  All 3 good.  

Entrees: both of the lobster offerings, spaghetti and meatballs, lasagna, prime rib chops, and some kind of vodka pasta. 

The vodka sauce pasta was not enjoyed by anyone. 

Everything else was delicious and prepared perfectly. 

If it says P.A. for price .... Ask!!!!  Lobster entree was $130.

We finished with the titanic ice cream dessert.  Yummy and pretty.  

I can surely say it was a very memorable meal.  I'll never forget.  The food was good but the highlight here was the overall gluttonous experience.    

Plan on a long leisurely dinner with some  friends who don't split hairs.

I recently celebrated my birthday here. Although I was late to my own party, my family was able to be seated and wait for me. The staff were awesome. Our waiter was Logan and he was great too. The food was delicious. My uncle even loved the food--and he is picky what he eats. High compliments to Carmine's Italian Restaurant!

Our waiter Michael was super fast to aid our requests for napkins, refills, and more! We didn't even have to wait at least 10 minutes before he came speeding to our service, even though it was packed inside the restaurant. I totally recommend him. The service wasn't the only thing that was amazing. The food was delicious! The chicken and beef were tender and the sauce had unique flavors that tasted like heaven. Don't even get me started with the noodles. They tasted spectacular as well. Michael is awesome!

I visited Carmine's NYC during Thursday Oct 31st (Halloween,) for dinner and this place was pretty empty. We had originally made a reservation for 7 people for 7:30pm, but when we arrived a little less than half of the restaurant was still empty. As we arrived the restaurant had a very interesting layout but you could still feel the Italian roots. There are no elaborate walls or breaks in the dining area its all one large box covered with pictures and a massive ceiling. Carmine's offers a list of authentic Italian dishes, including but not limited to Antipastas, Rigatoni, Chicken Contadina, Garlic Bread Parmigianino, and not to mention their 20ft wine rack in the front of the restaurant.

During our visit, our party had ordered Garlic Bread Parmigianino for appetizers, Rigatoni A Bolognese and Chicken Contadina as our entrees. The garlic bread seemed a bit too authentic for my taste; it consisted of large cuts of bread caked with Parmesan cheese which I thought was icing at first. The Rigatoni Bolognese, which was essentially Rigatoni pasta with a meat sauce, was much better in taste and quality, the pasta was a bit cold but the meat sauce had a good consistency and flavor. Likewise the Chicken Contadina, was served with a similar pasta however the chicken was bone-in and got cold quickly. Two things I didn't enjoy very much.

Overall the service was a bit above average, our server was definitely very knowledgeable of the menu and had proper etiquette when it came to serving us and maintaining the cleanliness of our table.  The ambiance was about what I expected, as I mentioned earlier the restaurant is laidback and has a very spacious layout with a high ceiling, which I like. There were picture of random Italian figures all across the walls, which contributed to the new world Italian roots feel. I would say this restaurant was a good representation of what to expect from authentic Italian restaurants in the US. 

In a nutshell, this place is a more expensive Buca de Beppo with moderately better quality food. I was definitely not impressed and would rate my experience average at best. Unfortunately family style restaurants don't really do it for me as the food always ends up cold less than halfway through the meal. Overall, this is a great casual restaurant to get the authentic feel of Italian family style dining. There were no service failures or defects with the food, however it was a one-time experience for me.

*Tip* order cautiously! We had 7 hungry guys at our table, 1 appetizer and two entrees were enough to fill us up! Portions are HUGE... hence why they cost as much as an arm and a leg.

I've been to Carmine's with a large group and was pretty excited about the whole family style thing they had going on. I was so disappointed with it. The food was far from good and the restaurant was overpriced for what it was. I was served overly salty plates, burnt broccolis and overcooked pastas. The price made it that much worst, as I had much better food for a lot less on that trip (come on... It's Vegas! There is good food in that city). My one star goes to the service, that was pretty decent.

If you are looking for good food in Vegas, skip on that one.

Came here for lunch. We had a calamari and spaghetti and meatballs. The portions are Huge! More than enough for 4 people. Calamari was pretty good, S&M was ok only.  What made our dinning experience stink was Abigale, our server, she took our order and we didn't see her again until after our meal. We have to get the bread and water refills from other servers.

Family style dining.
Great for large groups (5+) to share the large plates and to allow for variety.  The large plates are definitely for family style.  Spaghetti and meatballs were fabulous!  Kind of noisy because of bachelor's party upstairs, but they sounded like a fun time up there. :)

So two of us came into Carmines to eat on a Tuesday around 4 (so very weird hour, not a ton of people). It always smelled delicious when we passed by so I wanted to try it. The portions are huge for two so I'd recommend coming with groups of five or more. What was the most disappointing though was that the lasagna we ordered was completely bland. It was tasteless to a point I had to sprinkle salt on it myself. There were no hints of oregano, basil, or really anything for that matter in the food. Not only was it tasteless but the huge portion came out in a matter of seconds. It wasn't hot in the middle and the cheese was not melted on the inside. When we complained, our waitress completely disregarded what we said. She also told us spaghetti and meatballs and lasagna are not made to order, which is why those two come out so fast. The one waitress we had was just terrible. Other servers had to relay our messages to her because she was no where to be found when we wanted to pay and leave. We left the entire dish there, missing just two servings (which were also half eaten) and were clearly unhappy. Yet there was no discount, no offer to get us something else on the menu, also no apology? Just shocked that a restaurant on the strip can make such terrible food, treat their customers so poorly, and still get paid in the end. Left hungry and feeling robbed of our money.

I wish I took pictures of our food.  We got calamari, fried zucchini sticks and eggplant parm roll.  FANTASTIC!!  I have wanted to try Carmine's for years, I have two of the cookbooks and they are great.  This Vegas location did not disappoint!!

When our Italian friends who own a pasta company in NJ suggested we come here for dinner, I had to trust them! And boy did this place deliver a fine evening. The food is served family style, so coming with a group of six was perfect! Here's what we shared...

Bread Basket - It featured an assortment of three different breads with olive oil and butter to go with it. Two of the breads reminded me of focaccia - one with onions and the other with tomato. These were my favorites! They were light, fluffy and moist! The last Bread was one I didn't try, but hubby sure seemed to enjoy it!

Caesar Salad - Ever since giving birth two months ago, I have constantly craved the crunch of romaine. So this salad was particularly attractive to me. The croutons were huge, but there weren't too many to be overwhelming. There was just the right amount of dressing so that everything was covered without being soggy. A plate of three anchovies were served on the side. I think our moms were the only ones to indulge in those. 

Shrimp in Red Sauce - I'm not a seafood fan at all, but I had to at least try this. The shrimp was quite firm and didn't have the unappealing fishy taste. And I really enjoyed the full sized cooked tomatoes that were in the sauce!

Veal Parmigiana - I've never had parmigiana in my life and I'm so glad I finally have! The crispy breading provided a nice texture with the melted mozzarella. I think this was the most flavorful of all the meats on the table. 

Penne with Ragu - The meatballs in the ragu were probably the next most flavorful meat. The sausage and pork were a bit more simple and took a back seat to the delicious tomato sauce. And I was crazy for the past! It was cooked perfectly and seasoned perfectly. 

What a wonderful evening of sharing with friends and family. This is such a great place for a special evening!

This place has a fun atmosphere with pretty good food. The family style dining makes ordering with your party interesting as you have to compromise on what we'll all be eating. 

We had Caesar salad and carbonara pasta and both were quality and delicious choices enjoyed by our entire party. 

Two items that kinda bugged me:
1. The menu is on a wall so we had to stare at it from afar and had difficulty seeing it or appeared to be starting at the adjacent table sitting under the menu. It would be nice to just have a menu for my table. 
2. I hate when a restaurant insists on making u reuse your salad fork for your dinner. Our forks were on our finished salad plates and the server took them off our salad plates and put them back on the placemat for us to reuse. For the price per entre I'd think we could be given a clean fork for the next course of the meal. Small things make a big difference.
We visit LV a couple times a year!  This is our ABSOLUTE favorite restaurant!  My 12 year insists we eat here each time we visit.  Love the food, love the service!

This is located in Caesar's Palace and we had Thanksgiving dinner here. The dishes are pretty pricey but they serve it family-style. The calamari is to die for and so is the steak. We ordered it medium but it end up coming pretty well done. Think of this place as a nice Maggiano's. We also ordered the salmon which came out pretty plain and the Carmines salad is really delicious and chock full of a lot of goodies like ham and salami. I enjoyed the rigatoni and meat sauce as well. that was the perfect amount of food for six adults and a child. We were too full to have dessert but the Tiramisu looked delicious. They do half sizes of the cheesecake.

So good I went twice, had Kyle as the server night 1 and Michael night two really great service and food consistently delicious - family style so bring your appetite they serve big plates, it was my bosses bday and man did Michael make it special what a great entertainer and server on the side

I have been to Carmine's 4 times with a group of 10-40 while working with Caesars.  Is it good?  Yes.  Does that warrant 4 stars?  No.  I mean... I'll go back, but the food seemed to be normal Italian food with super-sized portions.  I expected to get some better than average dish.  I wasn't really amazed, but I did have a ton of leftovers.

Honestly, not as an indication of the food, I always gave the leftovers to some homeless people on the Strip.  One time I had 5 bags!  Carmines packages the leftovers up with great care.  The dishes had utensils, napkins, and great containers.  It just wasn't enough to warrant 4 stars.

This past weekend I made my way out to Vegas. I tried Carmines a few months ago in NY I loved it. So was excited to finally have it again on the West coast. The food was excellent and just how I remember it from New York. The only downside I had was the service in the beginning. We were sitting for almost 15 minutes with no service. I understand if they were busy but it was not at all. Finally our waitress Yvette came and took care of us. She was awesome. Thanks again Carmines Vegas,

Let's keep it simple...
We had 4 ladies. We ordered the calamari and the Chicken Piccata Special...along with a pitcher of the White Wine Sangria.

Service: Excellent
Atmosphere: Fun
Food: Excellent! Very large portions ($37 calamari/$39 chicken piccata)
Sangria: Tasty and strong! We got about 9 glasses out of the pitcher ($48)
Noise level: A little loud, but not as loud as Hard Rock.

My only complaint is, there are no menus at the table. The menus are on the wall on TV screens. We were seated on the "patio". The furthest from the wall with the menu and none of us could see it. So we had to pull out our phones to look at the menu. 

Would I go back? Oh yeah!!

We decided to come here to celebrate my mothers BIG 50th birthday. And we were not disappointed!!! There was seven of us total with a reservation. Our waiter Micheal was the best waiter! He was incredibly knowledgeable of the menu. Michael was fun, ENTERTAINING, and had the best attitude! He would joke and tease with everyone at the table. He was so kind to stop my father from ordering too many dishes explaining that two main dishes was more than plenty to feed everyone at the table. We ended up getting the vodka pasta with chicken and the steak dish with sausage. Both dishes were prepared perfectly and tasted amazing. Michael was so right! We had more than enough and extra to take home. When Michael learned we had a cake for my mother at home for her he came back with a bowl of whip cream with a candle on it. Can't forget to sing happy birthday! But just the song was not good enough for our waiter! No sir!! Michael announced to the whole restaurant that there was a birthday in the house, but not just any birthday. The big 5 0 birthday! The look on my mothers face was priceless!!! Thank you Michael for making our experience one to remember!! We will be seeing you again real soon!

The food was good but I wasn't impressed with the service. Upon arrival last Saturday the hostess's were talking amongst them self then finally acknowledged me. I decided to sit at the bar. The bartender who was my server did not get me a menu after ten minuets brought  me one after I asked. She also took a very long time to get my food order. She walked by my friends chair and bumped into him and didn't even say excuse me. She didn't come to check on us even once. The gentleman sitting next to us said she took forever to take his order as well and he thought she was rude. Another male bartender was nice enough to comp me and my friend two drinks because he saw that we were having a hard time with the other bartender. That was nice of him but I had asked for hot coffee and it came out lukewarm :/. Then when we were leaving she said oh I accidentally swiped the guy's card sitting next to you for your meal, and his was $7 cheaper so here's his bill. Ok?? So we paid and left and of course the hostess's didn't even say Thank you or Have a good evening. They were too busy talking to each other.
I am never disappointed with Carmine's. Bring a large group because it is family style and portions are huge.

The portions here are insane. One steak, a pasta, and a salad was more than enough to feed my table of 5. 

We started off with a Caesar salad which could last me a week! The sauce proportion to iceberg lettuce was great. My family was saying how they would eat a salad everyday if it was that salad. But then we check the price and that salad alone was like $20-30. 

The tomahawk steak was very good. It was well seasoned and even I, who hates steak, ate 3 giant pieces! 

Next we had the seafood pasta which was ok. Half of our table got sick to our stomach with just one bite of the clam. The noodle and sauce tasted good though.

The serving size is huge, it's served family style and definitely fills 3-5 people depending on how hungry you and the family are. I went with my parents and we order calamari and rigatoni with red sauce and sausage and definitely had to take home both. It was a great experience, minus getting up to see the menus on the walls I loved it! The service was excellent and food was delicious!
Food is excellent and worth the price. Portions are so large and staff doesn't mind if you over do it so beware you may order way too much. Excellent food though.
Amazing food, amazing ambiance, great host / hostesses, phenomenal setting - love this place!!

Wow they say family size but in reality it's a scam. 
It's just double portion at double price

No menus which is absurd,  also porterhouse salmon are market price. Hey guys every other place in Vegas knows how much he meat cost.

Next sardines I hope you like your neighbor they pack it in

Learn to hear the word extra , how in the hell is pasta extra at $40 plate you should get pasta 


The food was ok, I wouldn't recommend this at all

Go somewhere else

It wasn't all that..,had the worse service.  
Were told our waitress would be able to discuss menu which was written on big white boards....she only knew about the spaghetti and meatballs.  OMG stereotypical!   Had to ask for water and bread....another Waiter dropped off food and served for us.  That server was great. 
It seemed like the server we had was hung over?  Just got off work as dealer?
Food was ok. They are way too proud.

Ehh. We went into Carmines after walking by it on our way to Trevi in the forum shops (which to start off, I would advise you to go there instead). Seeing that it was family style, we were excited. So we decide to give it a try and our experience was not very good.

They start out by giving you one menu for the table and some cold bread. I wouldn't complain about cold bread, however this bread had some sort of marinara sauce on it, so it was cold crust sauce on cold bread. They also gave out odd pretzel like sticks as well. We look at the pasta dishes and decide to get the "Ragu", the most expensive thing on the menu. Meatballs, sausage, and pork. Sounds good! We get the dish and it gets served out...and it was just gross. WAY too much sauce, which is WAY too acidy. Trust me, I have been going to italian places since the 70's when I lived in New York. This sauce was horrible. Maybe the can they used was bad? The meatballs were just that...basic balls of meat. And the sausage was just one long sausage...not even sliced or cooked well. The pork was also weird...just salty skins of pork randomly placed in this garbage pile.

Needless to say after the 4 of us decided we were eating sh*t, we told the waitress and she immediately took our plates and the pasta away. 10 minutes later she hands us the bill, which is for the entire plate of pasta we didn't eat. What?? We ask the manager and she takes the bill in a huff....and returns with the bill with the drinks for about $12. The waitresses advice? Try not to order pasta if you don't want to eat something acidy. 

We left a $20 and left and went to Trevi for a real dinner. I'm guessing this place only survives because it is in a tourist trap and most tourists aren't looking for quality food.

Carmine's is now a favorite eatery in Vegas. After a day of shopping at The Forum inside Caesar's Palace, I needed something light, but satisfying to eat. I noticed Carmine's "Happy Hour" sign in front of the restaurant. Happy Hour at Carmine's?  A no brainier. I went inside with shopping bags in tow. The happy hour menu is offered between 12-5 pm with several food options including a breaded eggplant "roll", fried calamari, Parmesan garlic bread,  steamed mussels in tomato sauce and meatball sliders. The drink offerings were one red and one white vino selection, one beer selection, margarita and martini selection. I chose the eggplant and red wine selection, which was, in my opinion, similar to a Cabernet Sauvignon, full-bodied with a peppery finish. 

My bartender was so kind, I forgot his name, and very accommodating. The bartender noticed that the server brought me the wrong order, so he immediately had him send it back to the kitchen After glimpse of the food and smelling sheer deliciousness of the "wrong plate", I decided I would take it since it was already prepared. By this this time the server was headed to the kitchen. He, the bartender, raced to the kitchen to grab the meal and brought it out to me. I really appreciate the effort. Not only that, the meal was DELICIOUS. I'm glad the server initially brought it out because I never would have been able to experience this awesome dish otherwise. I was very happy.

Disappointed...Ate there a couple of times over the past couple of years and it was excellent. Went back Easter Sunday and greatly disappointed. We ordered calamari for an appetizer. It was cold and lit was the pre-cut frozen crap that is served around town. Main dishes were cheese ravioli, cold and hardly any sauce. Rigatoni with broccoli in garlic and oil was also cold and dried out. Was going to send it all back but then thought why bother. Looks like the tourist trap has gotten busy enough that quality has gone out the window. How they stay as busy as they are is a miracle. I guess the heavy Cesar's Forum traffic keeps it going. It certainly isn't the food. Won't be back!!!!

Such an eloquent establishment. Very beautiful staff, with great service. Started with Meatballs and Calamari for appetizers, I could honestly say this place is better the Buca Di Bepo. We had Lasagna 
And Seafood Linguini with Red sauce. Amazing and such huge portions. It's can be quite pricey, but well worth. A nice place for dates or even just a family dinner.
Lousy service, cheap wine but it tastes cheaper.  There are far far better choices in Vegas.  Cross the street and try anywhere else at The Venetian.

When they say family style... they mean business. The portions are pretty damn big. My girlfriend decided to stop off here for some drinks and lunch. It was not crowded at all around 3pm I think happy hour starts around 4pm. Sat at the bar tops, our server was quick to get us started on drinks and did a quick run through on the menu. We decided to go with the grilled chicken caesar salad and some fried zucchini... we figure if we stayed long enough maybe we can order more off the happy hour menu. We so did not need to order anything else. The portions were HUGE and they loooooove their Parmesan here everything was covered in it. They also give you a side of it so you can add more.. not like you would need to unless you just want to eat spoon fulls of it by itself. For me it was on the salty side of everything... but I do like the concept of old style family italian restaurant.

Food was very good. I won't say GREAT because I have had better veal parm elsewhere, but still very very good. GREAT service... Our waiter Angelo absolutely made the evening for us.

Portions are family style and huge! Make sure you bring your appetite. We had 4 guys that like to eat in our group and ordered chicken and veal palm and  pasta. We had leftovers to eat the next day...

Some people complain that the menu is on a board and there are no menus at the table. I got there early and checked the menu out while having a drink at the bar. You can also take a picture with your phone if you need to...This was not an issue for me.

I will definitely be back..

Came to Carmines for a business dinner. We had a large group and the hostess was really great about changing our table as our party size increased. We sat near the back and could watch as the staff brought out the dishes for other diners and man just like the reveiws say - portions are huge! 

I've been to other family style italian restaurants (bucca or maggianos) and I think Carmines is way better than both of those. We ordered the Carmines salad and anti pasta dishes to start. Then our mains were meatballs with pasta in red sauce, veal parm, and broccoli and sausage rigatoni in white sauce. They were all really tasty- i especially liked the veal parm. For dessert we had the titanic and choc bread pudding. 

All in all a great meal - had wine flowing and good fun.  

I do have to mention they have a waiter there that sings italian opera -- AMAZING.  He was singing happy birthday to a few folks and came over and sang our group a different song. He was super nice and he's really good! Go see him for yourself!!!

I came here the other day for my 21st Birthday and I just want to say Kyle was our waiter, he was just fantastic!! He was so attentive to us and that was great!  We couldn't have had a better experience here, we will be back to this location every time we come to Vegas ! Thanks Kyle for such an amazing experience!!

I've been to so many restaurants in Vegas over the last 15 years, I can't keep track.  This to me by far is the best Italian restaurant, and it was surprisingly reasonably priced.  I reserved a table for 6.  The server was very informative, and let us know that 2 or 3 family style plates will be enough to feed our whole table.   Being that I'm 6'3" and 205 lbs with a big appetite, and I happened to be the smallest guy at the table, I was skeptical.  When we ordered a Caesar salad which fed all 6 of us, then started to order 3 plates, he stopped me after ordering 2, and said "That will be enough".  Sure enough it was.  The portions are huge, which in my past experience means the food is mediocre, but not here.  The food tasted amazing.  We had lasagna, and Chicken Scaloppine w/ lemon & butter, and I'd order both again. 

For 6 people, which included 2 dinner plates, 1 salad plate, 1 mixed drink, and 4 glasses of wine, the tab was $180.  Not bad at all to fill us up with great tasting food. Nobody had an appetite when we finished there.

We can definitely recommend eating at the bar during happy hour. Especially if you're not with a giant group,
We had fried zucchini (more like fries, but tasty!), and eggplant rollatini. OMG the eggplant rollatini is fabulous!!!
And the house wine was tasty too!

This has to be one of the best Italian restaurants that I have been to. The portions are out of control. Every thing is family style. Our waiter was awesome. Make sure you bring at least 6 people with you. We had a table for four and ordered a salad, the 40 ounce prime rib, chicken Marsala, and two meat balls. And we have another whole severing for 4.

Came here with a large group to celebrate a birthday and we were seated upstairs. We were seated about 30 minutes after our originally scheduled reservation which was a little bit off-putting, but we were greeted warmly by a waiter as soon as we were seated.

We ordered several salads and fried calamari, all of which were tasty. We also ordered several pasta dishes, none of which were that impressive in my opinion, with the exception of the meatballs which were pretty delicious.

I tried a couple of their blended drinks and was very underwhelmed and disappointed, especially since this a restaurant located in Vegas.

Overall, the portions are big, the prices are high and the food is decent, but nothing to write home about.

Carmine's is the best Italian restaurant in NYC! Now it is the best Italian restaurant in LV!  They are in Shoppes at Caesars Palace(by the smaller fountain) in the middle section of the mall.
  Everything is made in house. I personally love their sauces. Fresh flavored marinara, a thick meat sauce, creamy Alfredo and one of my favorites the Marsala.
   The bread basket is fantastic, it has 4 or 5 types of bread which is extremely fresh since they bake all day. The meatballs have an old world flavor that most restaurants can't deliver. I had the veal parmigiana this week. The breading was crisp and the veal tender. 
  Carmine's has family style meals which is best enjoyed with multiple friends. However this year the staff told me they have a limited menu with smaller portions.
  I come there whenever I'm in Vegas. Make sure to make reservations. But they will do their best to fit you in when possible.  Enjoy!!

My husband and I ate here as guests of a wedding reception. There were roughly 120 people eating dinner at this reception. The service was great, the food was amazing!!! I highly recommend the Italian ice drinks from the bar and the Penne alla Vodka.
However, the women's restroom was in poor condition. It was not clean, one of the sinks was clogged and had standing water. The toilets were dirty, and majority of the  soap dispensers were empty. Now keep in mind this was a Saturday night at 7, at their busiest hours. If the women's restroom was this unsatisfactory I can only imagine what the men's looked like. 
In all I would say this is an amazing place to eat, but the cleanliness was poor.

I would give zero stars if possible. 
Went for dinner around 10:30, thirty minutes from close. We sat at one of the high tops at the bar and NO ONE came to take our order. Servers walked past numerous times. We just got ignored. After waiting fifteen minutes we left. Not cool Carmines.

What can I say? Great, Great, great! We were so hungry while shopping at Caesar's Forum Shops and most restaurants had 1-2 hours wait. We came in and found bar seating on a Saturday night. Bartender was really friendly and gave us his attention right away. We ordered some salad and pasta. When our order came, we were so surprised ---serving was good for 3-4 people in big white platters. Flavors were so good and rightly balanced. We enjoyed the meal paired with Moscato wine.

Can't say enough good things about our experience here.  Went for a family celebration of my son's 21st birthday.  Showed up early for our reservation and they accomodated us right away.  Plenty of servers to take drink orders, bring us water and reccomend the right amount for our group of seven.  

We had the Carmines salad and stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer.  Both were fantastic.  then we split three entrees : Spaghetti and Metaballs (the meatballs were large but so tender), chicken parm (awesome) and lasagna (excellent).....all of my sons favorties.  

We didn't finish everything as it is a lot of food, but we'd come back again.  Thanks for a wonderful experience!

Family style food was good but I was unimpressed by our waiter. He only recommended the most expensive items on the menu. For example, I asked for a red wine recommendation and he suggested one that was $155. When I said that was a bit more than I wanted to pay, he just stared at me. So I eventually said "could you recommend something at a lower price point?" He said something vague (and with distain) about how they were all decent. Just rude.

Don't let the prices here scare you off. This place is priced high (starts at roughly $30 per dish) because it's intended that you are ordering and will be served family style (you order for the table). 

The cheese ravioli is fantastic and so is the manicotti. But what really had me going (and I can't believe I'm writing this) was the broccoli. That isn't the typo but their broccoli was spot on and they even left roasted garlic in there which was fantastic. 

Their Salmon is also great, just keep in mind that it comes served with shellfish so you keep that in mind fi you don't eat shellfish or if you are allergic. They can make it without the clams but you have to request it in advance.

I really do like this place and it's great to know they have 2 locations in NYC as well if I'm ever in the area. The staff there are great and accommodating each time we went there. And more importantly, we never went hungry.

In the Old Planet Hollywood in the Forum Shops I had believed no place would ever succeed.  Transplanting the Carmines of NY / Atlantic City to the Vegas strip would be a challenge as so many cookie cutter type places exist and so many high end unique places open satelite places and fail.  Carmines delivers all of the expecations.

Large long bar and huge seating area adorne this Italian retro look with huge billboards showing the family styple type offerings.  After a drink with the ever pleasant Nicole at the bar we sit 9 for dinner tonight.   Bread is presented which is OK and wine list is perused.  Really a fairly weak wine list to be honest but a couple of value $50.00 Italian and Sicilian bottles are located and were off and running.  Note glasses are like my grandfather used to use and if you watch the scene in the Godfather where The Don is talkling to Michael with a heart to heart you will notice the glasses used are the same here.  Nice touch though I doubt many will remember.

Asked for some recomendations and we are offered a special Cold Antipasto and Hot Antipasto.  The cold was a mix of Italian Cold cuts / Procuitto, olives, eggplant salad, salmon on mozerrela bread etc.  This was fair nothing to write home about at $37.00. 

The Hot Antipasto was a Small Calzone, stuffed bread, stuffed mushrooms, ground sausange and brocoli Rabbe, Clams Oregenato, Mussels in red sauce, and a few other things.  This was again OK but the Mushrooms were absolutely to die for So much so that we ordered a separate platter of stuffed mushrooms, a platter of meatballs and a very good Italian Mozerella and parmagina baked bread to complete the appetizers.   all and all Meatballs, Mushrooms and bread top scores.

We take a break here to see how much more we should order as we have hit it pretty good right now but on we go.  Platter of Chicken Marsala, Platter of Veal Parm, Platter of Shrimp Fra Diablo and platter of linquini bolognese with extra side of Bolognese sauce.     Veal Parm a near perfect 10... Delicious, chicken Marsala good but not my favorite, the Shrimp were absolutely incredible clean tasty perfectly cooked while the hot sauce was just the right amount of spicy and declicious as well.  Didn't need the 3bls of pasta in Red Sunday Bolognese Gravy but have to say it was dam outstanding. 

NO coffee or deserts tried as we can't walk at this time but 9 guys 4 bottles of wine tax and Tip (Not included automatically) we walked out for $630.00   As far as I'm concerened a tremendous value and really for the most part tremendous presentations and food and taste.  Service was spot on all night and would not in any way hesitate to return here in the future.  Big Thumbs up handling 9 Hungry Hombres. Congratulations forum shops think you found one to stay awhile.

As someone visiting America over Christmas and missing my nonnas cooking, I was absolutely delighted to stumble into Carmine's for dinner during my Vegas trip. We had made a reservation (luckily as the place was packed) and were seated quickly as a group of 7. We were introduced to the menu and informed that it was share style with plates that would feed 3-4 people, and with prices of around $30-35 for pasta I thought that was a complete bargain. This place is a true Italians heaven and really showcases what Italian eateries are all about, huge served and sharing a meal with your family. We decided on the lasagnes, penne all a vodka and a Carmine's salad as well as some wine for the table. The food was incredible and we had plenty left over after eating our body weight in pasta and at a grand total of $40 each I was incredibly impressed with the value for money! I will definitely be returning again on my next trip to Vegas!!

Absolutely terrific time!!! Family style dining at its best. The dishes are huge and sharing is encouraged. The Chicken Parmesan and the Lasagna was delicious and plenty for a table of 8. We also ordered meatballs and an appetizer calamari but it was really too much. We got talked into the big dessert since it was my 50th birthday because you have to go big or go home. They don't offer the Tugboat smaller dessert anymore so we went for the Titanic and it's GIGANTIC,  but absolutely awesome for a big birthday milestone like 50. The entire staff was extremely nice and made the night perfect. Great time in Vegas at Carmines. Just do it!

This location is in the Forum Shops down toward the Mirage.  We made a reservation, but arrived early and there was no problem seating us before our time.  The staff was very helpful in letting us know when they thought we had ordered too much for two people - they could have just let us over-order, so we appreciated that. We had a salad and the veal parmesan (for the two of us) and it could have easily fed 4-5 adults.  We will certainly add Carmine's to our list of restaurants in Las Vegas to visit again, but will try to bring a few more people with us to get a better value for our money. The food was delicious!

Bigger IS better.... And bigger is what you get at Carmine's. This restaurant is perfect for a group outting. The meals are HUGE, but the quantity doesn't compromise their quality. 

The appetizers were delicious, and to be honest I was already full after appetizers, but once I saw dinner, my appetite was back. 

Appetizers: 
-Spicy Scarpraiello wings
- fried Zucchini--- a must

Dinner 
- Penne Alla vodka 
- Country style Riggatoni 
- Chicken Parmiagiana
- Porterhouse contadina

Dessert 
TITANIC- a must (and they have a gluten free option)

Highly recommend this place for birthday parties, group dinners, or if you're really hungry!!

Cannot say enough good about this place.  It was my first visit and I attended with a group of 8.  The food was EXCELLENT as was the service provided by our server Matt.  The prices were extremely reasonable given the portion size.  This will certainly be on my list of regular places I visit when in Vegas.  The meatballs and chicken wings were incredible.  You must try this place.

Amazing family style Italian. Very large portions -- the Carmine's salad, lasagna, and chicken parmigiana was actually too much for 6 of us! Our server - Zoran - was amazing. This was the best dining experience we had in Vegas. Amazing service, great value, delicious food.
Huge portions. Each plate feeds 3-5. Excellent food. Nice place. Highly recommend if you want to get stuffed and go take a nap. ;-)

Great place to take a group- huge portions, everything made fresh. We had the calamari and zucchini fries, huge appetizers. We then ordered the broccoli rigatoni with white sauce- oil and garlic,not cheese. Very satisfying meal, nice refueling after shopping at forum shops. The pasta is almost al dente, just cooked enough.

Yum!  Very very large portions... Lemon butter chicken breast with angel hair pasta is soooooooo good!  They didn't get 5 stars because their menu is on a projector screen on wall which mad it difficult to order.  Service was great!  Just hate that I couldn't see menu on wall!

Came by for dinner the other night and the experience left much to be desired.. Ambiance was tad above regular and the staff were dressed in pretty basic white outfits...

Started off with the salad that didn't taste too fresh and seemed like it had been staying in fridge for too long...portions were way too large...

The highlight of the meal was the fried calamari appetizer which was edible, although the marinara sauce tasted like it came out of a can...

Moved on to the tube pasta which tasted like it was dried pasta that was blanched... The sausage was rather salty and the broccoli was okay.

The ravioli wasn't special..merely filled with cheese...

The chicken dish was a complete disaster, overcooked, dry, and too salty.

The eggplant Parmesan wasn't tasty at all..

...the tiramisu was way too sweet and wasn't super fresh...

We went about 15 min before they close, yet they did not refuse to serve us. We only went for coffee and dessert, but I had a wonderful experience! Their staff were very customer oriented. We ordered cappuccino and tiramisu. The cappuccino had a deep coffee flavor. The tiramisu was creamy, had huge chocolate shavings and amazing coffee flavor! Everything is family style so it was fun! I will be back to try their main dishes!

If you are considering hosting a party, group function, or other gathering (or even just having dinner)... do it at Carmine's and you won't regret a thing. 

My wife and I just got married at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, and of all the fabulous things about Las Vegas, this cozy Italian Restauarant in the forum shops that hosted our wedding reception was the highlight of our program.  The food is absolutely amazing, and it is something we are still hearing our guests rave about.  Baked Clams, Shrimp Scampi, and Porterhouse Steak got flying remarks.  

Staff was remarkable.   Senior Special Events Manager Stephanie,  we seriously wish had been our wedding coordinator.  Our Server Ron was so attentive to the bridal party and was such a good sport while being roasted by the comedian at the reception.

Carmine's.  You'll only risk being disappointed if you choose somewhere else.
Sadly I had a two star experience here last night so needed to update. Had horribly salty dish and was unimpressed by the overall experience. Even the good is sometimes horribly bad I guess....
Great place for a large group. Excellent food and they are used to large groups. Fast service. Took care of the kids. Will defiantly be back!!

I'm giving this a 2 star review based service:
We visited Carmine's on Mother's Day to treat my Mother In Law to a nice late lunch at one of her favorite Italian restaurants.  She's from the NYC area but recently relocated to Las Vegas.  She's dined at the original Carmine's in NYC probably 100's of times over the years. 
We were greeted and seated promptly.  The server, Antonel came over and asked if we would like to get drinks started, we felt a little rushed but brushed it off.  We ended up ordering a bottle of wine and water for the table.  We placed our order, starting with the fried zucchini as our appetizer.  We also ordered a chicken parmigiana, veal parmigiana and a penne with bolognese.  Their portion are huge and served family style, which we knew before ordering.  We were looking forward to leftovers.  After 15 or so minutes our entrees came out.  We asked the food runner where our appetizer was so he took the entrees back and asked.  Antonel, our server came back and told us they were out or zucchini today.  When we asked her why she didn't tell us before firing the entrees she said she forgot.  Her entire attitude changed, like we were a bother.  We wanted an appetizer and specifically asked her if the entrees went back would the kitchen remake them or were they just going to sit back there.  She said oh no, they'll remake them.  Fast forward to when the entrees came back out and sure enough the kitchen piled a ton of cheese on the chicken and veal, threw them under the salamander and sent them back out, DISGUSTING!  When we asked to speak with the manager he tried to cover saying it was against health code blah blah blah but there was no way to get around what they did, literally a pound of melted/old cheese. They re-fired our entrees and they came out as they should have the first time.  It's not a cheap place to eat and some people I'm sure save for long periods of time to be able to afford those prices.  When you choose to dine in a restaurant like this you except great service!  
We're locals and won't go back and won't recommend to our out of town friends!

This place has a great concept but lack the flavor. We started off with a giant Caesar salad which was the tastiest part of the meal. And by tasty, I mean it's super garlicy. 
We ordered penne ala vodka which was a box pasta with a sauce that store bought Classico vodka sauce puts to shame. It was so bland, I put chili pepper on it to add some kind of taste & even that wasn't working. The pasta wasn't even al dente. It was nearly crunchy & it took forever to get this super basic part of the meal. 
I was truly hoping for this to be good. I was starving, the bar to succeed was low. 
The servings are giant but what does it matter if you feel so let down by the quality?
This was one of the "favorites" on the menu as well. 
The service was fine. The restroom was dirty. Toilet paper all over one of the stalls in the women's room. 
I just can't recommend this place overall.

Hits and miss. We came here with a party of 12 after we couldn't secure a desirable time for Bacchanal. First, easy to get reservation at anytime so that's a plus but indicative of what's to come. Ambiance is great. 20+ foot ceilings wonderfully decorated for Christmas. Now the food. It was really pricey even with the large portion. Most of the dishes were over salted and the complimentary bread was COLD. It wasn't even room temperature. Asked if they could heat it up a bit and said they couldn't. You have a whole freakin kitchen back there and you can't toast bread just slightly??

Stick with Bucca. There are several around the area on and off strip.

This is the worst restaurant pretending to be Italian.
Food was uneatable. Nothing could even barely remind me Italian food.
And even trying to replicate some Italian recipes, the results was miserable.
And this place is not evem cheap
Avoid it
By far the best Italian food and service I have experienced this far. Had our daughters reception dinner here and I would highly recommend this establishment, 5 star food and service, great Job Team.
Excellent can't believe we never are there , sauce was very good and pasta was cooked just right . The sausage was very tender , can't wait to go back

Before you come to eat here make sure you bring your appetite and a big party! This place is family style and all of their portions are served to feed at least four people.  If you are going out with just two people I would skip on this place unless you know you can eat a lot or want a lot of leftovers.

Our waitress was really nice and friendly. I was very happy with the service we received.

We ordered the fried zucchini. Even with four people eating it we ended up with the most leftovers of this. I really liked this dish and was impressed and was better than I thought it would be. I wasn't able to eat a lot because it was a bit on the greasy side and quickly filled me up.

For dinner we ordered the ravioli's and a side of meatballs. We didn't get the actual meatball dish because it came with pasta and we knew we wouldn't be able to eat all that food. I was smart because the pasta would have been too much. I really liked the meatballs. They were really tender and melted in your mouth. I would like to try the pasta next time though.

We opted out of dessert because we were all too full but if you have enough room I'd say go for it because everything I saw looked awesome!

Overall, good just very filling.

Carmine's has an awesome atmosphere.  I really enjoy the service that they provide and the unique dining experience it affords.  Before deciding to eat here, understand that you are going to spend at least $35/dish.  All of the dishes are family-style, meaning that the portions are large.  If you're curious what that mean like I was before eating here, you should know that a single item can feed about 3 hungry people.  Also, if you are going as a group of guys, plan on getting 1 entree for 2 people.  If you are going with women, typically a single entree can feed 4 people.  Thus, with a mix of people in your group, plan for 3 people per entree.  The restaurant will tell you otherwise, but you will be hungry if you don't plan accordingly.  All-in-all, the food is quite good.  I would say that the individual dishes at Maggiano's are a little bit better, but the price is a little higher for a group to eat there (since eat dish is about $20 per person or higher).

We ate at the bar last night, and the food was pretty special.   Rigatoni bolognese like Nona used to make.   Perfectly al dente.   I thought the bread could be better, but I'm used to San Francisco sourdough, so it's a tough comparison.   Great cocktails and service.   Loved being able to watch 2 basketball games and 1 baseball game simultaneously.  This restaurant gets PACKED, but it makes sense why.   It's damn good!

First time here and it was great! Our waiter, Matthew, was splendid from the start. We where on the side where the portions are more generous and he recommended us to get a 4 cheese gnocchi dish that was beyond this world!!!! The Caesar salad is the best I've had no joke!!!!! The service was professional and attentive. On the higher end but it's totally worth it!

A very nice atmosphere! The hostess was incredibly kind , the food was good but beware the portions are extremely huge. Just the Caesar salad was almost bigger then the whole table but the best dish in my personal opinion and also a very popular dish there was the lasagna it was extremely tasty and I absolutely recommend it! Also the prices aren't bad there but  actually rather decent. Pretty affordable for a family on vacation in Vegas!

We went to Carmine's on a recommendation from a friend and are so glad we did. There was just two of us, so I am so glad we went with only one dish- easily big enough to feed 4. We got the rigatoni with broccoli and sausage and while I prefer the dish at Buca di Beppos, this was still really good. We also got the blood orange marg and the white sangria, both of which were fantastic, albeit pricey. Keep in mind their dishes feed 3-4 people when ordering.

Best Italian food I've had in Vegas.. probably because it's from NY!

Went here when my inlaws were visiting (there were 8 of us total)

Started w/ fried calamari and zucchini apps.  The zucchini was like zucchini french fries which was not what I was expecting. Still good though! Would probably get something else instead next time.

We went on a Wednesday when they had a veal dish on special.  It was $62 for a huge plate of veal...even the salad that came on the plate was amazing!  We also ordered eggplant parm (my fave and it was amazing), chicken parm, and angel hair and meatballs.  Since my husband and I live in town we took the leftovers home.  I ate the rest of the eggplant over a few days and froze the rest for another time. 

I can't wait to have visitors again so we can go eat here.. again!  Makes me miss NY even more but I'm glad I can at least hit up Carmine's when I want real Italian food.  

Our bill was close to $400 and we had ordered a bottle of wine, the rest of us had regular drinks.  We probably could have gotten away with 1 less dish and been fine.
Dinner was amazing we had a party of 17. Food was excellent service was great everyone had a fantastic time!
This is a must if you ever visit Las Vegas great service great food  authentic Italian

One dish can feed an army... really... it can... The portions are enormous! Look at the menu before you go, and if there are only two of you try to find something that is going to be great for you to share... like one dish to share... because, believe me... if you each order a dish, you will be eating leftovers for two weeks...
The food at Carmine's was amazing. But unfortunately I will NEVER return. The manager wasn't nice to the staff.

Family style restaurant with a family-like feel. Lots of great options and the prices are fair. We had no wait and were seated right away. The service was incredible and they were on top of everything. Food was very good and so was the sangria! We picked several dishes and enjoyed every one of them.

Worst cheese ravioli I have ever had! The sauce was just as bad! Guessing people go there for the huge family style portions! The only reason I gave this place two stars was because the service was good.

Still craving the ceasar salad.  Had penne ala vodka and chicken parm.  True family style large portion meal.  Server was great.  The mango mojito was worth the trip.  Definitely will go to Carmine's in NY now

Got the ribs and 1/4 chicken combo with Mac & cheese and Collard greens.  There was enough food to share with another person. The food tasted good.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for some good ol' BBQ.

Okay, I normally have a hard time giving places in the casinos a full five stars, but this place is fantastic. The service is quick and friendly. But one piece of warning I would not go hear if you are dining by yourself. That could get pricey and well entirely too much food. At this place they serve family style. Meaning everything you order in huge and intended for sharing. My wife and I had Lasagna and it was fantastic. The best part is because sharing is assumed you can get a decent meal here for around $40-$50. Any time we see a show in Caesars moving forward we will dine here. The food is great and it sure beats spending $70-$80 somewhere else.

Definitely one of my new favorite restaurants. Excellent food and huge portions (especially refreshing after a bunch of small plates at other LV fine dining restaurants.) The lasagna was great! Pre meal bread included!

Went here on a whim while walking through Caesars.   I am SO glad we stopped in. The food is fantastic. Their chicken wings are the BEST I have ever had, and I have eaten my fair share of wings. My kids devoured them too. We came here about a month ago for the first time and just returned this weekend because of the wings! The other food is equally delicious. We had a special salad for Easter which we could barely eat (2 adults, 2 kids) it was so large. We also had Chicken Saltimbocca. Holy cow, so good! We had their spaghetti and meatballs last time which was a hit as well. For dessert, cannoli's. Wow is all I can say. The only negative I can see about this place is the seating. The first time we went we got stuck at a table in the middle of the room on top of everyone else. It was barely comfortable. However, this time I requested s booth with my reservation and they granted that request. Love this place, will definitely be back!!!

I chose this place for my birthday dinner with my family and I don't regret it at all! 

Our server was awesome; even as busy as a Saturday night is, he was very attentive to us. We ordered the Caesar salad, Lasagna, shrimp scampi on top of angel hair noodles and the titanic for dessert (this was just for my family of 4!) The salad was so good and to top it off, the had anchovies like a true Caesar salad! When the lasagna & shrimp scampi came out, my kids were shocked at how big the dishes were!! We ate probably only half of each dish, which was perfect because we wanted leftovers! Our server even warned us about how large these dishes were...but we knew we'd want it for home later :). We ordered their infamous Titanic for dessert, although we were pretty full already, we had to! it's one of their famous dishes! Pricey but worth it! It's a mix of a sundae, a banana split & the bottom has a fudge like brownie... HEAVEN!! we ate all the ice cream and whipped cream & saved the brownie for home. I woke up this morning already excited for my leftovers!! If you go, bring your appetite!
EXCELLENT family style Italian!

Came here for dinner during a work trip; last minute reservation but they were able to get us a table. Everything from the service to the amazing Spaghetti Bolognaise was wonderful!! HUGE portions (family style). I recommend the Stuffed Artichokes for an appetizer (they give you 2 HUGE ones). Will definitely go again the next time I visit.

Just had a private party here for 25 people and from start to finish...AMAZING!! Event manager Krista rocks! Food is top notch and service superseded our expectations! I would recommend this place for your private party! Our family was very satisfied ! The food and drinks just kept coming! Thanks Carmine's for making my mother in laws 50th birthday so special!

Family serving size dishes makes this place good if all like the same dish, otherwise expensive for families where everyone likes something different! The sauces and fallacies were amazing. Waiter David was great with our 12 & 13 year old boys. Would DEFINITELY RETURN!!!!

Seated far from a menu printed on the wall. I asked for a printed menu. "It's our tradition to not give you a printed menu.  You can go take a photo of it if you like."  Since it's my tradition to be handed a menu, and I was traveling with someone who is visually impaired, we politely left after explaining this was an unacceptable inconvenience.

Just sat at the bar for over 15 minutes was never acknowledged and it was not busy...walked right out. When you have an endless amount of dining options right around the corner it's important to provide excellent and consistent customer service.

Carmine's has the biggest portion sizes I have ever seen, they could feed an army. We ended up sitting in the bar area which serves smaller portions (only for 3 people) but the menu is more restricted. The prices seem high but when you consider how much food is served they actually become very reasonable.

We ordered the Caesar salad and penne bolognaise, the food was so rich and there was so much of it that we ended up taking the final third of the bolognaise to eat the next day. I would definitely recommend Carmine's to anyone in search of a good quality hearty meal in Las Vegas.

The food here was definitely plentiful, but I thought it was only 'decent.'  Almost everything I tried lacked seasoning.  It's a very pretty restaurant, with traditional Italian (or New York Italian?) style.  Both levels are open to the bustling mall, which as great.  The staff was very friendly, but service was slow and disjointed.

We stopped in for happy hour and decided to stay for dinner as well.  The happy hour red wine was very respectable and the calamari was excellent.  Our server was Dorian and she was a delight.  We did the meatballs w angel hair and left totally satisfied with food quality, service and price point.

This review is only for their happy hour (2pm-6pm and 9:30pm-close at the bar). We sat ourselves at one of the high chair tables. This place is BIG so for the most part you won't have to wait for a table. At first no one came by to ask for drinks or anything so I got up and asked the bartender to order our drinks. When he came by with our drinks he also took our order.

APEROL FIZZ ($7) - surprisingly very good! I didn't know what this drink was but just took a shot in the dark and I really liked it. It has a slight carbonation and it was a refreshing drink.

MUSSELS IN RED SAUCE ($9) - a very visually appealing dish. The mussels were good and I liked the sauce that they were in.

GARLIC BREAD PARM ($6) - admittedly not the most visually appealing dish but the garlic bread was delicious and I really liked the melted part on top. Girlfriend wasn't a fan of the cheese so she took it off but we agreed the garlic bread was really good.

FRIED CALAMARI ($11) - my favorite of the dishes. The calamari was very good but I was a huge fan of the dipping sauce. You could tell that it was homemade and it had a ton of flavor. 

They have a ton of pasta options that were served in big portions and sounded delicious but unfortunately were not part of the happy hour menu. I do want to come back and try some of them though.

We have eaten - Atlantic City, Bahamas, and 
NYC -/ food and service always great !
Micheal Baker in the Vegas location  is the Greatest Server we have had! We had a party of 30 and never wanted for anything. Truly an excellent representative for Carmine's ! 

Thanks Mike

First Timers at Carmins and will Never go back! We had made reservations for a very special occasion with our friends from out of state. The waiter was friendly and took our order and than when the staff came out with the 3 Hot Plates of Large Portions of food. He drop one of the plates on my husband lap burned his lap fucked up his expensive dress shirt and brand new leather shoes and the food was all over his white dress shirt and the floor. We felt embrassed, upset and lost our appeite. Everyone in the restaurant looked at us it was just Awful!! the waiters moved us to another table along with the 2 plates. while we waited for about 17 minutes for the manager to come out with claim papers to fill out and told us that the staff person was a new dad and  that he was sorry but if the man was tired he should of called out sick or he needs to realize these plates are steaming HOT!! and it could be dangerous to them and the customers its been 5 days and we havent heard back from the corporation office yet.  For the price they charge on the food they should at least  the decently to call to see if my husband is ok. We left very upset and he had to go back to the hotel with pasta all over his and clothes & shoes how embrassing!!! it ruined everyone night. I hope they call so we can file the claim and get our reimsburment for my husband clothes. The night was Ruined thanks to Carmins!

This was the perfect spot for 6 of us to enjoy a birthday dinner. The food was pretty good, portions beyond large, our server was great. I would go back if I visit Vegas again. It is like Bucca de Peppo, but the food was better.
The one thing that sorta made me almost in a bad mood was. My husband and I were meeting 4 others for dinner. When we sat at the bar to have a drink, I realized I had not eaten since breakfast. I asked the bartender for a slice of the stick bread I saw another patron at the bar eating. He said something while turning his back to me and slid a menu my way. I did not see just bread on the menu. So I said to another bartender the same thing and he said (in a curt way) we are family style and there is the menu. The least exspensive item was $19.95.  So i said to him, really you can't spare a piece of bread? He grabbed a basket of bread and through it at me.

Came here with a large group of people and was pleasantly surprised. Unlike most restaurants, Carmine's serves food family style so each dish is a huge portion that can serve multiple people. There were 11 of us and we had for appetizers: salad, wings, and calamari. For dinner we had, the stuffed fish special, veal, pasta bolognese, pasta alla vodka.

All of the food was absolutely fantastic and we were beyond stuffed at the end (and even had leftovers). If you are a lover of garlic this is the place for you, they use a healthy amount in each dish. I would recommend the wings for an appetizer. They are garlicky and delicious. If you are going to choose any entree, it must be the bolognese. It was one of the best I have had and is quite filling.

The sticker shock of each dish can seem daunting but if ordering as a group, you can most likely get away spending less per person than most restaurants in Vegas due to the portion size. 

I wish they had one close to me since I would definitely go. I highly recommend it if you are traveling with a small or large group in Vegas.

I've been to the NYC location, and it is good.  I took my team to Carmines during a recent conference and found the food to be mediocre.  The food wasn't terrible, it just wasn't great.  I do like the family style and the portions were great for 4 people. The ravioli was good but the sauce was on the bitter side. Ragu would have been a better alternative. At the waiters recommendation, we also tried the Chicken Marsala...Bad choice.  The salad was very good, but if you screw up salad you really have something wrong with you.

Huge portions. And hearty flavorful food!

4 adults and 4 children. 
Calamari for appetizer, Garlic and oil linguine, Sausage and broccoli rigatoni, Shrimp Scampi and Chicken Scaloppine w/lemon and butter.

We still had food leftover! 

I was most surprised by the garlic and oil linguine. You would think that the pasta would be very light or plain in flavor, but it wasn't. Quite the opposite. It was incredibly flavorful without the heaviness of say a cream sauce. 

Also,  I never order chicken dishes when I'm out for some reason. Especially dishes with chicken breast, mostly because I've never found a dish that I've liked, that wasn't bland or tough or just uninteresting with some sauce slopped on it. The chicken scaloppine was so tender, with the most delicious creamy, lemon butter sauce that had a refreshing delightful flavor.

Casual, family style ambience. I felt like I was dining at a good old Italian friends house for dinner. Big appetite is a must!

Had a great dinner with friends from out-of-town,  and it was a fun filled satisfying evening.

Meh. We actually spent thanksgiving here. Very crowded and very loud. A little too loud to be pleasant. The food for me was average. The portions are large but that's not that important to me. The best thing I had was the fried zucchini. Rao's is the only place to go for Italian in caesar's IMHO.

Wow - what a meal!

We were a party of about 14 in a private back room.  Our hostess had ordered several family style courses and OMG were they good but were we FULL!

Appetizers: fried zucchini strips (amazing), a mixed salad and a roasted pepper and mozzarella salad - all really good.
Pasta course - Ravioli with Ragu, Shrimp with angel hair pasta in white sauce - again super yummy.
Main course (which by now we did not need) - Veal Marsala and Eggplant parm.  Both super good.
Dessert - really????  Tiramisu and fresh fruit.

Not sure how all this works in the dining room but I can say their food is excellent as was their service.

Check it out!

Not the way nyc one works. Right next to our table was a birthday person. They sang very well even the manager came in to sing. I went upto the manager and he was rude to me. Said are you buying a dessert? And the just said ok.   I then asked the aited who was helpful, and 3 ppl came to wish. Like they were forced. 

Coincidentally, the table next to us was white and we are brown.  Pretty sure that was not the case, but the manager was rude. I'd still like to mention this kind of stuff during current times.

This is one of those restaurants that it does not matter how good or bad the food was, but that the employees and experience were so horrible and unpleasant that you cannot think of anything other than that.
My husband and I went to Vegas because I had a seminar in the Wynn for Labor Day weekend. It happened to be my birthday on the Sunday, so he took me to the Mariah Carey show at Caesar's Palace. Afterwords, we decided to go here for my birthday dinner since it was in the same hotel. I made reservations on OpenTable. My poor husband is in a wheelchair because of a broken foot, and this made it more convenient since we didn't have to venture far from the concert.
We arrived, and the restaurant wasn't busy at all. We checked in via our OpenTable reservation, and I asked if we could have a nice table since it was my birthday and we were celebrating. The two hostesses rolled their eyes and didn't even say "Happy Birthday" or "Welcome!".One of them just took us to our table, which was a tiny table in the middle of the restaurant. Mind you, this could have been their WORST table, and it was really difficult for my husband to maneuver around in a wheelchair and then sit in a cramped table with his foot in a huge case. I saw that there were three booths next to the table, with one of them being open, and asked if we could sit there. The hostess said "No, sorry. There is no server for that section" and walked away. My husband and I looked at each other, a little puzzled. I walked back to the front of the restaurant and asked the same hostess and the other hostess if we could please sit in the booth, especially since it would be a lot more comfortable for my disabled husband. She huffed and puffed and said she would ask her manager. I watched her walk a circle around the restaurant, but never asked anyone anything or spoke to anyone, and then walked back up to us and said "Okay it's fine, but just to let you know, it might take about 20 min for a server to come to your table or take your order". I said it was fine, and honestly I was at the point of laughing because she was behaving so ridiculously, and because I was in a good mood because it was my birthday and we just saw Mariah Carey.
Again, this girl was full of s*** because a server immediately came to our table and brought us water and took our order. The server was a little robotic and cold to us at first, but he ended up being nice. He forgot to bring our bread basket, but made up for it by sending us home with some. The food was good, but the prices were very, very steep. $30 for a salad? If they made the portions a tiny bit smaller and the prices a tiny bit lower it would be better.
A couple days later, I checked my OpenTable account and it said that the restaurant had CANCELED my reservation that night 15 min after we had been seated, which means I didn't get my OpenTable points. I was FURIOUS! Obviously that hostess didn't like that I questioned her choice of seat for us, and decided to retaliate by manually cancelling my reservation. What a miserable human being that would treat someone like that on their birthday! I called the restaurant, and spoke with the manager, Keely. She looked into it and said that "it looks like there was some confusion; the hostess said you may have not told them about the reservation so they cancelled it". BS. I told them twice! Trust me, I always want to make sure I get my OpenTable points. Keely ended up giving me the points, but did I really need to go through that trouble?

Very good lasagna!! Huge portions, crowded Restaraunt, very loud, exactly what you would expect from a good Italian Pasta house. The entertainment for the dinner was the fact that there were about 200 guys in drag. It was apparently, Diva Las Vegas at the Restaraunt that evening. 
The Brunello paired nicely with the dish, and a cappuccino ended the meal. 
If you are shopping in the Forum Shoppes, it's a great place to go.

Fantastic food. HUGE portions! I 
Quick Breakdown:
Appetizers : Calmari & cold antipasto - good. Stuffed Muschrooms Ok
Pasta: Penna Alla Vodka DAMN GOOD
Chicken, Scaloppine: YUMMO
Shrimp Scampi: The Best
Lasgna: way to full to even try it
Sides: Broccoli; Super good. 
Desserts: HOLY cow..not sure how i did it, but i tried it all. The Titanic is awesome. BE aware that you need at least 4 people to split this. The Strawberry shortcake was my Fav. 
Make sure to get reservations since this places fills up fast!

The slowest service eeeeeever.  My family and I stopped by ready to eat.  I can only attest to the other reviews about the menu for every other person and for you to look at the wall menus.  But with the nearest menu was behind us and over our heads; the others out of viewing range.   C'mon give us menus!   We promptly ordered the garlic bread with our drink order.  Thirty minutes later still no garlic bread and the main courses were alread ordered at this point.  Finally our waitress came by for us to ask the status on the order.  I could tell by her facials expression something was wrong (like our order wasn't being processed)  We saw other tables seated after us  with their hunger being put to rest with great looking and smelling food.  When the order of garlic bread finally arrived we devoured it and shortly after the main courses arrive.  Wait staff didn't apologize for the long wait and even charged us for a drink we didn't like.  To say the least we won't be back.  To many options in Vegas.

Wow - walked passed Carmine's a thousand times and never tried it. Decided to take my wife there for Valentine's Day and we loved it - HUGE portions of yumminess! Enjoyed every bite.
