The service wasn't the best but it could have been because they were very busy with the holiday. Overall would I go again? Yes!
Good food, I have taken my guest from our of town, good service. I like the day that they have special sample pasta.

Carmines was an excellent choice for meeting some friends I haven't seen for over a year. Ron was our waiter and he was excellent. They had a veal special Wednesday evening that was simply delicious. Service was great, food was great, hanging out with friends was Priceless!

Excellent food, great ambiance, very good service.  Reminded me of the Italian restaurants in NYC.  Very authentic Italian food and plenty of it.  If you are in Vegas and want Italian this is a must stop.

Well, it's not the Carmines in New York, but it's pretty darn close. Like many New York, LA or celebrity owned restaurants in other cities, when they come into Las Vegas, sure it's the same menu they usually even look somewhat similar but there is just that "it" factor, that vibe, that's missing. One part is maybe even just the staff. When you're at Carmines in New York all of the staff has that New York attitude that is just so amazing and fun. One things that did make me really feel like I was in New York, was the fact that Carmine's is inside the Caesars Forum so there are no views of palm trees or the desert to be had. The other thing is that the place was decorated for Christmas, there's just something about Christmas in New York that is very special and inviting. 
 
So if you are wondering around Caesars looking for somewhere to eat or craving some good ol' New York style Italian food, I highly recommend popping in to Carmines. Hey, it is Vegas after all, it's all about excess; whether that means spaghetti or slot machines!

Very good service -gave us water and soda even before we asked. Waiter came by often and asked how we were doing. Food was great. Great calamari appetizer. We had Spaghetti with meatballs. Pasta was cooked perfectly -not too soft, not too hard. Meatball was tasty -very soft and flavorful. If there was an issue, the portions were huge and we couldn't order any more than basics for 3 of us.

Great Italian food in Vegas. The entire menu is family style, so it is a little pricey (it's Vegas), but the food is very good. The restaurant is big considering it's located inside Caesar's Palace, but in a good location.

Items Selected:
Bread Basket - Focaccia, Rye, Tomato and Herb, Rustic Italian
Cold Antipasto Platter - Mortadella, Prosciutto, Eggplant Caponata, Salmon Crostini, Seafood Salad, Mixed Olives, Panini and More
Spicy Scarpariello Wings
Eggplant Parmigiana
Lasagna
Double Espresso on Ice
Bread Pudding
Strawberry Shortcake
Chocolate Cannoli

Opened in the Forum Shops at Caesars' by Artie Cutler and the team behind two New York City locations, one in Atlantic City, DC and even the Bahamas, Carmine's is cut from the same Southern-Italy-by-way-of-NYC cloth as chains such as Bucca di Beppo or Maggiano's Little Italy, yet by doing 'the little things' right the experience is upgraded at least two-fold while still maintaining its customer-friendly prices.

Assuredly a tourist gathering point, though a fair share of locals have been heard to say they enjoyed their visits, Carmine's Las Vegas location opened in Summer of 2013 and closing in on three years with Chef Michael Ingino involved since doors opened the very concept of a "scratch kitchen" feeding a room that seats up to eight hundred from 11:00AM to 11:00PM weekdays (and till Midnight on weekends) may seem exhausting, but in reality the attitude of everyone in the place remains not only pleasant but downright exuberant.

Currently managed by Anthony Esparza, a pleasant man whose enthusiasm for a big job seems contagious to his staff, it was as part of a party of four that seats were taken under one of the colossal menus mounted amidst black & white photos not dissimilar to any number of Italian-American restaurants and with portions as outsized as the restaurant's character the phrase "Family Style" rings true from the onset, our waiter warning that each plate was meant to serve anywhere from "two to four" guests.

Skipping the grandeur of a place like Carbone, casting aside stereotyped Italian phrases and an absurd check in favor of a sort of "Sunday at Grandma's" vibe, feasting at Carmine's commences with an ample Bread Basket likely to tempt all but the most carbohydrate conscious and with Sinatra, Dean and Sammy playing overhead in not-too-loud fashion the question of where best to begin is a daunting one, the fact that nearly everything but Pasta and imported Charcuterie is made on-site further complicating the decision.

Acknowledging from the start that over-ordering at Carmine's is a virtual guarantee, "two to four" better translated as "four or more," it was to a large platter of Antipasti that the table was soon treated and although the phrase "something for everyone" is often a dicey proposition it would be difficult to call the smorgasbord anything less as everything from simple meats and cheese to a complex seafood salad are presented elegantly with a price not dissimilar to what such a spread would cost from Whole Foods Market.

Told that the Spicy Scarpariello Wings were something crave-worthy, two dozen plump pieces of Chicken cooked crisp before a bath in vibrant sauce teaming with garlic, lemon and peppers, suffice it t say that the housemade Blue Cheese Dressing alone would make this plate worth ordering instead of lesser versions at the local Sports Bar, a followup of Lasagna and Eggplant Ptarmigan showing the former to not be quite as crisp as one might hope across the top while the 9-layered latter outperforms any other version in town by a significant degree as each hand-sliced and stacked piece is baked soft without turning mushy around what could easily be a pound or more of Tomato Sauce and Mozzarella Cheese.

Joking with the server about his description of Strawberry Shortcake, the desserts all tempting but that one sounding particularly odd when accidentally described as being served on Rye, it was in good humor that the actual dish was served complimentary alongside a block of Cinnamon and Chocolate Bread with fresh Whipped Cream and three filled-to-order Cannolis, the Bread Pudding actually almost *too*dense at the end of such a meal while Marble Cake beneath Cream and Strawberries was soft and light, the citrus-tinged Mascarpone filling each Chocolate-dipped Shell equally convincing of Carmine's commitment to quality.

**** Accounting for the fact that Carmine's is positioned to compete for the 'average' tourist dollars and not those looking for an 'event' meal or fine dining there is little doubt that what Michael, Anthony and their team is doing at Carmine's goes a step beyond to make the overall experience a worthwhile outing, and one that tourists as well as locals may equally be likely to enjoy.

Came to celebrate our fathers birthday. On time with our reservation & to be seated. We were a party of 13 including kids & our waiter was very patient, prompt, made sure drinks were always filled, & gave great suggestions for their dishes. Very family friendly. All plates are huge portions. Pasta ala vodka was our favorite.

Great food, but the waitress/Bartender did NOT tell us they would charge us $12 just to add shrimp to our $18 entree. Also, my jack and coke was $10. Super high prices for add ons.

It's Vegas, of course, so they're looking to jack up the bill as high as possible, but $12 for two pieces of shrimp is outrageous. 

If you just won a some money at the Blackjack table, go ahead and eat here. If you're down, however, you might want to make sure you know how much each item costs before ordering because they will sting you.

Very bad experience. Food is huge! Cost is ridiculous. Can't sit in restaurant unless you want to eat for 4. If your a couple forget it. Caesar salad was $30!! Ugh! Chicken parm was so garlicky I gagged! Don't do it!!

A big group of us went here after a wedding one evening. We had reservations for 7:30 (over a month in advance) and we were not seated until close to 8pm. The portions were huge and mediocre for the most part, but a majority of us ended up getting stomach cramps and/or food poisoning after eating here. The service was decent (wait staff) but the bar staff was pretty rude. I don't think I'll be visiting this establishment again.

Just like the one in NYC!!!  Wife & I were thrilled to come across it and they once again did not dissappoint. We sat at the bar and Jimmy took excellent care of us.  Had food for a midnight snack and breakfast the next day!  Portion sizes are gigantic! Beware of that.

We came in excited about eating here.  It's family style and we were starving after a long day of travel.  My wife ordered for us; the seafood with angel hair and white sauce.  It came out looking delicious!  Lobster, mussels, clams, calamari, shrimp...  all over cooked!

It started with the calamari tasting like a rubberband soaked in chum.  

Next, I had to saw into the shrimp to cut it in half, to taste the crunch that should be reserved for a Snyder's pretzel, and the vein jamming between molars.

After my wife saw my face chewing like it's cud, she thought to try the lobster... she popped out a dry chewy piece of shredded meat and didn't bother with any more.  

I shouldn't need to explain how awful the clams were after the rest of the mess, but I tried a mussel after all this.  For the first time as an adult, I spit partially chewed food onto my plate.

The mussel had the consistency of a sand soaked wash cloth.  I've had gritty seafood before, but someone must've rolled this thing in desert soil right before serving it.  I haven't wanted for a piece of floss like this since $2 steak at Chuck o Rama.

To be fair; they did not make us pay for this atrocity, we did not eat it either, and my appetite was shot.  (Our server did apologize several times and offer us something else)

I haven't felt this close to food poisoned in 20 years and over 100 visits to Vegas.

It got a second star because they cooked the angel hair perfectly.  (Boiled in chum)

Food was very good and the service was great. It's a nice family style restaurant. Huge portions. The only problem is that because the portions are so large, it's hard to try a few things. Definitely recommend going with 4 or more people.
Service was great but food was just okay. Huge portions for big parties but I've honestly had better Italian food. Great location inside the forum shops.

I've been to Carmine's in New York before and I liked it. Huge family style portions but better than Buca di Beppo, I think. Made a reservation and went here with the family. It's not as busy like the one in the Theater District in NYC.

They make their lemonade fresh to order: strawberry or blueberry. They use real fruits...but refills aren't free. I personally love their strawberry lemonade because it's real tart...so refreshingly good. Since we're a small family (with a big appetite) we got the chicken scarpariello, manicotti...and the Titanic for dessert. Great bread service...combine olive oil, balsamic vinegar and Parmesan as a dip.

Chicken Scarpariello:
Chicken in lemon butter and rosemary sauce. The meat is tender, juicy and perfectly cooked. The skin is light brown and crispy. Even the breast (normally the driest part of a chicken) was juicy. The sauce was delicious. 5/5 

Manicotti:
Pasta filled with ricotta. Tomato sauce was thick and tangy. 3.5/5

Titanic:
Chocolate torta, gelato, ganache, whipped cream, pineapple, strawberry and hazelnuts. One of the best desserts I've had recently. It's a combination of their chocolate torta and gelato. Think banana split but waaaay better. This dessert (just like all of their desserts) is huuuuge. It would take 4 people to take down this behemoth. The ganache is what makes this so good. Everyone that would pass by our table would stop and admire this beauty. 5/5

Our server forced us to take our leftover dessert home. "Just freeze it and it would still be good". It looks like a mess now but it's still delicious! Service is a little slower here and our food took a long time.

Food= Amazing, Big portions yes but if you have left over take it home for later! Iv had a verity of dishes here and everything is very well prepared with tons of FLAVOR.

Service= Every time I visit Carmines the service is great! Our server last night was on top of it. He was friendly , easy to talk to and attentive. 

I made reservations 2hours before just incase they were busy to insure no wait time.

Food was amazing, I also loved the fact that we had 20 people in our after wedding party and they were able to provide the seating without a complaint. I would definitely go back without a second thought. I don't understand all of the bad reviews on here, maybe try and make sure your servers are happy and ready for a busy day in vegas. I did miss putting a 5th star because one of my drinks was forgot, luckily they did not charge us for it.

Two stars for service very good food needs to be desired. I'm a 100% Italian and never had food like this my grandmother would go back in that kitchen and smack those cooks with a wooden spoon. If you like bucca di beppo i think that's how you spell it you definitely like this  will never go back good job Carmine

My husband and I recently got married at Caesars Palace and we decided to have our reception at Carmines.  This was one of the best decisions we made on multiple levels.
1) We were lucky enough to work with Cassy, the events manager at Carmines.  From the very first encounter with Cassy when she walked us around the venue to her accommodating the ten extra people that ended up joining us for our tasting at a different date to ensuring that everything was exactly as we asked for, she was the consummate professional.  In addition, her candor and the rapport she made with us was much appreciated.  I felt like I was working with a friend and she shared in the joy of our special day while making sure every detail was met.
2) The food.  Oh my, the food.  We had a whole table of hot and cold appetizers.  Everything was delicious and exactly as it was when we had it at our tasting.  The three pastas we chose were a total hit with the guests.  Cassy gave excellent advice about which pastas would hold up in the warmers and she couldn't have been more accurate.  
3)  The staff that was on the floor was incredible.  We had servers that ensured the food amounts were always full and replenished quickly.  We had to do a last minute two-top table for my husband and I (we forgot to ask for it in our original plan) and they were able to accommodate us immediately and without an issue.  We had two bartenders that were spot-on and worked their tails off to ensure our guests didn't go thirsty.

Overall, it was the reception I had been wanting and dreaming about and I couldn't have been any happier or satisfied.

Food and service was great. Bread was wonderful drinks were strong. Pasta was wonderful. We asked for an entire basket of tomato focacia bread and they readily accommodated us. It was great. Highly recommend it.

I was at the Forum shops doing some shopping, and stopped here during one of our shopping breaks. I had always wanted to go to the one in New York but was never able to, so I was ecstatic to see this one. The food was delicious specifically the blood orange margaritas, meatball sliders, the calamari and the spinach artichoke dip we only stopped in for happy hour and it was delicious! I can only imagine how good a full meal would taste!!

Great place to have food with your group. Prices are reasonable and quality is consistent. Try the Espresso Martini and Chocolate Cherry Cordial martini. If you're an eater figure one entree for every 2 people.  Salads are huge.

I first went to carmine's in new York and wow, I was blown away! They had a carbonara that was beyond amazing! It was hands down my favorite dish. They also have a delicious bread pudding that is nothing like the typical bread pudding you would expect. It's like a light and fluffy cake with flavorful chocolate in it topped with high quality whipped cream and strawberries. Truly blown away.

I passed by this carmine's expecting the carbonara and initially the employees greeting everyone said they had it. We just ate dinner so we left and came back the very next day to have some and our waitress tells us there hasn't been carbonara since about 2 weeks because it got taken off the menu. What?!?! How disappointing.. I almost wanted to leave but I know it's a good restaurant anyways and I tried the pene al vodka which was very good. Not a carbonara but very good nonetheless. 

Something to note are the family size portions that they serve so don't be too alarmed when you see $35 for a plate. It's large enough for 3 people or 4 even depending on how much everyone eats. 

Overall a great restaurant that I'd suggest trying but I'm just sad my favorite plate is off the menu which was the whole reason I went in the first place.

We have been to this Carmine's a few times... And we have been to the ones in New York multiple times.   The hostess stand people greeted us with a very friendly reception and set us very promptly.  We started with a female server, and we were taken over by male server who could care less what was going on with our table.  The other tables around us were getting excellent service by two different waiters.   We ordered chicken Parmesan and added penne pasta, as well as an order of meatballs.  The pasta was undercooked, even by Italian standards. We never had a waiter come back to tell this problem to.  We were able to eat the chicken parm & most of the meatballs, but none of the penne.  When we could not find our waiter, I asked another waiter to please get a manager for us.  I saw the waiter go get a young lady who was in a black blazer and a dress.  He talk to her, but she never came to our table. Then our waiter finally came around and asked if we were able to finish our food, to which I told him that the pasta was undercooked and we could not eat it.  He brought us a bill, that still included pasta. I asked again for a manager so that it could be taken care of. No manager ever came but he tossed the new bill on our table but would not verbalize anything to us.  We stopped him think the hostesses for the warm reception, and reiterated that the food was good other than the Pasta.  We told them that we had asked for a manager and never received one. She did tell me that the lady that I suspected was the manager was, in fact, the manager.  She never bothered. Normally a perfect experience, but they missed the mark on 3-13-18

Silly silly, wait staff! You took one look at us and doubted we could finish anything in your family chow down establishment; everyone warning us from the hostess to the the waiter to even the bus boy that "we serve big family-style portions" and that this might be a lot for a couple. You doubted my self-assured nod each time, cuz you didn't know that the hubster and I have hyena bellies; that food is a sport for us and we are gold medal eaters. 

So when we DID finish in 15 minutes that big ol' plate of delicious linguine and clams with two cocktails plus polished off our bread basket (I mean we had to dash off to the airport to head home), all of you looked incredulous. And though we're not big people, we walked outta there like we'd just won an award. Never doubt our bellies; we got this.

This was my first time here but my uncles who were visiting go to the one in New York often so they wanted to get together here. It is a beautiful layout with an amazing wine wall in the bar area; there is an upstairs for larger parties.  This is family style much like Bucca but this place puts Bucca to shame!  The eggplant parmesean was incredible; not super fried and a lot of it! We also got some chicken wings in a lemon and butter sauce which were incredible! The food is fresh, the staff was amazing - aside from a holiday party with a DJ that was a little loud the atmosphere is perfect inside Ceasar's Palace. I will take this place over Bucca any time!

An awesome experience across the board. Bread to start is insane, Peter behind the bar whipped up a solid dirty martini and suggested the Seafood Mix Bowl, our of this world, huge pieces and chunks of lobster and crab. Great ambiance and inside Caesaer's forum, definitely worth the stop!

My husband and I stopped here for the happy hour specials. We ordered the bread, zucchini and mussels. I noticed something strange poking out of the mussel, i pulled it out and OMGGGG SO GROSS it was a CRAB! I showed the waiter and he looked horrified. The manager came to our table and said it was a crab, it's fresh seafood and that happens once in a while. Hmmm I was so grossed out i totally lost my appetite. I don't think I'll eat mussels ever again. I feel the manager could/should have done more.

Blah! Ordered the Linguini with clams. No good. Smelt and tastes like burnt garlic, too much crappy oil used to cook the dish and waaaay over priced. Wine is served in a cocktail glass instead of a wine glass ghetto!!! I get it that its "old school Italian" but if were keeping up with "old school Italian" why did they offer me Cheese with my shellfish? This place should pack up and retire.

The best Italian food in Las Vegas by way of NYC. And the best porterhouse steak in Las Vegas as well. Carmines is a family style restaurant hence the high prices. But one entre' is enough for three people.  The seafood here is also the best you will find in this city.  Ask anyone from Maine how the lobster is here and they'll tell you " outstanding"! The Vegas location offers bar portions too for those sitting solo or who just want a smaller dish. Not all owns are available in this size though. Don't bother with any other Italian restaurants in Vegas..... Just go here. Great place to go too solo since 95% of the places here expect a solo diner to go to Burger King. Carmine's will never forgot your sitting there.

Food was very good it feels like you are in a Italian family's kitchen...portions are very big tho... this place is perfect for a big group of ppl, we had the Diablo 2lb yes it was HUGE the cesar salad was huge to... friendly staff and you can have wadding party's here to...really nice place...

This was a great evening out with friends. Our server Michael Baker did a great job not only being attentive but also with entertaining us. Food was great too. Highly recommend if you get to Las Vegas to eat here. Family style so portions are huge.
What a GREAT place! We had our Thanksgiving dinner here and it was truly amazing! The whole family loved it and will go back again!

Stumbled upon this restaurant with my boyfriend and the hosts suggested we sit in the bar because of the bar specials!!! We ordered vodka penne and we LOVED it!!!!! HUGE portions even when you order the smaller sized platter at the bar!! The bread basket was amazing as well with the wine! We just wish the bread was warm, but hey I still ate the whole basket..still amazing!!

We live in California and want to go back just to eat here again!!!
Excellent restaurant!   Seafood Linguine is amazing. Best if you have 4 or more diners.  Family style portions.

I enjoyed everything about this restaurant - the food, server and atmosphere was quite an enjoyable experience. 

We ordered the Caesar salad, antipasto, fillet mignon , 2 pasta dishes and desert. The fillet mignon dish was the Thursday night special. This dish was spectacular - the meat melted in your mouth, the flavor had me thinking that I've been cooking beef the wrong way and veggies on the platter were cooked as though they just came out of the ground and put straight into the sauté pan. 

My recommendation is to go with a large group because it truly is family style dining. We had 8 adults and 2 kids, and we still went home with 20lbs of leftovers.

Came here for our anniversary and couldn't have picked a better spot! The food was some of the best Italian we've ever had and our waiter was amazing. (So sorry I forgot his name!)They even brought us out this insane dessert to help us celebrate. Definitely would recommend this spot if you want some really yummy Italian food, a great atmosphere and exceptional service!
Excited to go and try this place out, limited bar, not many flavored vodkas and food was mediocre at best, Maggiano's is much better, will not be back!

We were working an event across the walkway from Carmine's and were initially drawn here because of convenience, but came back the next day and will probably come back tomorrow too! Since we were working, our team of three was planning to come eat in shifts however Carmine's is family style. I was worried this would cause a problem, but the wonderful ladies in the bar (Gina and Colleen) in addition to their awesome manager Anthony were completely willing to help us out! They let me sit at a table in the bar to order and eat before I had our other two girls filter in one after the other.

The food is fabulous and the service and willingness to be flexible was even better! So great. If you like Italian food and great people, come to Carmine's!

Came here with a large party celebrating a birthday.  First off they're great at accommodating large parties and bringing the food out at a good pace.  Especially for getting the food out to all of the tables at the same time.  The table bread, calamari, chicken wings, and broccoli were awesome!  The other food seemed to be pretty much on par with other Italian places such as Maggiano's.  Service was great, very attentive.

Your host staff tonight needs some major training. We call from inside the Forum Shops and were informed that there was a 15 min wait. One of our party goes to the host stand and the three girls tell him it will be a 15-25 min wait, and ask for his #. He gives it to one of them and she enters the wrong #, he corrects her and she enters it wrong three more times because of her ridiculous fake nails. No apologies just a "we'll text ya" We wait 30 min without a text and watch 3 other groups get seated immediately. We approach the stand and see that there are 3 empty tables. One of the girls catches an attitude and accuses us of ignoring the text. The person that gave his number shows his history on his phone which doesn't have anything received from the restaurant. Again no apologies, just a shrug and a "Oh well". We inquire about the empty tables and are informed that they aren't ready yet and again it will be 15min, and another request for a # so they can text us. We provide the number and wait outside. 15 min go by and 5 parties are seated without hesitation. Overhearing their conversations none of them had reservations either. We approach the stand again and one of them tells us yet again we will get to you in 15 min we need are waiting for your table to be cleared. We ask her why she is seating other groups of the same size ahead of us and she just points at the one with the fake nails. She then proceeds to seat another group that just walked up.
We left and walked down the hallway and had a wonderful dinner at Cheescake Factory instead. That text we were supposed to receive? We didn't receive it until an hour into our meal at the other restaurant.
Tonight was a real shame too, you are one of my favorite restaurants and we dine their frequently but your staff tonight may have cost you our business and we definitely won't be introducing others to your business.

Food was delicious!   Staff was super nice! Went on a Monday night.  They had the NCAA March Madness championship basketball game on.  No reservation. Crowded but did not have to wait since it was just my husband and I. Sat at a high top table and was able to order off the Jr menu/bar menu.   We ordered an appetizer and entree.  We couldn't finish it all and took back leftovers to our hotel.  Highly recommend!! (Of note: I have also been to the Atlantic City restaurant and this was also A+ in my book)

I brought my girlfriend to Carmines for her birthday dinner. I've been to the NYC location and was blown away that i had to bring her to the Vegas location. We ordered the Carmines salad and shared the chicken marsala. Keep in mind that this place is like Buca de Beppo, family style plates so the portions are huge. What can i say, the good is amazing! My gifriend loved it and stated she would definitely return. Outstanding service as well.

I went here with a group of six and everyone was pretty bombed after a fun afternoon on the strip.  Dinner suggestions popped up, but options got slimmer when a companion meeting us was sporting a Randy "Macho Man" Savage t-shirt.  Giada was undoubtedly out of the question.  Carmine's welcomed us with open arms.  

My jaw dropped as the hostess walked us to our table.  I gawked and commented out loud to no one in particular on the enormous portions at other tables.  Yeah, it's family style, but who's family??  The Brady Brunch with Alice?  Joey Chestnut's family???  The Klumps????  Monstrous plates of pasta were everywhere!!

The spicy wings were a fantastic appetizer.  $32 got us 24 wings, sliced fennel as opposed to celery, and their homemade bleu cheese dip.  Carmine's isn't a typical place to order wings, but these were some of the best I've had in recent memory.  The tomato based sauce had nice spicy kick and went so well with the thick dip.  The fennel grew on me bite after bite as it kind of worked as a palette cleanser.     

Then all the main entrees came out.  Good god!!  The chicken parmigiana had ton of cheese on top and managed not to be dry despite being hammered super thin.  Ragu with meatballs was suggested by our server and he didn't steer us wrong.  I overheard someone else say the meatballs were "tender as fuck".  I agreed.  

The main event was the "Four Pasta Special" which is only available Sundays.  If you have a chance to check out my picture, just look at how small the server's hand/wrist looks compared to the dish.  It looks like a child brought this dish over!  We barely made a dent in it.  I enjoyed lasagna and gnocchi the most.

My wife and I could never eat here by ourselves unless I cleared my car trunk out to make room for the leftovers.  The ones I did have on this particular evening came in a large aluminum buffet pan (no joke) and weighed at least 5 pounds.  If a full on Italian pig out is what you're looking for, look no further.

Located in the old Planet Hollywood spot inside the Forum shops, this place is pretty good.  High ceilings with plenty of pictures and an impressive bar that climbs up to the ceiling.  Or server who was from Brooklyn was efficient but not over friendly, NY attitude for sure.  As all the other reviews state, this place has huge portions but if there is only two of you, eat at the bar, they have portions for 2.  I was part of a party of 6.  We had the calamari, seafood pasta and spaghetti with sausage and meatballs.  Seafood pasta had a whole lobster in it.  It was full of calamari, shrimp and clams.  Delicious.  Meatballs were great too.  It was plenty of food for 6 with leftovers.  Tiramasu was a whole cake, delicious.  Impressed.

First timers and will for sure be back. Fantastic service, great for families (kids or not) and casual or dressy. It shouldn't matter if your a local or not but the manager heard we were and he made sure our experience was fantastic. I recommend this place because they did an all around fantastic restaurant experience! 
I gave four stars just because the special was way too $$$ for what we got.

We went with a very large group... Over 30 people. We had three tables. The food was delicious. The service was spot on. The portions were huge! The prices were more than fair. Great place for large group.

Having been to Carmine's in NYC we knew what to expect in the way of portion size and the general menu. Carmine's salad was very good the veal parmigiana and the rigatoni with proscuitto were just ok. Veal a little overdone and the rigatoni was the same as any mediocore Italian place serves in NY. And what's with the glasses? Small glass for water (Vegas, Dry, Hot) same small glass for wine. I know that is how it is served in Italy but dude this is Nevada. Capisce?

We went to Carmines for Happy Hour after a show in Vegas last week. We had originally wanted to go there for dinner, but time did not permit. We had drinks which were reasonably priced. The wine and beer were $5.00. We also had three different appetizers, all of which were very good. We had meatball sliders, with a side of marinara sauce. They were delicious and the sauce was yummy! We also had the calamari with a side of marinara and toasted ravioli again with marinara sauce. Being from St. Louis (where toasted ravioli originated) I've had better, but Carmines marinara is so delicious, made it so good!

The next time we go to Las Vegas, we will definitely go there for dinner!

Designed for family style dining. If you are a party of two order only one dish 'entree' because the portions are quite large. But I must say that for a place that serves large numbers, the food quality was really great. Quite tasty and our waiter was very attentive. I'm ready to go back now.

I've been to the Carmine's in NYC many many years ago, and more recently to this Las Vegas location. I have also have come to learn that the Chicago Carmine's has no relation to either of these which may be the reason I don't seem to care of Carmine's in Chicago... yet I digress. Carmine's Las Vegas can be best described by three words: large, hearty, Italian.

We ended up here with a huge group of friends a couple months back when in Las Vegas and of course did everything family style. They serve all the Italian classics you can possibly dream of and are not shy at all with the portions. My favorite was the rigatoni! Their red sauce has that nice deep and rich flavor to it. Yums!

Anyways, would highly recommend making reservations ahead of time as it does seem to be quite the popular spot. No issues with the service here. Very prompt to grab you another drink and refill your waters, which is always appreciated when you find yourself drinking on and off the entire weekend in Vegas. I'll have to say its definitely a bit on the pricier side of the spectrum, but with the large portions you'll definitely have leftovers to take home. So all in all you do seem to get what you paid for.

Not sure I got much else on this one. 'Til next time, cheers!

100/365

We arrived for dinner around 7pm, and decided to sit near the bar for smaller portions. (TIP: main room is for family size portions 3-4 people, the bar seating has junior portions 1-2 people, which you can seat yourselves). 

We ordered the broccoli and sausage penne pasta (~$18) and the chicken combo sandwich (~$17) for the two of us Definitely WAY TOO MUCH FOOD for 2; probably could feed 3 or 4. 

The chicken sandwich was huge (about the size of a foot long), and came with a side salad. The flavor wasn't my favorite so I stuck to my pasta. The penne was also huge, cooked perfectly al dente, and though there was way too much sauce, it was delicious with the broccoli. We probably ate 1/2 of both entrees and had to wave our white flag to surrender. 

Our server/bartender was awesome, and was probably one of the highlights of our meal.

Italian food, family style, I am in.  It's the spouses favorite Italian restaurant in NY (she's a NY Italian), so I assumed it would be good.  She had to have the tartufi.  The food we had was all great!  I enjoyed it very much.  They waste a lot of water by putting a pitcher on each table (not wise for a desert during a drought).  I look toward to going back.

Every single time my husband's parents visits I know where we'll end up. We love the venue and their staff. We typically go to dinner with about 5 of us. Carmine's is known for their family size dishes. Reasonably priced and great place to people watch through the forum shops. A few must haves-chicken Park, garlic bread, and spaghetti meatball. Don't forget the tiramisu for dessert! Enjoy!

Average food in a cool setting with great soundtrack playing in the background.  I wouldn't suggest the calamari as I found it a bit greasy and bland.  Squeezing lemon over it helped add flavor but not enough.

This place is GREAT! Feels like being in Italy! Food is Italian authentic. Large family portions worth the price. I have had several dishes and have been extremely pleased with ALL of them! A MUST try! 
Waiter "BAKER"is the best!!!

Stopped in and had lunch here. I have eaten at one in the Bahamas before. The atmosphere is hard to beat. The portions are big enough for 3-4 people easy, as it's family style. We ordered chicken parmigiana and portobello parmigiana. Both were fine only thing that prevents the fifth star is that you had to pay an extra 12 dollars for noodles with the chicken parmigiana.  I would eat here again.

I've visited Carmine's in Atlantic City, NJ and honestly my experience was far better here in Vegas. Customer Service is quick and the quality of the food was much better. This is your white table cloth traditional family style Italian restaurant. 

By Family style we're talking about extended family! HUMONGOUS portions delivered to your table to feast on. A menu filled with a plethora of pasta, salad, meat and dessert dishes are displayed on the wall of the restaurant for patrons to choose from. My party of 4 opted for the famous Jumbo Shrimp Parmesan and spaghetti. This meal was perfect. Pasta was cooked to perfection and THE SHRIMP! I don't even like shrimp. The shrimp were HUGE, fresh, and succulent.. Lightly breaded to give it a crisp texture. Not overly cheesy or salty. Our party could hardly finish the platter after over indulging in the bread basket. 

If you are traveling with family or a group make this your 1st dinner destination.  This is a deliciously cost effective way to dine.

As a big fan of their Bahamas location I was excited for Carmine's to open in Las Vegas but to my surprise it was a huge disappointment! :(  Service was horrible (waiter took our order and pretty much forgot about us) and the dishes are cooked better in the Bahamas. Listed below is what our meal entailed: (Hope it helps)

Calamari: The best dish of the night. 

Carmine's Salad: Don't waste your money on this. The salad tasted bitter. 

Beef Tenderloin: This was their Thursday special but don't waste your $79.99 because there is nothing special about this plate. It took over an hour to come out and it looks like a lot of meat but in actuality they stuff the plate with a lot of potatoes and layer the beef on top. It was dry and unsatisfying.

Vodka Pasta: Good dish nothing to rave about. 

I recommend if you want to eat at Carmine's book a trip to Atlantis!! :)

The idea is fun and the atmosphere is very Maggiano's like (kinda of homey italian feel).   Their pasta portion size is big.  One pasta dish (around $30) serves about 4, and since we had a party of 5 the waiter recommended a salad with a past.

Knowing that we are going to need some left over we decided to get two pasta dishes.  We got the ragu with the three types of meat and this other vegetarian one.  To be honest, if the pasta was not so salty it may deserve a 3 or 4 star.  But oh my god, I have no idea who put that ridiculous amount of salt in the pasta, but I was drinking a cup of water for every bite of pasta.  

I definitely do not recommend this place considering how salty the pasta is.  Not worth it.

Walking to Carmine's real treat we were friendly and politely greeted by staff members. Upon walking in and being seated we were asked if we need a highchair. When the high chair was delivered to us the seat fastner was broken. I brought it to the attention of the staff member seeing this and she promptly brought me out a another chair to replace the broken one.
Unfortunately, the highchair that she brought me out was also broken and the seat strap unusable. When I brought to her attention she simply shrugged at me and said "I don't know" and walked away. So, not so good on the server-side. 
Aside from that mishap, the food was The food was good.

We had the porterhouse which came to my delight covered in garlic and olive oil absolutely phenomenal.

We also ordered the angel hair with oil and garlic and chicken Big mistake the chicken was dry as the Las Vegas desert we are surrounded by.

When it comes to lasagna, I'm afraid the lasagna leaves much to be desired. 
It falls apart easily as you're cutting it and it's nearly impossible to serve without dropping back into the plate or onto the table. 

These things combined with the fact of the lasagna is very bland and has almost no original taste of it's own. It seems it inherently flavor from the sauce surrounding it. Both the Ricota filing and the meat sauce used to build the layers I'm afraid need a little more work.

When I heard this restaurant had opened in Caesar's palace I was SO excited!!   I loved eating there in NYC and now it would be a little closer!   The EGGPLANT PARMIGIANA and Spaghetti with meatballs are my absolute favorite!  I love that everything is family style and there is such a large amount of food to share.   The service, ambience, and food are all stellar in my book!   I love coming here whether it is in Vegas or NYC!

This is now a must when I go to Vegas! Fabulous Italian food! Everything here tastes amazing and the portions are huge. Each entree feeds multiple people so be sure to order wisely otherwise you will be leaving with a lot of food. My family and I came here for dinner and there were 9 of us. We ordered calamari as an appetizer, meatballs, chicken Parmesan, and rigatoni in vodka sauce and all 9 of us were stuffed. It was plenty of food for our large group! So delicious!

I am a local. The service is terrible and our waiter (Luiz) was rude, you'd think having a restaurant inside of a hotel such as Caesars Palace, the waiters would have some sort of professional training (which he had greatly lacked). I ordered stuffed mushrooms which didn't come and politely asked to cancel the order and make sure it's not on our bill, a simple apology would have sufficed, the waiter instead starts off by saying "well you didn't order it from me". The food was average and nothing special. It is definitely a place I do not intend on returning to. If possible I would give 0 stars if I could.

Update on my previous review - we went back for our rehearsal dinner and it was PERFECT!  The food was amazing, we got tons of amazing, positive feedback on everything,  especially the shrimp parmigana - including some raving reviews from a very hard to please relative who usually doesn't like anything. Thank you so much to all the staff and our planner who made it such a memorable night!

My spouse retired (finally!!!) and I brought him and seven friends to Carmine's to celebrate on October 8. Radu was our waiter and he was great. He gave us suggestions on what to order and was very attentive. The food and service were excellent. Radu made sure everything went smoothly and took excellent care of all eight of us. I will definitely go back to Carmine's.

Just came back from a huge meal at this fine establishment. This was our first main meal in Vegas and might I say it was the best. Not sure if anything could top that. The executive chefs Michael and Jeff even came out to the table as we were there with someone who knew them personally. We took our servers recommendations as we had never been there before. Went with the Carmine's salad to start, followed by cheese ravioli with a vodka sauce, and the lemon chicken with a caper sauce. DELICIOUS!!!!

The dessert was fantastic! We had the Titanic which was gigantic! This thick brownie consistency bottom, topped with 3 scoops of vanilla ice cream and then 3 scoops of chocolate ice cream. Bananas, chocolate cookie type things. AWESOME! We were so full by that time that we did not eat but just a few bites, but what we did eat was amazing!
Would DEFINITELY return here on my next trip to Vegas!

This place is totally meant for a group due to the family-style platters, which I did not realize until we sat down, but it was good experience nonetheless. I have always wanted to try Carmine's when I have been to NYC, but for some reason (probably the extremely long wait for a table), have never been. Since a lot of iconic NY eateries have made their mark on Vegas though, I have been able to try some of these hard-to-get spots, including Carmine's. We started with a delicious green salad, ordered from the "bar" menu at the suggestion of our server, as that size is a bit smaller and more appropriate for a duo like my husband and I. I ordered a delicious drink that I would love to replicate at home - it had lime, lemon juice, and blood orange, but was amazingly fresh and crisp! Our main was the chicken parmesan, which was delicious, cheesy, and crunchy. You order the pasta separately for around $12 to complete the meal and I would say you need it - the tomato sauce the meal comes with is super fresh and simple, the way I like it. The bread served here was pretty good, too. I was a fan of the awesome tomato focaccia bread, yum! Too bad we were stuffed, otherwise the dessert menu here looks really good. And if you're in a large group, the calamari looked divine, but would be a heap of food for two.  Our server was really nice, not attitude-y at all, and helpful in accommodating our small party.
My Sicilian family would love this place! Very kitschy decor, a la Dolce Vita. I would definitely recommend Carmine's for a group.

We booked a reservation for a large soccer team party of 40 people. Carmines had the best service from the group sales to the waiters and staff. They accommodated every need and the food was amazing. The spaghetti and meatballs were such a crowd pleaser. We had a set menu and there was not one thing we did not like. Great job and we will be back.

I fulfilled a bucket list item by finding a Carmine's and actually getting to eat there. Chicken parm and shrimp with white sauce were very tasty. Caesar salad was fresh and good. Would love to try eggplant parm and other dishes someday!

Amazing appetizers, drinks and dinner. Server provided excellent recommendation to start dinner with meatball sliders...I am still thinking about them! The caesar salad was fresh and perfectly dressed. Our pasta was fabulous. I highly recommend Carmine's. My only regret was there was absolutely no room for dessert.

Absolutely delicious Italian! Family style portion sizes. Ordered calamari, portabello mushroom salad and stuffed artichoke, all were absolutely amazing and we had so much leftover. Bring your appetite and enjoy!!!

I came here because I grew up in NY and loved the restaurant there... I love the ambiance and I love that there's no wait (usually had to wait over an hour in NY)! However the food is way too salty. We ordered the calamari and rigatoni with sausage. All I remember is drinking water afterwards. I really wanted to give it a chance and went a second time and same thing... everything was way too salty.

If you like POOP in your food then you'll love Carmine's. 4 of 8 people in our party got food poisoning. Symptoms ranging from migraine, severe stomach cramping, diarrhea and vomit ting. Called the manager in the morning and he said he's been a restaurant manager for 20 years and "If this was from the actual food being bad, the symptoms would show up in about 24 hours, when its immediate like in this case, its from someone not washing their hands".  He asked to call everyone in our party to check on them...never did.  Did not offer to reimburse or compensate in any way.  Manager was supposed to call back, NEVER DID.  After 3 hostile messages left, he finally called back.  He said "how did he know that our group didn't eat somewhere together before Carmine's?  How did he know it came from his restaurant?  Did anyone go to the doctor to prove they were sick?"  We met at Carmines for our friends 25 year wedding anniversary and the guest of honor had to emergency stop on the way home to blow up and spent the rest of the night running to the toilet.  The manager went on about how the restaurant is new..etc..etc..finally after aggressively reasoning with this poor excuse of a manager, he agreed to refund the dinner.  Since the credit cards have been reimbursed, I am now writing this review.  I've lived in Vegas 32 years, a hotel admin major in school and HAVE NEVER seen a manager handle SICK CUSTOMERS FROM POOP IN THEIR FOOD like this.
PS Calling the health department

I've been here twice now and the food has consistently been delicious. Made reservations in advance and was seated pretty quickly there after. Food is served family style and portions are massive.

Started out with the Caesar salad which was so big it was falling off of the plate. Because we were so stuffed from that and the basket of bread served beforehand, we only ordered one entree. The chicken Parmesan arrived and it seemed to overflow from the plate. The dish was crispy, and dripping with cheese and sauce.

Everything was seasoned well and delicious. My only complaints, and I am digging for them are the water cups are super tiny, so you're constantly refilling...and because it's crowded, it can be quite noisy. Like I said, I am digging for things to complain about. And a bonus feature is the restaurant has its own bathroom, so you do not have to venture outside to find it. 

The food here tastes as good as it smells. If that's not a huge endorsement, I don't know what else is!

Good for large parties, entertaining to have such large plates, decent food and price 

"The dishes are big!" And the waiter was not just talking about the porcelain! This is definitely a place to take a large group of people who enjoy sharing and don't mind not getting their own dishes. 

Carmine's boast their traditional Italian home cooking style- think big families around a table. I would say it's most optimal for a party of 6 or more. 

I went with a party of 5 and we got 1 appetizer and 2 main dishes. Luckily my cousin lives in Vegas so she took the leftovers home or otherwise it would have been a waste since I don't want to take it back to the hotel room. 

We had the fried zucchini appetizer which really good. It comes as a foot-tall mound of fried zucchini strings. Makes everyone's eyes pop out by the sight of it. The. We had the veal marsala (okay could pass but the mushrooms were cooked well), the special of the day - rack of lamb (cooked well), and the pasta pomadaro (good too).

We had a large party if 15, and they were friendly, efficient, and the food was surprisingly good even though everything was family size and style. 

The Sat steak special dish was fantastic, as was the seafood pasta. The rigatoni with sausage and broccoli, and chicken Marsala was solid.  The antipasto salad and combination appetizer dishes were just okay.

The salad was huge, so we wished we only order 1, and same with the appetizers cu they were only so-so

Overall though it was a great place for a large group meal, with extremely reasonable prices for Vegas!

I used to love Carmine's in NYC.  As a college student, and an Italian, it was a treat eating at Carmine's in the City.  The portions were HUGE and the food was delicious.  However, going to Carmine's in Las Vegas was not the Carmine's I remember.  We ordered a few appetizers.  The stuffed mushrooms were probably 4 stars, while the mozzarella and tomatoes were at 3.

For entrees we ordered Penne alla Vodka (4 stars), Angel Hair and shrimp (2 stars), and Chicken Parm (3 stars).  The Penne was al dente and the sauce was good.  That is the only dish I would recommended. I love all parm dishes (chicken parm, veal parm, eggplant parm).  However, this one was OK. The chicken was tender, but the cheese was not melted throughout the piece of chicken.  While the edges were nicely melted, the center of the pieces still had unmelted cheese. 

With so many restaurants in Vegas, I don't know if I'll be back to Carmine's.  For italian food, there are def better choices.

As I pondered what I really wanted for dinner out after Diane would return from playing poker, I pretty quickly decided that it had to be "Sausage & Peppers".  Putting in that search term on Yelp, I looked for where I could find a great rendition of this Italian staple.  And the best reviewed dish seemed to be at Carmine's, where I recalled I had enjoyed this once before.  A color photo of this entree, which happened to include onions as well, sealed the deal for me.  So when Diane returned, off we went to the Strip on a busy Friday night for me to satisfy my craving.  Even though Carmine's serves platters family style, neither Diane nor I cared what the cost or overage would be.  We could always bring home leftovers.

After finally reaching valet parking at Caesar's Colosseum, we strolled on over to Carmine's inside the Forum Shops, and secured a table for two at 10:15 p.m.  The place at this late hour was still 2/3 full.  Supplied with a table for four looking right onto the mall walkway, we were ready to get down to some serious eating.  And so we did.

To get things started I ordered a Caesar Salad, which arrived with enough Romaine Lettuce to feed six diners.  At our server's suggestion, I ordered it with light dressing, and extra dressing on the side, so leftover salad would not get too soggy.  But, alas, the extra dressing was not forthcoming.  So, I had to ask for it again, meanwhile masticating very thinly dressed leaves and a few croutons.  Finally the extra dressing arrived.  It was thick and viscous, and when ladled on the great expanse of lettuce leaves made all the difference in taste.  Strips of Mozzarella Cheese and an ample supply of nicely seasoned croutons in cube shape also contributed to an authentic and well-flavored Caesar Salad.

When ordering my entree of Sausage, Peppers & Onions, I sought to augment it with still more ingredients.  First were Roasted Potatoes, but this was changed to a side of Contadina Potatoes when Diane decided that she wanted them to go with her Veal Marsala without mushrooms, too.  Then I imagined the Red and Green Roasted Peppers mixing with Penne.  So an order for Penne was placed.  When separate platters of Sausage, Onions, & Peppers; Contadina Potatoes; and Penne arrived and were conjoined by me, I decided that something was still missing to meld everything well together.  I tried to put my finger on the absent ingredient, and soon came up with the solution.  It was Marinara Sauce!

So I asked an attentive busboy for some Marinara Sauce.  He said he would check with our server to see if an extra charge applied, and I replied, "It doesn't matter.  Just bring it."  (Ultimately I was not charged for this.)  When a hot bowl of wonderful mild Marinara Sauce soon arrived and was mixed with the Sausage, well-roasted Green and Red Peppers, nicely sweated White Onions, and memorable Roasted Potatoes, it was just the thing to make my entree whole.  An hour later I had consumed half of the platter of salad, and a little over half of the Sausage, Peppers, & Onions; while Diane was able to polish off five of seven scallops of veal overlaid with delectable Marsala Sauce.  Together we also ate most of the Penne, and consumed all of the potatoes.  I gladly paid a bill of over $150 for two, and didn't mind.  For, all of the food obtained would have comfortably served six, and I finished off a quarter more of the salad and all the rest of the Sausage, Onions, & Peppers at next day's lunch. 

While the hostess and managers were friendly, and our busboy fairly attentive, our sever was not.  Besides forgetting to bring the extra salad dressing, he only asked if I wanted any more Iced Tea once, just as I was looking around to request that of him late in the meal.  So I was only furnished with two Iced Teas in the space of 90 minutes.  And then after asking our waiter if he could box up the unused Caesar Dressing to go with the salad, he said, "Sure!"  But when we arrived home, no such dressing was in our to go bag.  He also had a habit of referring to me repeatedly as "Buddy" when I am silver haired and likely more than twice his age, which I thought was not very professional or appropriate.

So, while the food was again five-star worthy in quality and taste, the inattentive wait-service this time lost a star.  What was promised was not always delivered.  I will still return, because the service was exemplary the other two times I have dined here, and the cooking here is first-rate.

Where do I begin! 
We're from the NYC area and my boyfriend loves Carmine's. always talks about it. But I had never tried it, so we finally did yesterday in Vegas and it was amazing. I mean the decor was very neat. I'm a total food, wine, hospitality junkie and I had never seen a wine rack so tall! The photos on the walls were authentic and really told a story about the place. We were greeted by a nicely dressed host who welcomed us with a warm smile and brought us over to our table. A few moments later, our waiter Frank introduced himself. He had a ton of knowledge and answered every question we had about the mouth watering menu. Frank was the ideal waiter to have, at my first time at Carmine's. we were lucky to have gotten there a little bit after lunch time because we were able to  order from the lunch menu, which had smaller portions, which were still big! We ended up getting garlic bread, half with cheese. Which I thought was cool. Most places don't offer you the option. And then we shared a lunch size Penne Ala Vodka. And we still had left overs!!! Perfect Italian cooked pasta. None of that over cooked mushy shit. The food was excellent. The place was organized and beautiful. The bathrooms were clean. And the service was awesome. Our waiter was friendly and fun to talk to! Although he did tell us he was a Raiders fan. Ha ha. Recommending Carmine's to everyone I know! I also can't wait to dine at the NYC and DC locations! High expectations! Keep up the good work and hospitality, Vegas!

We had seen Carmine's during our recent shopping trip to The Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace and decided to give it a try for dinner prior to attending the April 30 Elton John concert. The ambience is casual and New York Italian (as am I) with a lot of energy in the air. It was prom night so there were several groups of prom goers who as an aside looked great all decked out.
To say Carmine's serves "family style" is a little misleading unless you come from a large family. The portions are huge. Our waiter advised my wife and I to stick to a single entrée and order it over pasta (for $12 upcharge) rather than ordering a separate pasta dish for twice the price. We took his advice and had the chicken parmesan over spaghetti and really enjoyed it.One note, Carmine's has a Food Valet service, at no charge, which was a new term for me but what they do is box up your leftovers, keep them in a refrigerator and deliver it to you when you check back in at their front desk when you return after whatever you're doing after dinner. We tried it out and it worked perfectly so tonight is a repeat of last night's dinner.
The couple next to us ordered a Caesar's salad which looked to be 1 1/2 heads of Romaine lettuce. They each had two or three dishes worth of salad and hadn't made a dent in it so after repeated offers by them I tried the salad. It was quite good; stronger on the anchovy taste than garlic but really pretty mild. I saw their spaghetti and meatballs which like everything else was huge. Given portion sizes the prices at Carmine's are very reasonable; cheap by The Strip restaurant standards.
The service was excellent and everything we tried tasted very good. I will definitely return but I'd like to have two other couples with us so we can try a couple more entrees. Three couple with three entrees will mean leftovers for all.

After walking around for close to an hour trying to find a dinner spot we would like, we came across Carmine's and decided to give it a try. The decor reminded me a little bit of Maggiano's, as did the family style menu they have. We ordered an appetizer and a pasta plate to share amongst 4 people and it was MORE than enough food and both items were very tasty! The prices were real steep, but that's to be expected on the Strip. The service was pretty attentive, except for having to ask for water refills quite often. If you're looking for a solid meal on the Strip, I would recommend Carmine's!

Was just so-so. Brought out a basket of 5 or 6 kinds of bread & none of them were memorable, actually pretty blah.  I got ravioli with Bolognese sauce.  The sauce was pretty good but the cheese ravioli were boring.

We had lunch today and was greeted promptly. The hostess explained the menu was on the wall....which is hard to see! Prices will shock you until you realize these are family size plates.....not that our waiter offered that info until we asked. The Calamari was the best I've eaten. 

So, if you wonder why only 2 stars. It is for the service! We ordered our drinks 3x with different wait staff before we got them. Then a manager came by to ask how was everything? We told them not good. We didn't have our drinks and still haven't ordered. All they did was send someone else over!?! My son ordered chocolate milk which was Powdered Hot chocolate stirred with milk. How do I know? The waitress told is when we complained about the chunks and taste. Really?  Just say you DON'T have Chocolate milk. Oh, and we still got charged for it. I will only get take out IF we ever return.

Fabulous dinner!!! The family style portions could feed a small army. Everything we tried, Lamb, Manicotti, Veal Parm. It was all fantastic!!! there were 10 of us for dinner and not a single person walked away hungry
Had a reservation for a graduation party then got told we had to wait 35 mins we ended up going next door to the burger place and had a blast.

I have been to this place twice and pretty much enjoyed both times. I had reservations both times so I didn't have to wait. While I didn't have to wait, many people did. One tip I would give you is to request for them not to place you in the front. If you do, you will have people waiting to eat staring at you like you are in a fish bowl. The food might be some of the best Italian food I have ever had. The location is in an amazing spot, the price is still reasonable and not out of hand. 

What kept me from going this place 5 stars was the service. I don't the service I received was not the best. I wish I remembered her name. I don't know if it was the number of people in there, but I expect good service no matter what. Plus some of us got our food 10 mins after others, That was not cool.

This was the second time we have been to this restaurant.  Both times we enjoyed the food - although had the same thing both times.  Salad, pasta and chicken parigiana.  

We arrived a few minutes a head of our guest and we ordered a class of wine.  The waiter brought the wine and left it.  He did not offer to pour the first glass he just dropped it and left. 

The first time we visited this restaurant we ordered the pasta on the side and it wasn't a problem, this time it was.  The waiter insisted that we have the parigiana placed on top of the pasta.  So we did.  No biggie just didn't want it that way. 

The first time we were the the waiter was amazing.  Very helpful and offered his opinion when we asked.  This time we were told what was good and I felt that there was a little eye rolling when we did not order the $48.00 special.  

Our food was delivered by a runner - no big deal but the waiter did not return to our table until we were at least half finished.  We were not even asked if we wanted ground pepper on our salad.

Our waiter did show up to tell us about dessert but again really just wanted us to order what ever the special was for the night. We declined but did order dessert.  We ordered regular coffee as well. 

Around 10:00 (I think) our waiter started his side work - removed our salt and pepper shakers etc.  Did a few other things around our table, refilled our coffee once brought us the bill that my husband paid and then he was gone.  Never told us he was leaving for the evening.  We continued to sit and enjoy our conversation until around 10:45 but no one bothered with us again. 

We are locals and have lots and lots of people that come to town to visit us.  After our first wonderful experience we were thinking that this was going to be our go to restaurant.  Not so sure after last nights experience.
Family style eating.  Everything was very filling.  The ambiance is great despite being in a casino.

Food was good! Huge portions-definitely for sharing! Service was attentive! Reasonable prices! 

This restaurant is worth a try....

I'm pretty sure every other person to review this place has said this, but the portions are MASSIVE. Eating at Carmine's is truly a feast and good enough to be your only meal of the day. Surprisingly though, our portion of the clams was pretty tiny and just enough for 2-3 people. However, the ravioli and fettuccine compensated. We were full to the brim with a ton of leftovers even in a group of 5 people. The prices are pretty decent for the quantity of food you get, and it may not be the best Italian food you've had but it is still pretty good. The ambience is super nice and the place is in the heart of Caesars too.

Carmine's in the Caesar's Palace Forum Shoppes is a terrific evening for you and friends, couples and such.  It epitomizes Italian cuisine served in family portions.  The ambiance is unique, friendly, kinda sexy/cozy and well worth a night of dining.
    While with 7 other friends we went without a reservation on a Friday night (8:00PM) and were seated in under 10 minutes.   Drinks came quickly after a great server gave us a rundown of specials, one of which we ordered (read on).
    Ours was a semi-business dinner so as drinks were being served we were going around the table in discussion.  Soon after I was provided a second drink service by the manager with the server saying, "Our manager didn't believe you were having a good time by the non-passionate look on your face.  Enjoy."  Now readers, when was the last time that ever happened to you in a nice restaurant.  Carmine's went way up the charts for me on that one.
     We dined on a special which was breaded chicken filets covered in provolone cheese coupled with pasta.  Another entree was lasagna.  The third was a fettucini in a white veggie-based sauce.  Each meal was delicious, huge portions that would easily feed 3 - 4 people dining.  And the total bill was manageable for 8 guys.
     I highly recommend anyone in Vegas pay a visit to Carmine's - big time good food and fun times.

Came here for dinner on a Friday night.  It is a big restaurant with big portions.  Everything is family style and their were only 2 of us so we got appetizers.  I had the portabello mushroom appetizer and it was cheesy fantasticness(--- good enough to make up a word).  They brought out a basket with 4 or 5 different kinds of bread that were not disappointing.  The waiter was really helpful and nice and took his time with us.  The manager even came over to welcome us at one point.  If your in the area looking for Italian then you should check this place out.

I like how they give you an option to dine in the main dining room and eat large family style meals or sit at/near the bar and have appetizers and smaller plates which are still enough for 2. Meatball sliders are OUTSTANDING, garlic bread was delicious as well. The Italian sandwich had lots of flavor. Came in for a small bite but got tons of food, everything looked good and we kept hearing great things about this place. Will be back!

Came here for my son's birthday. Party of 7  with 4 of them being 20something guys.  This is a great place for big groups.  The guys loved it and ate and are and are!

We started with the Caesar's salad, which was perfectly dressed and super fresh.  We also had the antipasto which my hubby and I lived but the guys thought a little exotic.  (They are burgers and fries kind of guys).

We had veal scalllopini, spaghetti with sausage and meatballs and lasagna.  A hearty carb fest for all! Nom nom! All were delish!

We finished with the amazing Italian Cheesecake.  Super light and fluffy! 

Definitely a do again place! Yummy!

LOVED THIS PLACE! Our waitress was great! The food was so awesome! We only dropped in because of the smell. The plates are HUGE! One plate is enough for a family of four-five. Would absolutely recommend

The food is very simplistic. However, if you're craving basic Italian food then this place is definitely your jam! The pasta and garlic bread were pretty good but not amazing. I didn't like how they don't have menus and instead there is a giant menu on the wall...bad day for me to forget my glasses. The service is very fast so not to worry about that and the servers are very nice.

This place is so good !! Everything from the drinks to the food everything is excellent 
Kyle our server Made our experience here way better all his recommendations were spot on 
Thank you Kyle keep up your good costumer service

I, for one, am a huge fan of Italian food. More often than not, I will find that I like the food that I am having. Carmine's, however, is much more than just a good tasting pasta. The decor of the restaurant make it feels as if you are in a genuine Italian restaurant. It almost makes you feel at home. The food is truly stupendous. I find that I enjoy their spaghetti much more than I like my family's own. Although they have great food, they also have great prices. If you are eating with someone else, it would be in your best interest to split an entree with them. The portions at this place are huge, they almost look like party platters. Realistically, it isn't so expensive the cost is split amongst two people, but you can only get one thing. If you get two, you will find that there is an exuberant amount of leftovers, almost an overwhelming amount and the bill will be pricy as well. If you and your date can agree upon one thing, I would recommend this place, but if you wish to order different things, this might not be the place for you.

We took our hungry family to Carmine's late on Sunday evening.  What made the dinner excellent was the outstanding service we received from Frank, the tall waiter from New York City.  He helped us with recommendations and genuinely cared that everything went well.  Frank made us feel like VIPs.  The assistant servers were on-point too.  The manager dropped by to make sure we were OK and the hostess was personable. We had the Rigatoni Country Style and Chicken Parmesan.  With our family of 4, we had leftovers too.  We are glad we chose Carmine's at the Forum.
Huge portions of great food, 10/10 would recommend. We came into town and when my wife found out there was a Carmine's, she told me what had to go. Had the chicken parm and it was fantastic.

We had a group of eight and it was perfect. Got the mixed greens salad, meatballs, chicken Marsala, penne with vodka sauce, and a pasta with bolognese meat sauce. We finished everything off and loved it all. Had great service and enjoyed the atmosphere, too!

Had dinner there last night and very impressed!  Food was amazing but word from the wise, portions are Extremely large! My wife and I went together and even requesting half orders were more then two can eat. It's primary focus is family style and large groups.  That said I'll be going back no matter what!  Caesar salad was one of the best ever and the pasta was simply perfect.  
They said if you eat at the bar you can get a menu more designed for two people.

Horrible experience. Groups SHOULD NOT COME HERE! We were in Vegas from out of town. Made reservations for a large group, celebrating my aunts bday. I've never been to a restaurant that doesn't have food menus but had drink menus instead?! 

To order our food, we had to take a picture of the menu board on my phone. Then go back to the table to order. Most plates on the menu averaged between $20-$30 which I was ok with since the servings were big. I normally ask waiters for suggestions at new places. The waiter, (not friendly) tall Hispanic guy with black glasses, suggested a seafood plate bc it was great (according to him). I took his word for it. At the time of the bill, that dish was $70!!!!!!! After reviewing the "menu board" I had taken a picture of on my phone, that dish was not on the menu!! What was supposed to be a nice dinner turned out to be a horrible one instead. I felt mislead by the waiter. Why would he suggest something that wasn't on the menu or even mention the price? If I had had a menu on my hands like you would at most restaurants, I wouldn't have ordered that dish. I felt he was trying to add to the bill to increase his tip percentage. Not only that, but the seafood made me sick with food poisoning. 

I will never recommend this place to anyone. I did tell all my close friends about the bad experience I had and now I'm sharing it on yelp to warn others who plan to have group dinners here. Worst experience, bad food and I didn't appreciate getting screwed over by the waiter. They need to have menus like all other restaurants do. Only reason I'm giving them one star, is simply bc I have to.

Cut one star for the huge sizes. Have you seen any reviews without the word huge? Food is so good and if you cannot take leftovers you really feel guilty to leave behind such a good quality and taste, not to mention the waste. 

We were two people and warned in advance to chose the same meal. Meat balls we still talk about how tasty they were. Salad is also fresh and can feed a table of 6-8 easily. 

Why not some consideration for smaller portions?

Came here for dinner last night with my family for my husbands birthday . Usually service is great and I leave impressed . Unfortunately a football game was on while we were dining. So we didn't get the usual attention . Our order was wrong and while we asked for food to be packed our servers response was " that doesn't travel well" well we are actually local so we have a fridge at home . The icing on the cake was when the server asked if we wanted dessert . We said no thank you to which he responded with " we have a birthday dessert for you " with that being said who turns down free dessert . $329 later that dessert was $30 . Which I probably would have not gotten being my husband prefers the strawberry shortcake . Lesson learned Carmine's , to not come in with football is playing because then your employees would have to work . Thanks to our server for making sure we would probably go to Rao's spend the extra money but it would be worth it .

Went here for a birthday celebration. We had a private dining room which was awesome. It was at the back of the restaurant very secluded. Our waitress was good. She made sure we had drinks and that our plates were cleared in a timely manner. It was a set menu and the portions were huge but it's known for being a family style type of place. The dessert was absolutely amazing and the presentation was beautiful. Carmine's made the birthday very special. Thank you!
Sabrina was absolutely amazing! She catered to everything we asked for plus more! All the food was very good. Large portions so make sure you bring a group! Definitely recommend this place!

Came here one night for dinner with friends and my husband. I really love how it was very convenient and inside of the forum shops in the Caesars Palace and how generous their portions were. I myself am not a very big eater but we had a party of 7 and even had a little food to take home. The menu was a giant menu on their wall which was super cool since it was my first time ever seeing that in a restaurant. I thought that the prices were fair for the amount served. We chose 5 dishes all together and the food was good. Some dishes I didn't enjoy as much but other dishes I wanted to keep eating. We ordered the Caesar salad to start, spicy scarpariello wings, penned alla vodka, shrimp scampi, and the carbonara. My favorite was the carbonara and the wings!
